loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Dedewanou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DEDEWANOU est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même maison au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Laliatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Laliatou est âgée de 64 ans et est une veuve. Laliatou a deux enfants, dont un est à sa charge. Aucun des enfants n'est scolarisé. Laliatou n'est également pas scolarisé. Laliatou vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les différentes charges. Pour y parvenir, Laliatou mène comme activité la vente de produits divers dans son quartier. Laliatou s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Laliatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DEDEWANOU, un premier crédit.
texts.en: The Dedewanou group is made up of three people who live in the same house in Benin. It is the first time that this group has requested financial help from Alidé and they are doing this in order to increase their business volume. The representative of the group, who is called Laliatou, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Laliatou is 64 years old and a widow. She has two children, one of whom she is responsible for. Neither of the children has been to school. Laliatou has not been educated either. She lives alone with her children and bears the various expenses herself. In order to do this, she has an actitivy selling various products in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her turnover, Laliatou is requesting a first loan together with the other members of the Dedewanou group.

loans.use: to buy various products and cassava flour

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, vive con su hija de 27 de años, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas, todos los días realiza las ventas, en el mercado municipal, por las noches hace tortillas.
Este negocio le permite obtener los ingresos para sus necesidades, ella quiere hacer unos cambios en su puesto de venta, para ello invertirá en compra arena y cemento, pues su objetivo es tener un lugar mejor establecido, donde los clientes estén más cómodos y satisfechos con el servicio.
El sueño de Mercedes es algún día comprarse su propia casa.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives with her 27-year-old daughter. She sells tortillas and “pupusas”. Mercedes sells her products every day at the municipal market. At night she makes tortillas.

This business has allowed her to generate income to pay for her necessities. Mercedes wants to make a few changes to her vending stall, so she will invest in the purchase of sand and cement with the intent of having a better established location so that her customers will be more comfortable and satisfied with her service.

Mercedes dreams of someday having her own home.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement for remodeling the premises of her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación, el grupo se encuentra en el 4º ciclo, con 10 miembros. Todas ellas unieron con el propósito de generar más ingresos para sus familias, desean abrirse camino y desarrollarse no solo en lo económico, sino también a nivel personal.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Señora Elodia, ella tiene 3 hijos, es casada, su marido es Empleado de una Metalúrgica. Ella es artesana hace varios años, confecciona y vende sus artesanías en forma ambulante por su barrio y también por el centro de la ciudad de Encarnación. Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijas tengan una carrera universitaria y se conviertan en grandes profesionales. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales y accesorios para la elaboración de la artesanía y  volver a vender a sus clientes. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito, ya que este le servirá para procurar mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
This group was started after one of its members contacted Fundación Paraguaya. It is now in its fourth loan cycle with 10 members. All of these women joined together with the goal of generating more income for their families, as well as developing on a financial and personal level.

One of the group members is Sra. Elodia. She is married and has three children. Her husband is employed at a metal shop. Elodia has worked as an artisan for many years, making and selling handicrafts as a street vendor in her neighborhood. She also sells in the central part of the city of Encarnación. One of her dreams is for her daughters to earn a university degree so that they can become successful professionals.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials and accessories for making handicrafts that she can sell to her customers. Elodia is very hopeful that with her loan she can secure better conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials and accessories for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es: Maria Yolanda tiene 38 años de edad, es una persona amigable y trabajadora, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la ganaderia, tiene dos niños y dos niñas y todos ellos se dedican a estudiar, su residencia esta ubicada en el Barrio La Cruz en el municipio de Patuca. Maria se dedica a la venta de saldo para celulares y a la venta de golosinas, ella inició sus negocios cuando su esposo vivia en Estados Unidos y le enviaba remesas pero el dinero que recibia no era suficiente para cubrir los gastos de ella y sus hijos, asi que decidió que debia buscar una forma de ganarse la vida. Luego de un tiempo la concurrencia de personas que iban a su casa a comprar recargas era bastante y se quedaban platicando allí, asi que se le ocurrió la idea de colocar una venta de golosinas. Maria le da muchas gracias a Dios porque le esta llendo muy bien con sus negocios y eso le permite ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de los niños. El préstamo que María está solicitando lo necesita para comprar variedad de carnes, yuca, maseca y una gran variedad de verduras, tambien para comprar recargas de saldo. Por los momentos ni su familia ni su negocio presentan problemas de ningun tipo. Con el apoyo de este prestamo sus negocios seguiran activos y su familia contará con una fuente de ingresos. Maria tiene dos ciclos en FAMA y a realizado sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
Maria Yolanda, age 38, is a friendly and hardworking individual. She is married and her husband is a livestock breeder. They have two sons and two daughters, all of whom are attending school. Her home is located in the neighborhood of La Cruz in the town of Patuca. Maria sells mobile phone credits and sweets. She started her businesses when her husband was living in the United States. He would send remittances, but the money she received was not enough to cover the expenses for herself and her children. Therefore, she decided to find a way to earn a livelihood. After she started selling mobile phone credits, Maria noticed that people would be talking and then linger around her premises. This is when she came up with the idea of also opening a stand for selling sweets.

Maria gives plenty of thanks to God because she is doing very well in her businesses. This has allowed her to help her husband with the expenses related to their home and their children. The loan that Maria is requesting will be used to buy a variety of meats, cassava, cornmeal, and variety of vegetables. She will also buy mobile phone credits. At the moment, neither her family nor her businesses are experiencing any problems. With the support of this loan, her businesses will remain active and her family will have a source of income.

Maria has participated in two loan cycles with FAMA and has completed her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone credits and ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Santos Valerio

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su esposa, él es empleado de una joyería, por las tardes su esposa se dedica a la venta de pupusas, las cuales vende en su vivienda, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, con la intención de tener más ingresos para su hogar.
Él solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en chicharrón, quesillo, aceite, y más mercadería que es necesaria para la producción de las pupusas.
Juntos se dedican cada día a dar lo mejor en el trabajo y negocio, pues de las ventas se ven beneficiados los dos.
texts.en:
Santos lives with his wife. He is employed at a jewelry store, but his wife sells “pupusas” from their home in the afternoons. She started this business on her own with the intention of generating more income for their household.

Santos is requesting a loan to invest in pork, cheese, oil, and other necessary supplies for making pupusas. He and his wife devote each day to doing the best in their work. The sales from her business have been beneficial to both of them.

loans.use: to buy pork, cheese, oil, and other necessary supplies for his wife's business.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Cristo Rey Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Cristo Rey, se conformó por  diez integrantes con la presidenta que es Amparo Del Socorro, ella se dedica a la venta de cerdos y cuajada. Tiene más de 15 años en su negocio, sus 4 hijos que tiene bajo su cargo han hecho de ella una mujer muy luchadora. Es por eso que solicita este crédito con sus amigos para la compra de cerdos y cuajada, es un excelente grupo, el cual gracias al trabajo realizado continúan trabajando. Ella está muy feliz con su trabajo, ya que le encanta. Su trabajo le genera buenos ingresos, con lo cual puede cubrir sus gastos.  Juntos esperan con este crédito ampliar sus negocios cada día más.
texts.en: Communal bank Christ King is made up of 10 members and president Amparo Del Socorro. She has been selling pigs and curd for more than 15 years and had four children under her care who have taught her become a hardworking woman. That is why she is requesting the loan with her friends and buy pigs and curd. This is an excellent group whose dedication has allowed it to continue working. She is very happy with her job since she loves it. Her job generates lots of profits with which she can cover costs. Together with this loan they wish to grow their businesses more everyday.

loans.use: buy pigs and curd.

loans.name: Marcos German

texts.es: El sr. Marcos casado tiene dos hijos ya jóvenes uno de 15 y una de 20  que se encuentran estudiando,  el es taxista trabaja de lunes a sábado de 6:00 a 23:00, su esposa se dedica a la venta de zapatos es vendedora ambulante de esta manera aporta con los gastos del hogar,  Viven en anticrético ya hace bastante tiempo en la zona de Sarco, el préstamo lo destinaran para la refacción y mantenimiento de su movilidad. El sr. Trabaja con su vehículo el cual presta servicio de taxi libre, también tiene contratos para llevar a niños a la escuela,  realiza el transporte en la zona central de Cochabamba como también en las zonas peri urbanas, es una persona muy trabajadora su deseo es tener su propia casa y el de ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en: Sr. Marcos is married and has two children who are already youths, a son who is 15 and a daughter who is 20. They are both in school. He is a taxi driver. He works Monday through Saturday from 6 am to 11 pm. His wife sells shoes. She is a roving vendor and in this way contributes to the household expenses. They have lived in an anticretico (a Bolivian housing system in which the renter makes a loan to the landlord at the beginning of the rental period) in the Sarco zone for some time. The loan will be used for the repair and maintenance of his vehicle. He uses his vehicle for work, offering service as an independent taxi, and he also has contracts to take children to school. He works in the central zone of Cochabamba as well as in the peri-urban zones. He is a hard-working person. His dream is to have his own house and to see his children have careers.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Maria Felipa

texts.es:
María, vive junto a sus cuatro hijos, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, las realiza en su vivienda dos veces al días, sus clientes son vecinos del lugar, quienes le encargan diariamente la cantidad que van a comprarle, este negocio es su fuente de ingresos, y es como logra comprar los alimentos para sus hijos.
Ella comprara maíz y leña, con el préstamo, estos materiales son muy necesarios para la producción de las tortillas, ya que al comprarlos por mayor cantidad obtiene mejor precio; Las aspiraciones de María es poder apoyar a sus hijos en la educación, que puedan encontrar un buen trabajo para que puedan independizarse.
texts.en:
María lives with her four children. She sells tortillas and makes them in her home twice a day. Her customers are her neighbors. They order the quantity of food that they will buy each day. The business is her source of income. This business allows her to be able to purchase food for her children.

She will buy corn and firewood with the loan. These materials are very necessary for the production of tortillas. Buying them in wholesale quantities lets her purchase them at better price. María’s dream is to help her children with their education, so that they can find good jobs and become independent.

loans.use: purchase corn and fire wood to make pupusas and tortillas.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La  Señora Aurelia es madre soltera, tiene dos  hijos, ambos en edad escolar. Ella  tiene un pequeño copetín (establecimiento D. comida rápida) en Ciudad del Este, cuya venta cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso. Ella es una microempresaria exitosa con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad y buen trato con las demás personas.
Ella comenta que se levanta a muy tempranas horas del día para elaborar los alimentos que va a vender en su copetín, dice que es un trabajo duro, que requiere D. mucho sacrificio, pero cuenta que todo lo que hace es con mucho amor para sus hijos, ya que ellos se merecen todo el sacrificio que ella hace por ellos. Lucha por un futuro mejor para sus hijos, para que ellos no tengan que pasar por las mismas necesidades que ella.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D. los insumos que ella necesita para la elaboración D. sus alimentos, como ser pollo, carne vacuna, panes, condimentos y demás. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito, pues D. obtenerlo le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sra. Aurelia is a single mother with two school-age children. She has a small fast food establishment in Ciudad del Este. Her sales have been increasing and she is able to generate a good income. Aurelia is a successful micro-entrepreneur who has a large and loyal customer base as a result of providing good and friendly service.

She says that she wakes up very early to prepare the dishes that she sells in her fast food establishment. Aurelia notes that her work is hard and requires great sacrifice, but she does everything with a lot of love for her children since they deserve all the sacrifices she has maD. for them. She is determined to proviD. a better future for her children so that they do not have to forego the same necessities that she lacked when she was their age.

Aurelia is requesting a loan to buy the necessary supplies for preparing her dishes such as chicken, beef, bread, condiments, and other items. She is hopeful that the loan she will receive will be of great help.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, beef, bread, condiments, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La señora Yolanda  es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora, es madre soltera  tiene 1 hijo pequeño, actualmente se encuentra viviendo en alquiler en el mercado de la zona al Sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la cliente tiene como actividad principal la venta de verduras en un mercado céntrico de la ciudad,  hace 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad, el destino del crédito lo invertirá en el reintegro aumentar para la compra de una caseta en el mercado donde ella vende, indica que este crédito le ayudara a anular el pago de alquiler del puesto  y con ello podrá realizar su actividad con mas disponibilidad y obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en: Yolanda is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is single mother of one young son. At present, she lives in a rental by the market on the south side of the city of Cochabamba. Her main activity is selling vegetables in the central market in town. She has done this activity for 6 years. The loan will be used to buy a stall in the market where she sells. She indicates that this loan will make it so she can stop paying rent for her stall and thus be more available and make more income.

loans.use: to buy a market stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Urpis  De  Confraternidad Group

texts.es:
(En la fotografía la socia Esther está levantando la mano). 

La señora Esther nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y  tiene 50 años de edad. Actualmente, Esther vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Esther es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable que saca adelante a sus tres hijos, Esther se dedica a la venta de comestibles en su pequeña tienda que está ubicado en su domicilio en el populoso distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco. La pueden encontrar de lunes a viernes en su negocio. Esther los días sábados vende comida en el mercado ferial del baratillo de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Esther requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo bolsas de azúcar y bolsas de arroz. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Urpis  de  Confraternidad” son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. El banco comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los demás socios se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como por ejemplo venta de comestibles, venta de comida, venta de productos de ferretería, venta de ropa y venta de jugos. 
 
Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
(In the photo, Esther is the one raising her hand).

Mrs. Esther was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and she is 50. Currently, she lives in the same city in which she was born and where she now works. Esther is a hard-working, enterprising and responsible mother, who is getting her children ahead. Esther sells food in her small store located in her home in the highly populated district of Santiago, Cusco. She can be found in her business from Monday to Friday. On Saturdays, Esther sells food at the flea market in Cusco. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Now, Esther needs this loan to purchase merchandise such as bags of sugar and bags of rice.

The members of the "Urpis de Confraternidad" communal bank meet every thirty days in Cusco city. The communal bank is made up of people who are hard-working and enterprising, who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and to offer a better future to their children through their daily efforts. The other members have various businesses such as, for example, selling groceries, selling food, selling hardware products, selling clothing, and selling juice.

Cusco is known for being a very touristy place, as well as being a commercial area. It is known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta, and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as bags of sugar and bags of rice

loans.name: Cristina Berenisse

texts.es:
Cristina es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con su familia, administra una farmacia, lleva dos años trabajado para la farmacia, y actualmente necesita cancelar una deuda, con el préstamo podrá quedar solvente y pagar menos intereses.
Este es un gasto personal, pero que le ayudara muchísimo en sus finanzas, pues esta deuda la obtuvo su madre comprando materiales para una panadería que administra, su objetivo es ayudarla e iniciar un historial con esta institución.
texts.en:
Cristina is single, has no children, and lives with her family. She runs a pharmacy. She has worked for the pharmacy for two years, and currently needs to cancel a debt. With this loan she will be able to remain solvent and pay less interest.
This is a personal cost, but it will help her greatly with her finances. Her mother acquired this debt in purchasing materials for a bakery that she runs. Cristina's goal is to help her mother and start a history with this institution.

loans.use: to pay off a payment on materials for her mother's bakery.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VALLECITO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la señora Guadalupe; la socia es casada y tiene 40 años de edad, la socia tiene 2 hijas de 22, 19 años de edad; la socia trabaja haciendo movilidad escolar, la socia tiene una combi y lleva a los niños a sus respectivos colegios, la socia paralelamente a su trabajo y sin interferir en ello, realiza manualidades y chocolatería, la socia es independiente por lo que ella misma administra su tiempo y sus horarios para realizar diversas actividades para la venta, la socia en cuanto a la chocolatería  tiene una fuente en la cual con unas brochetas de fruta baña o cubre con la pasta liquida de chocolate y en segundos esta es compacta, la socia esta siempre tras de las fiestas infantiles para ofrecer su trabajo en chocolatería, ella se relaciona mucho con los colegios para contactar a los padres que festejaran los cumpleaños de sus hijos; en esta ocasión la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de forros para los asientos de la movilidad escolar y con la otra parte la socia desea invertir en el negocio de la chocolatería, ella comprara palitos para hacer brochetas de frutas. La socia  solicita el préstamo en la compra de forros para cubrir los asientos de su movilidad y brochetas de palos para las frutas y otros.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “VALLECITO” communal bank; the bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Guadalupe; she is married and 40. She has 2 daughters ages 19 and 22. She works in school transportation; she has a Combi van and takes children to their respective schools. On top of this work, and without interfering with it, she also makes handicrafts and chocolates. She is independent since she manages her own time and her own schedule of diverse sales activities. As for the chocolate making, she has a fountain in which she bathes fruit on skewers or covers the fruit with liquid chocolate paste. This fountain is compact, so she is always going to children's parties to provide this chocolate service. She has many good contacts with schools in order to contact parents about to celebrate their children's birthdays. Now, she wants to invest this loan in the purchase of covers for the seats of her school transportation vehicle. She wants to invest the other part in her chocolate business. She will purchase small sticks for making fruit skewers. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of covers for the seats of her vehicle and for wooden skewers for the fruit and other items.

She is grateful for the support that we are providing and she promises to repay the quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase covers for the seats of her vehicle, and wooden skewers for the fruits and other items.

loans.name: Hugo Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo es un artesano, que realiza rompecabezas de venesta con motivos infantiles, los comercializa al por mayor, realiza sus entregas sobre todo el la feria de la tablada donde ya tiene clientes que le hacen su pedido cada semana, también en algunas ocasiones viaja a la ciudad de Oruro y Cochabamba (esta empezando a relaizar viajes al interior de pais) el Sr.  Hugo vive solo, hace tiempo se separo de su esposa y tiene una hija a la cual no puede ver por motivos de tiempo, actualmente vive en anticrético, con su hermana y su sobrina, el utilizara el crédito para la compra de una maquina caladora y cortadora  que optimizara su trabajo, ya que actualmente realiza su trabajo con de forma manual con una sierra metálica. Su sueño más grande es darle lo mejor a su hija  ya que es por quien trabaja.
texts.en: Hugo is an artisan who makes jigsaw puzzles for children out of laminated wood. He sells them wholesale, making his deliveries above all at the La Tablada fair, where he already has clients who order from him each week. He also travels occasionally to the cities of Oruro and Cochabamba (he is starting to make trips to the interior of the country). Hugo lives alone; he has been separated from his wife for some time and has a daughter he can't see due to time constraints. Currently, he lives in anticresis (an arrangement in Bolivia where a fixed sum is paid at the start of tenancy instead of monthly rent) with his sister and his niece. He will use the loan to purchase a router that will optimize his work, since currently he does the work manually with a metal knife. His biggest dream is to give the best to his daughter, since she is the one he is working for.

loans.use: to purchase a router

loans.name: Jose Bernardo

texts.es:
José, es soltero, vive solo alquilando una vivienda, ahí a instalado una tienda donde ofrece a los vecinos productos domésticos, lleva ya tres años en el negocio, la atiende de 6:00am a 7:00pm, está ubicado cerca de un centro escolar donde su mayoría de estudiantes son clientes.
El invertirá un préstamo en jugos, gaseosa, galletas, boquitas, dulces, arroz, frijoles, aceite, toda esta mercadería para abastecer el inventario del negocio y teniéndolo más surtido, así será la afluencia de clientes.
El quiere crecer en la tienda, algún día a través de sus ganancias poderse comprar un terreno para construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
José is single. He lives alone, renting a house where he has set up a store where he offers household products to the neighbors. He has been in this business for three years. He tends the business from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm. It is located near a school center where the majority of the students are customers.

He will invest the loan in juices, soft drinks, crackers, snacks, sweets, rice, beans, and oil. All this merchandise is to stock the inventory of the business so that it will be better supplied and increase the flow of customers.

He wants to increase his business and someday, through his earnings, be able to buy land to construct his own house.

loans.use: to buy juices, soft drinks, crackers, snacks, sweets, rice, beans, and oil.

loans.name: Villa Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal “VILLA SANTA ROSA” es un grupo unido que está conformado por 11 mujeres la cual realizan diversas actividades comerciales siendo  Jhoselyn  unas D. las socias activas. 
Jhoselyn  es una joven estudiante D. enfermería, tiene  20 años D. edad, donD. en la actualidad vive con sus padres la cual la apoyan en sus estudios, ella nos cuenta que  se  dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza  donD.  lleva más D. 01 año dedicándose a dicha actividad, trabajo que le ha permitido cubrir algunos gastos D.  su instituto como en pasajes para asistir a sus prácticas ya que nos manifiesta que le falta muy poco para que termine D. estudiar. El deseo D.   Jhoselyn  es D. seguir estudiando y posteriormente instalar una farmacia en su domicilio. Con el crédito solicitado piensa invertir en sus productos comprando talcos, colonias, cremas y otros productos en oferta. La Alcancía Comunal “VILLA SANTA ROSA” agradecen a los prestamistas KIVA. La señora Jenny no pudo estar presente por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The Communal Savings Bank  “VILLA SANTA ROSA”  is a group maD. up of 11 women who have diverse businesses. 

Jhoselyn  is an active member of this group.  She is a 20-year old nursing student who currently lives with her parents, who are supporting her while she is in school.  She has been selling beauty products for more than a year.  Her business has enabled her to cover some of her school expenses such as transportation to her practical training. She is very close to completing her degree. 

Jhoselyn would like to continue her education and eventually set up a pharmacy in her home.  She will use this loan to purchase products such as powders, colognes and creams to sell.  The communal savings bank “VILLA SANTA ROSA” thanks KIVA lenders.  One of the group members, Jenny, does not appear in the picture because she had to work.

loans.use: to purchase colognes, powders, and creams.

loans.name: Edis Alberto

texts.es:
Edis, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y un hijo, él se dedica a la siembra de maíz y pipián, lleva ocho años haciendo este cultivo, y de las cosechas comparte uno para vender y otro para el consumo familiar.
Por el momento está realizando el cultivo de maíz y pipián, para ello necesita comprarse abono y herbicidas para tratar las plagas, estos insumos son muy necesarios para que se pueda desarrollar bien el cultivo y que produzca abundantes frutos, ya que benefician a su familia.
texts.en:
Edis is a farmer. He lives with his wife and son. He plants corn and squash. He has been planting these crops for eight years, and he sells part of the harvest and keeps the rest for his family's consumption.

Right now he is cultivating corn and squash. For this he needs to buy fertilizer and herbicides to treat the pests. These ingredients are very necessary so that his crops can develop well and produce an abundant harvest, since they will benefit his family.

loans.use: to buy feritlizer and herbicides for his corn and squash crops

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La Señora Pabla tiene 41 años D. edad, está casada con el Señor José D. 46 años D. edad, ellos llevan 22 años D. casados y tienen la dicha D. tener 7 hijos.
La Señora Pabla  es comerciante, cuenta con una despensa en su domicilio y su esposo cuenta con un automóvil en la cual se dedica a la venta ambulante D. prendas D. vestir, calzados, artículos D. mercería por zonas aledañas, ellos se dedican a esto hace 15 años.
Dicha actividad lo emprendieron con mucho sacrificio con un pequeño ahorro que contaban y fueron prosperando ya que desean darle una vida digna a sus hijos, y que ellos no pasen por las mismas necesidades por la que atravesaron sus padres.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. comestibles, panificados, alimentos no perecederos y demás para abastecer su local comercial, sabe que esto le servirá para atraer a más clientes. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Sra. Pabla is 41 years old. She has been married to Sr. José, age 46, for 22 years. They have seven children.

Sra. Pabla is a merchant and operates a food pantry out of her home. Her husband has an automobile that he uses for his job as a traveling vendor. He sells clothing, shoes, and sewing supplies in the surrounding areas. They have worked in this manner for 15 years.

Pabla started her business with great sacrifice, using the small amount of savings that she had. She was able to prosper because she wanted to proviD. a decent life for her children. Pabla is able to offer them the necessities that she lacked when she was their age.

She is requesting a loan to buy food products, baked goods, nonperishable goods, and other items to restock her store. Pabla knows that this will help her attract more customers. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy food products, baked goods, nonperishable goods, and other items.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El sr. Alejandro esta renovando su crédito, es su segunda secuencia vive en casa familiar en la casa de su hijo en la zona de pacata baja junto a su esposa que es ama de casa,  su principal actividad del Sr. Alejandro es la construcción como contratista el se dedica a la actividad de la construcción desde muy joven, es su principal fuente de ingreso tiene dos hijos que ya no dependen de el, pero un o si trabaja con el,  saco el crédito para comprar mas herramientas para construcción ya que las que tiene ya están muy gastadas, y esto no le permite realizar un buen trabajo, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sr. Alejandro is renewing his loan. This is his second loan cycle. He lives with his wife, who is a housewife, in his son's home in the Pacata Baja zone.  Sr. Alejandro's principal business is construction. He works as a contractor. He has been doing construction since he was very young. It is his principal source of income. He has two children, who no longer depend on him, but one works with him. He is taking out the loan to buy more construction tools, since the ones he has are already quite worn out, and they do not allow him to do good work. He is a very hard-working person and is thankful to the institution (Emprender) for the support offered to him.

loans.use: to buy construction tools

loans.name: Joaquin Alonso

texts.es:
Joaquín, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos, su familia es de agricultores, dedicándose al cultivo de maíz, maicillo y frijol, Joaquín tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse al cultivo, realizándolo de 6:00am a 2:00pm, lo aprendió de su padre.
Actualmente invertirá en la compra de abono y pago de jornaleros, que con el préstamo espera cubrir el gasto, ayudándole a solventar la necesidad y que esto contribuya para tener un buen cultivo y al final una buena cosecha. Los sueños de Joaquín es ayudar a completar los estudios de sus hermanos, dándoles la oportunidad de superarse, y con sus padres pues con la cosecha les ayuda a tener ingresos y alimentación.
texts.en: Joaquiín is single and lives with his parents and siblings. His family is farmers. They grow corn, millet and beans. Joaquín has been a farmer for the past ten years. He works from 6:00am until 2:00pm. He learned how to farm from his father. He would like to buy fertilizer and pay his farm workers. With this loan he hopes to cover his expenses, provide for his necessities and thereby have a good crop and, ultimately, a good harvest. His dreams are to help his siblings finish their education. A good education will help them to succeed. With this harvest, he can help his parents have an income and food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay his farmworkers.

loans.name: Geroncio De Jesus

texts.es:
el sr. Geroncio de Jesus vive en el barrio El Centro de la ciudad de Choluteca, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos, Geroncio tiene un negocio de Barberia el cual tiene varios años de tenerlo, la ubicacion de su negocio es favorable ya que muchas personas transitan por ese lugar y aprovechan a cortarse el pelo, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de tijeras, cremas, jabones, crema rasuradora, lociones, talcos y otros implementos para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
su meta a corto plazo es remodelar su negocio y hacerlo mas atractivo para sus clientes.
Geroncio nos comento que el quiere lo mejor para sus hijos y que desea preparalos profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Sr. Geroncio de Jesus lives in the neighborhood of El Centro in the city of Choluteca. He is married and has three children. Geroncio has managed a barber shop for several years. His business is located in a favorable area where many people pass by and take the time to get a haircut.

This loan will be used to buy scissors, creams, soaps, shaving cream, lotions, powders, and other supplies so that he can provide good service to his customers. His short-term goal is to remodel his business and make it more attractive for his customers.

Geroncio says that he wants the best for his children and hopes to prepare them professionally.

loans.use: to buy scissors, creams, soaps, shaving cream, lotions, powders, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: La señora Ruth, es madre soltera, tiene una hija, por quien trabaja duro ya quien le quiere brindar un futuro mejor,  vive en San José en el municipio la guardia,  a 25 km. De la ciudad de Santa Cruz. Vive en la casa de su madre la Sra. Clementina quien cuida a su nieta, mientras su hija a vender sus productos, su actividad económica es la venta de pollo y queso en el mercado central desde hace un año. El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería (compra de carne de pollo,  embutidos y quesos) es cliente nueva y agradece por la confianza que depositan en ella.
texts.en: Señora Ruth is a single mother. She has a daughter, for whom she works hard and to whom she wants to offer a better future. She lives in San José, in the town of La Guardia, 25 km from the city of Santa Cruz. She lives in the house of her mother, Sra. Clementina, who cares for her granddaughter while her daughter sells her products. Ruth's business is the sale of chicken and cheese in the central market. She has had this business for a year. The purpose of the loan is the purchase of merchandise (chicken meat, sausages, and cheese). She is a new loan client and is grateful for the confidence that is shown in her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (chicken, sausagaes, and cheeses)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an order of tires.

loans.name: Estela Emerita

texts.es:
la sra. Estela Emerita esta casada, tiene dos hijos y viven en el barrio el Centro de la ciudad de Choluteca, Estela se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos para la venta de su ropa. su negocio esta ubicado en las afueras del mercado de Choluteca, sus clientes son personas que vienen de lugares fuera de la ciudad a realizar sus compras.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y asi satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
su sueño es poder tener un puesto mas grande para tener mas variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Sra. Estela Emerita is married and has two children. She lives in the neighborhood of El Centro in the city of Choluteca.

Estela sells new clothing and has the help of her children with making sales. Her business is located outside of the market in Choluteca. Her customers are people who come from places outside of the city to make their purchases.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers. Her dream is to have a larger vending post so that she can have a wider variety of products.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, and undergarments for women and men.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making "pupusas", as well as sodas and nonperishable goods for her store.

loans.name: Fauto

texts.es:
el sr. Fauto esta casado y tiene 3 hijos, su familia y el viven en el Coroso, namasigue. Fauto se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, tiene la ayuda de su esposa cuando el no esta en la casa, sus clientes son los vecinos de la comunidad y otras personas que viven cerca a ese caserio.
el credito lo invertira en compra de abarroteria.
Fauto tiene planes de llegar a tener un mini super en un futuro.
texts.en:
Sr. Fauto is married and has three children. He and his family live in Coroso, Namasigue. Fauto sells popular consumer products and has a store located in his home. His wife helps out whenever he is not around. His customers include neighbors from the community and other people who live near his village.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of grocery products. Fauto has plans to open a mini-supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Zainab M.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in the eastern city of Kenema. They have applied for a loan of 12,400,000 SLL from SMT, a partner of KIVA, based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to buy goods or invest in something that their mere salaries alone cannot let them do.  At the end of each month, their school’s bursar deducts the repayment from their salaries and pays KIVA on these teachers’ behalf.

Zainab is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Pujenhun 50 years ago, Zainab is married and has 6 children, one of whom is in college.  The rest are no longer attending school. Zainab has requested this loan in order to invest it in a business.  She will buy local produce in large amounts for resale.

loans.use: to buy local produce for resale

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
This is 25 year-old Dauda.  He is single, and has one child, aged 2.  In 2006, Dauda established his Kola nut business. He began his business just to realize his dream of independence.  It is his only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  Dauda needs a loan in order to buy kola nuts and empty bags. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  In the future, Dauda plans to export more kola nuts to Mali, and to generate enough funds to further his education.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy kola nut and empty bags

loans.name: Maria Pilar

texts.es: María tiene 57 años D. edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos independientes, María junto a su conyugue se dedican a la siembra y venta D. tuna llevando el ejemplo D. sus padres que también se dedicaba a dicha actividad la cual  lleva más D. 25 años en ese rubro, este actividad comenzó ya que contaban con un terreno y con los conocimientos que tenían iniciaron su negocio, también nos manifiesta que cuenta con un pequeño local donD. venD. todo tipo D. comidas, gracias a su trabajo María ha logrado que sus hijos sean profesionales y D.  construir su vivienda, María asegura  sentirse con todas las fuerzas suficientes para seguir trabajando positivamente. Con el dinero solicitado María va a  aportar para la compra D. un carro donD. brinD. servicio D. transporte, generando así un  ingreso mas para su hogar. María está muy agradecida con el Programa-Prosperidad.
texts.en: Mary is 57 years old, married, with two adult children who live on their own. Mary, along with her husband, works growing and selling cactus. She follows in her parent’s footsteps, as they did this business for more than 25 years. This business starts with the land and with the knowledge tht they have about growing cactus. They also have a small place where they sell all types of food. Thanks to her hardwork, Mary’s children have become professionals and she has been able to build a house. Mary feels that she has all of the energy needed to continue working hard. With the money that she is requesting, Mary would like to buy a car so that she can proviD. a transportation service, thereby earning more income for her household. Mary is very grateful for the “Prosperity Program”.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Mohamed.  He is married, and has 3 children, aged 9, 3 and 2 years. He has an additional dependent who lives with him because he is his sales agent.  In 2009, Mohamed established his provisions and "Top up" business. He began his business because he believed it to be a possible way to earn money and support his family.  Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  He needs this loan in order to buy milk, sardines, luncheon meat and Top up (mobile phone) cards. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.  In the future, Mohamed plans to own a bigger shop, to establish a branch at Ahmadiya junction, and to build a house for his family.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy milk, sardines, luncheon meat and Top up cards

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo 1,  2  & 4 Group

texts.en:
MatilD. is the coordinator of her group Mata D. Palma, (Palm tree) named thus because the group is located in the city of Hato Mayor, in the eastern part of the country, a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture. MatiilD. lives in a simple structure with her three children and husband. She says that her most difficult challenges are helping her children to achieve a good education and a safe living and having a successful cheese factory.

MatilD. has had her business for approximately seven years, maD. possible by her first loan from Esperanza. She is excited about her 13th loan, which she plans to invest in her business by purchasing milk, calcium, plastic bags, salt, coloring, etc. The loan will enable her to increase her cheese production and serve more customers. MatilD. sells the cheese she produces to families, grocery stores, cafeterias, etc. She will save her increased profits to make her dream of owning a successful cheese factory come true.

The other group members are dedicated to selling clothes, food, shoes, cosmetics and jewelry. MatilD. thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy milk, calcium, plastic bags, salt, coloring, etc. for her cheese production.

loans.name: Osman's Group

texts.en:
Osman is the leader of this group of borrowers from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. These borrowers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,000,000 SLL for each in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. This group of salaried workers will repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. Their finance officer is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT/Kiva on their behalf. 

The 31-year-old Osman is married to a banker and the couple has two children attending primary school. Born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone, Osman has had three years of experience in the civil service. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his junior sisters.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his junior sisters.

loans.name: La Chorrera Group

texts.es:
el grupo La Chorrera esta ubicado en el caserio la Chorrera de El Triunfo, Choluteca, esta integrado por dos mujeres y un hombre, todos tienen varios años de conocerse y trabajan juntos para salir adelante con sus familias.
doña Tereza que es la cordinadora del grupo se dedica a la venta de utencilios fabricados de plastico, Teresa cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposo para ayudarle a vender sus productos.
su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el caserio la Chorrera en su casa de habitacion y sus clientes son personas del mismo lugar en donde vive.
el credito lo invertira para la compra de utencilios de plastico y asi surtir mas su negocio y tener mas variedad de productos.
el sueño de Teresa es poder tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
La Chorrera Group is located in the small town of La Chorrera de El Triunfo, Choluteca, and is made up of two women and one man. They have known each other for several years and work together so their families can get ahead.
Teresa, who is the group coordinator, sells plastic utensils. Her children and her husband help her sell her products.
Her business is located in the small town of La Chorrera in her home, and her customers are people who live in her town.
She will invest the loan to buy plastic utensils so that she can better supply her business and have a greater variety of products.
Teresa’s dream is to be able to have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy plastic plates, cups, serving bowls, buckets, and water jugs.

loans.name: Mata De Palma 3 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is one of the members from the group Mata D. Palma 3 & 5, (Palm tree) named like this because this is the community where the group is located in Hato Mayor city, in the eastern part of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture. 

Carmen is a mother of four children and they live together with her and their father. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to have her business at all. In the past it was very difficult, because she did not have enough money to start one up, but after she found Esperanza and took out her loans, she was able (like other members in this group) to open her business.  

Carmen is excited about her 12th loan with Esperanza. After almost six years with her business, she has expanded her little butcher shop into a bigger one, with more quantity of meats to supply more clients. With this loan she will increase her inventory and make even bigger sales. She will use the profits to invest in her butcher shop. She is planning to make some changes in the structure. 

She dreams of having a nice house and a successful business with employees. Carmen and her group thank all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different sorts of meat (pork, beef, chicken).

loans.name: Juan Valerio

texts.es:
El Señor Julian es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 52 años de edad, está casado con la Señora Nimia con 40 años de edad. Del matrimonio tienen 3 hijos todos en edad escolar.
Él se define como un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor, no tiene miedo a ningún desafío ni trabajo, pues desde pequeño el empezó a trabajar. Comenta que todos los días empieza su jornada laboral desde muy tempranas horas para atender su negocio, ya que siempre tiene clientes desde muy temprano. Él tiene una despensa en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada gracias a la amabilidad y buena predisposición con que atiende a los clientes. Comenta que su negocio le genera buenos ingresos por lo que le gustaría seguir invirtiendo en el.
Él solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos, lácteos, panificados, y otros para el abastecimiento de su local. De obtener el crédito este le será de gran ayuda. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Sr. Julian is from the city of Santaní.  He is 52 years old and married to Sra. Nimia, age 40.  They have three children, all of whom are of school age.

He defines himself as a hardworking and enterprising man.  He is not afraid of any challenge or of hard work.  He says that he wakes up early every day to attend to his business.  He manages a food pantry in his home and has an established customer base thanks to the friendliness he demonstrates to them.  He says that his business generates good income, so he would like to continue investing in it.  

He is requesting a loan to buy food products, dairy products, baked goods, and other items to restock his store.  Obtaining this loan will be a great help.  He thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to him.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, milk products, and bread products to stock his store

loans.name: Ya Alimamy

texts.en:
This is 56-year-old Ya Alimamy.  She is married and has 3 children aged 25, 28 and 20 years.  In 2008, Ya Alimamy established her biscuits, provisions, drinks, and bread business. She began her business because she never went to school and her parents chose that she would become a business woman to help her support her family. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Ya Alimamy requires a loan in order to buy more provisions such as sardines, margarine, biscuits, bread and soft drinks for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. 

In the future, Ya Alimamy plans to save enough money in order that "my children will be able to care for me during my old age without being a problem for them."   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions such as sardines, margarine, biscuits, bread and soft drinks.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel tiene 43 años de edad, está casado con la señora Geronima de 36 años de edad, ellos tienen su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de Santaní.
Es propietario de una discoteca, con todos los insumos necesarios para el mismo. Comenta que la discoteca le genera muy buenos ingresos, en especial los fines de semana ya que muchas personas están libres en esos días y salen a divertirse. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por el bienestar de familia, es por eso que nunca se cansa de trabajar.
Cuenta que mucha gente, de una gran variedad de edades asiste a su discoteca, tiene un ambiente agradable y muy confortable. Desea poder seguir creciendo e invirtiendo en dicho negocio. Como antecedente dentro de la Fundación tiene cinco créditos, con un excelente cumplimiento.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de instrumentos musicales para equipar su discoteca, con lo cual podrá formar un buen atractivo para atraer a más clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que una vez más esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Sr. Manuel is 43 years old and married to Sra. Geronima, age 36. They have their own home in the city of Santaní.

Manuel is the owner of a discotheque and has all the necessary equipment for his business. He says that the discotheque generates a very good income, especially on the weekends when many people have free time and want to have fun. Manuel says that everything he does is for the welfare of his family, which is why he never gets tired of working.

There are many people of different ages who come to his discotheque since it offers a pleasing and comfortable atmosphere. Manuel wants to continue growing and investing in this business. He has built up an excellent repayment history with Fundación Paraguaya by taking out five loans.

The loan he is now requesting will be used to purchase musical instruments for his discotheque so that he can make it more attractive so as to draw in more customers. Manuel is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to him once again.

loans.use: to purchase musical instruments for his discotheque.

loans.name: Estela Marys

texts.es:
La señora Estela tiene 42 años D. edad, es casada, vive en la ciudad D. Villarrica, tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales 4 están casadas ya y se independizaron, ella junto con su esposo viven es su casa propia.
Ella se dedica al al bordado en lienzo y ao po'i con este trabajo ella pueD. ayudar a su esposo quien es quinielero (vendedor D. juegos D. azar) y maestro D. obras, para poder educar y alimentar a sus hijos y hacerlos estudiar. Ella comenta que sus bordados son muy solicitados, ya que el bordado en ao po'i es muy querido, en especial por los turistas. Comenta que ella lucha diariamente por el sustento D. su familia, le gusta sentir que su trabajo ayuda a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas, que luego ella y por medio D. su creatividad ira perfeccionando, así también para la compra D. hilos y agujas necesarios para los bordados que ella hace. Agradece a la Fundación, la confianza depositada en ella. Está con mucha esperanza en el crédito, pues D. obtenerlo le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Estela is 42 years old, married and lives in the city of Villa Rrica. She has 6 children, of which 4 are married and live on their own. She and her husband live in their own home. Her business is embroidering cloth and ao po’i (fine embroidered cotton fabric typical of the area), and with this work she can help her husband who is a “quinielero” (vender of games of chance) and foreman, to be able to educate and feed their children and make them study.  She comments that her embroidery is much in demand, since embroidered ao po’i is cherished, especially by the tourists.  She says she fights daily to proviD. for her family. She likes to feel that her work helps her family.
She is requesting the loan to buy cloth that later she will perfect by means of her creativity, and also to buy the threads and needles necessary for the embroidery that she makes.  She is thankful to the Foundation and the confidence it has in her. She is very hopeful about the loan, since obtaining it will be of much help.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread and needles for embroidery.

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.es:
La señora Delfina tiene 52 años D. edad, es comerciante, tiene una despensa en su domicilio, tiene un hijo varón D. 16 años D. edad, el cual siempre la ayuda en el negocio cuando ella lo necesita.
Delfina con mucho esfuerzo cubre todos los gastos familiares, empezó ahorrando D. la ganancia D. la venta D. huevos, queso, leche, ya que posee animales D. granja. Su negocio va creciendo día a día, las mercaderías que más venD. son productos D. primera necesidad como, leche, carne, panificados, fideos, arroz, carbón entre otros. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes ya que la mayoría D. sus vecinos siempre se acercan a su local a comprar D. ella. Dice que el motivo D. su trabajo es crear un mayor bienestar para su hijo y sus familiares, ya que ellos son quienes la inspiran el día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecer su negocio con la compra D. leche, carne, azúcar, fideo y otros artículos D. primera necesidad. Agradece a Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo que esta le da y comenta que uno D. sus mayores anhelos es D. que su hijo sea un gran profesional, con este trabajo ella pueD. seguir ayudando a que su hijo estudie y pueda cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Mrs Delfina is 52 years old. She is a storekeeper and has a small store in her house. She has a 16 year old son who always helps her out with the business whenever necessary.

Delfina painstakingly covers all the family's living expenses. She started by saving from the profits she maD. from the sale of eggs, cheese and milk, from the farm animals she owns. Her business is growing day by day. The best selling goods are staples such as milk, meat, baked goods, noodles, rice and coal amongst others. She says that she has a lot of clients as most of her neighbours come to buy from her. She says that what motivates her to work is the welfare of her son and relatives since they are the ones who inspire her every day.

She is asking for a loan in order to supply her business with milk, meat, sugar, noodles and other staple items. She thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the support they give her and says that one of her greatest desires is to see her son become a great professional. With this business, she can continue helping her son to study and so fulfill her dream.

loans.use: to buy meat, milk, noodles, rice, sugar and the like with which to stock her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a businesswoman running a grocery store in the city of Hato Mayor. This is a rural area where agricultural activities are common. She has had her business for around 4 years, this will be her 8th loan with Esperanza Internacional. After successfully repaying her previous loans, she is able to receive another one and will invest it all in her business.

She is dedicated to selling groceries, candies, snacks, and meal ingredients (rice, beans, meat, canned food, and vegetables) as well as many other goods in her little Colmado (small grocery store in the neighborhood). Rosa will use this loan to expand her business inventory by purchasing all these goods. 

Rosa lives with her long-term partner and her child. She said her most difficult challenge is to take care of her family. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Sergio tiene 27 años de edad,  el socio es casado; el socio tiene 2 hijos, el socio trabaja taxista interprovincial, el socio tiene su unidad vehicular y traslada pasajeros desde el poblado de Urcos hasta Ocongate, el socio en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo, el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo en el cambio de aceite y otros para ponerlo operativo para que siga transitando bien.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “The Triumphant Beautiful Mary” Bank that is located in the Ocongate District in the Quispicanchis Province in the Department of Cusco.
The member, named Sergio, is 27 years old. He is married with two children. He works as a taxi driver who drives between provinces. He has one vehicle and he transports passengers from the city of Urcos to Ocongate. This member would like this loan in order to maintain his vehicle. He would spend the money on oil changes and other necessities needed to keep his car operating and able to run well.
This member is thankful for the support of this loan and promises to pay his payments on time.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle by paying for oil changes and other necessities needed to keep his vehicle in working order so he can continue transporting his customers.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Claudio tiene 34 años de edad,  el socio es conviviente; el socio tiene 1 hijo, el socio trabaja como albañil y también se dedica  paralelamente a la crianza de ganado, el socio engorda ganados el tiene vacas, toros entre sus animales el socio se encarga de criarlos, cuidarlos, engordarlos, les da sus alimentos y proteínas y los hace reproducir y los vende. El socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un toro. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un toro.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to the communal bank "Las Triunfadoras de Bella Maria." The bank is located in the Ocongate district, in the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco.

Claudio is 34 years old. He lives with his partner and he has one son. He works as a bricklayer and at the same time raises animals and fattens them to sell. Among his animals, he has cows and bulls. He is in charge of raising them, caring for them, and fattening them. He gives them their food and proteins, breeds them, and sells them. He needs a loan to invest in the purchase of a bull.

He is grateful for the support that is offered to him and promises to make his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a bull

loans.name: Rodrigo Sebastian

texts.es:
El Joven Rodrigo tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene aun hijos y vive en la ciudad de Villarrica. Cuenta con un Taller de Tapizados, donde fabrica y repara sofás, Asientos para Automóviles y Butacas para Cotillón. Este  taller lo heredó de su padre que aún con su larga edad, sigue apoyando y supervisando los trabajos terminados, para que posteriormente sean comercializados o entregados a los clientes.
El se define como un joven muy trabajador y emprendedor, tiene muchas ansias y proyectos, le gusta su oficio y quiere seguir aprendiendo cada día más y más. Agradece a su padre por todo el apoyo que este le da, ya que el es un gran apoyo para Rodrigo. Quiere, algún día poder tener un local grande donde ofrecer todos los muebles que tapiza. Rodrigo sueña formar una familia y con este pequeño negocio poder solventar los gastos y traspasar esta profesión a sus hijos.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de cueros y cuerínas que son los elementos esenciales para su trabajo. Agradece a la Fundación por la gran oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Mr. Rodrigo is 33 years, single, and does not have any children yet. He lives in the city of Villarrica. He has an apholstery shop where he makes and repairs sofas, car seats, and armchairs for Cotillón. He inherited this shop from his father who in spite of his old age continues working on and improving the finished works. They are then sold or returned to the clients. 
He describes himself as hardworking and enterprising. He has a lot of drive and projects. He enjoys his job and wants to learn more and more everyday. He thanks his dad for all the support he gives him since it is a great support for him. One day he would like to have a large enough shop to offer all of the furniture he upholsters. Rodrigo dreams of forming a family and with this small business to pay off costs and pass on this job to his children. 
He is requesting this loan to buy leather and imitation leather which an essential material for his job. He is thankful for the great opportunity this foundation is offering.

loans.use: buy leather and imitation leather for his shop.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Yolanda tiene 37 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 5 hijos, la socia trabaja en agricultura y ganadería, la socia se dedica ahora al engorde de ganados y comercialización de productos secos. La socia  es una mujer muy trabajadora y ella todo el año está trabajando y variando sus actividades principales según la época del año, la socia está sembrando productos de maíz blanco y amarillo, también compra y vende ganados y animales pequeños, ella en esta ocasión esta criando y engordando animales vacunos y también está con su negocio de compra y venta de productos secos, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra y venta de productos secos y en la alimentación balanceada de minerales que les dará a sus ganados vacunos. La socia solicita el préstamo para el alimento de sus animales vacunos y para la compra de productos secos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Yolanda belongs to "Las Triunfadoras de Bella Maria" community bank in the district of Ocongate, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco, Peru. She is 37 years old, married and has five children. She works in agriculture and livestock, and right now makes a living raising cattle and selling dry goods. Yolanda is very hard-working and does it throughout the year, varying her principal activities depending on season. She is planting white and yellow corn as well as buying and selling cattle and smaller animals. At this time she is raising and fattening cattle and is working with her business buying and selling dry goods. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of dry goods and balanced feed to give to her cattle. She is grateful for the support and promises to be disciplined in making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle and to purchase dry goods.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Petrona 50 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 1 hijo, la socia trabaja en agricultura y ganadería, la socia se dedica ahora al engorde de ganados y  ella está encargada de el cuidado, alimentación, vacunación, y a la venta de los mismos, La socia tiene 6 vacas y un toro y desea poder invertir el crédito en la compra de otro torito tierno para la crianza y reproducción de sus vacas, ella tiene un dinero ahorrado y desea completar su ahorro con el préstamo y cumplir con su deseo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un toro.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Petrona belongs to "Las Triunfadoras de Bella Maria" community bank in the district of Ocongate, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco, Peru. She is 50 years old, married and has one son. She works in agriculture and livestock, and right now makes a living raising cattle. She is in charge of the care, feeding, vaccination and eventual sale herself. She has six cows and a bull, and plans to invest the loan in the purchase of a young bull to raise and breed with her cows. She has money saved and coupled with the loan she will be able to fulfill her wish. Petrona is grateful for the support and promises to be disciplined in making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase a bull.

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Elizabet 22años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 2 hijos, la socia trabaja en agricultura y ganadería y crianza de animales menores como chanchos, cuyes, aves de corral; la socia  engorda a sus ganados para la venta de estos en cuando alcancen la época de vender, la socia también compra cuyes los cría y los vende, ella desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de una vaca y cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una vaca y 20 cuyes.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Elizabet belongs to "Las Triunfadoras de Bella Maria" community bank in the district of Ocongate, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco, Peru. She is 22 years old, married and has two children. She works in agriculture and livestock, raising small animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and poultry. She also raises cattle to sell when the time is right. She also buys guinea pigs to raise and then sell. She plans to use the loan to purchase a cow and 20 guinea pigs. She is grateful for the support and promises to be disciplined in making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and 20 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Kathya De La Cruz

texts.es: Kathya de 31 años de edad es soltera, labora para el MISA-SILAIS Juigalpa como Responsable de Contabilidad desde hace 9 años. Esta solicitando su 5to credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto ya que actualmente esta compartiendo el cuarto con su mamá, y en la casa habitan varios hermanos con su familia y desea contar con mayor privacidad, tanto para ella como para su madre.
texts.en:
Kathya, aged 31 is single.  She has been working for the Juigalpa Ministry of Health’s Comprehensive Local Health System (SILAIS) for the last nine years.

She is requesting her fifth loan with the objective of building a bedroom, as she currently is sharing a room with her mom because several of her siblings live at home with her family.  She would like to have more privacy, as much for her as for her mother.

loans.use: to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Agustina tiene 35 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 4 hijos, la socia se dedica ahora al engorde de ganados y comercialización de productos secos. La socia  es una mujer muy trabajadora y ella todo el año está trabajando y variando sus actividades principales según la época del año, la socia está sembrando productos de maíz blanco y amarillo, también compra y vende ganados y animales pequeños, ella en esta ocasión esta criando y engordando animales vacunos y también está con su negocio de compra y venta de productos secos, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra y venta de productos secos y en la alimentación balanceada de minerales que les dará a sus ganados vacunos. La socia solicita el préstamo para el alimento de sus animales vacunos y para la compra de productos secos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “The Triumphant Beautiful Mary” Bank that is located in the Ocongate District in the Quispicanchis Province in the Department of Cusco.
This member, named Agustina, is 35 years old. She is married with four children. She currently works raising cattle and selling dried food products. She is a hardworking woman and works all year, but varies her work depending on the season. She grows white and yellow corn and also buys and sells cattle and small animals. Right now she is raising and fattening up vicuñas and also is working in a business buying and selling dried food. This member would like this loan in order to buy dried food and also to buy a balanced diet to feed her vicuñas. She is asking for this loan in order to buy vicuña food and more dried food products. She is thankful for this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for her animal food and to buy dried food.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Nieves tiene 43 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos, la socia se dedica  al engorde de ganados y venta de leche de vaca fresca.  La socia  produce leche de vaca,  ella tiene ganados vacunos y sus vacas son lecheras, la socia lleva a vender la leche en sus respectivos embases ella distribuye a algunos pobladores en diferentes puntos y otras veces lleva al poblado de Urcos y  también a la ciudad del Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras de Bella Maria” which is located in the District of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 43 years old, married, and has four children. Nieves earns her livelihood by fattening cattle and selling fresh cow’s milk. Her job is that of a milk producer, but she owns beef cattle in addition to dairy cows. Nieves sells the milk in containers and distributes it to a few residents in different villages. On other occasions, she takes the milk to the town of Urcos or to the city of Cusco. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a dairy cow.

Nieves is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Jesusa tiene 41 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos, la socia se dedica  al engorde de ganados y a la producción de leche, la socia esta más en el negocio de la venta de leche fresca de vaca.  La socia  produce leche de vaca mediante sus ganados vacunos, ella tiene ganados vacunos en números de 6 vacas, no es mucho pero ella dice que le ayuda a salir adelante y desea mejorar con el tiempo su economía, la socia tiene vacas  lecheras, la socia lleva a vender la leche a las diferentes ferias y a sus clientes frecuentes. La socia deseas invertir el préstamo en la compra de una vaca para de este modo incrementar sus ventas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera. 

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Jesusa is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras de Bella Maria” which is located in the District of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 41 years old, married, and has four children. Jesusa earns her livelihood by fattening cattle and producing milk. Most of her income comes from selling fresh milk. Jesusa has six cows that produce milk, which is not many but she says it helps her to stay ahead. In the future, she wants to improve her financial situation. Jesusa takes the milk produced by her existing cows to different fairs or delivers it to her frequent customers. She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of another dairy cow so that she can increase her sales, which is why she is requesting these funds.

Jesusa is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Claudia tiene 27 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica  la compra, crianza y venta final de animales menores como aves de corral, chanchos, cuyes al por mayor, ella compra estos animalitos, los cuida, engorda y reproduce y cuando han alcanzado su madurez la socia los vende según los pedido y la demanda que se tenga en diversas fechas del año. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales como cuyes en un total de 50 y aves menores pollos para la crianza y la continuación del ciclo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra y venta de animales menores.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras de Bella Maria” which is located in the District of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 27 years old, married, and has two children. Claudia buys, raises, and sells small animals such as poultry, pigs, and guinea pigs in large quantities. She buys these animals and then takes care of them, fattens them, and breeds them. Once the animals have matured, Claudia sells them by request or on demand at different times of the year. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of animals, including 50 guinea pigs and young chickens to raise so that she can continue the breeding cycle. The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase and sale of these animals.

Claudia is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and young chickens.

loans.name: Gonzalina

texts.es:
la sra. Gonzalina tiene 40 años de edad, vive en unión libre y a procreado 2 hijos y viven en la colonia Eben Ezer.
