texts.es: Francisco, de 52 años, es un hombre alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Paulina y 2 de sus 7 hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos y a los que cuidan en la comunidad nativa de Alianza. Se siente feliz por todo lo obtenido hasta el momento, sus hijos y sus nietos son su razón de vida y trabajo. La actividad a la que se dedica es el cultivo de plátano, café y cítricos. Las extensas tierras que posee, lo han convertido en uno de los principales productores de la zona. Sus productos los lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de La Merced, donde ya tiene compradores esperándolo, ya que sus cultivos son de muy buena calidad y en tiempos de buena cosecha los mismo comerciantes lo visitan, ya que sabe de su buen trabajo. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho empeño, lleva 28 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. En el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción y así continuar con el trabajo que lo apasiona, la agricultura. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Alianza al progreso” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y para eso ya está empezando a ahorrar. Además agradece al apoyo brindado. Francisco de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de plantitas de café y plátanos para comenzar a renovar sus plantaciones, además de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos posteriormente.
texts.en:
Francisco, 52, is a cheerful man living in his own house with his wife, Paulina, and two of his seven children who are the motivating force behind all his efforts and who he cares for in the indigenous community of Alianza.  He feels happy about everything he’s accomplished to date; his children and grandchildren are his reason to live and work.

The activity he’s involved in is growing bananas, coffee and citrus fruit.  The extensive fields he owns have turned him into one of the area's main producers.  He takes his products all the way to the city of La Merced to sell where he already has buyers waiting for him because his crops are very good quality.  During times of good harvests the merchants actually come to visit him because they know about his good work.

What he most enjoys is planting his fields; something he’s done with much dedication.  He’s been in this line of work for 28 years and considers the most difficult part protecting his plants from infestations that can affect them.  In the future, he’d like to buy new lands to expand production and continue with the work that he’s so passionate about: agriculture.

He belongs to the “Alianza al Progreso” (Alianza toward Progress) communal bank and this is the second MFP loan where he’s willing to make his installment payments punctually; he’s already started to save up to do so.  In addition, he gives thanks for the support provided.  If Francisco were to receive your support, he’ll use the requested money to buy coffee and banana seedlings to renew his plantations as well as to buy natural fertilizer to spread among them later on.

loans.use: to buy coffee and banana plants as well as fertilizer.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 41 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Arnaldo, con quien convive desde hace 11 años, cuidando a 4 de sus 5 hijos en la comunidad nativa de Alianza (selva central peruana). Los días de Teresa se centran en el cultivo de la tierra, con los años y esfuerzo a logrado comprarse sus propios terrenos de cultivo y ahora es una de las principales productoras de plátano, café, palta, maíz y achiote de la provincia de Chanchamayo, lugar hasta donde llegan sus compradores para obtener sus cultivos, pues son muy buenos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar con peón en diferentes terrenos de cultivo, pues necesita adquirir dinero para poder mejorar sus cultivos. Ahora con el paso del tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción, sabe que lo logrará, pues es una mujer trabajadora y hábil. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Alianza al progreso” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde está segura de poder pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que los integrantes de su banco comunal le enseñaron a ser responsable. Teresa de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos, además de 2 mil plantitas de café.
texts.en:
Teresa is 41 years old.  She is a simple, hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Arnaldo with whom she has been living for the last 11  years.  They are still caring for 4 of their 5 children in the indigenous community of Alianza (central Peruvian jungle).  Teresa's days are focused on cultivating her land.    She was able to buy this land with years of hard work and now she is one of the main producers of bananas, coffee, avocado, corn, and achiote [annatto] in the province of Chanchamayo.  Buyers come to her to buy because her crops are very good.   What she likes most about her job is caring for her plants which she does with great affection.  She has been doing this for 21 years and she considers the most difficult thing about her job  to be working with laborers in different fields with different crops.  For this reason she needs money so she can improve her crops.  Now, over time, she wants to buy new land so she can increase her production.  She knows that she will be able to achieve this as she is a hard-working, capable woman.  

She belongs to the communal bank "Alianza al progreso" and this is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is certain that she will be able to make all of her payments on time since the members of her communal bank have taught her to be responsible.  Upon receiving her support Teresa will buy natural fertilizers to spread on her crops as well as 2 thousand coffee seedlings.

loans.use: purchase natural fertilizers and 2 thousand coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan produces and sells furniture. He needs some new instruments to increase the quality of furniture. With the help of this loan, Vardan will be able to meet his clients' demand, as well as attract new clients. He will increase his working capital and develop his business further. This means a brighter future for Vardan and his family. Vardan lives with his wife and small child.

loans.use: to pay for an instrument

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard works at the local school as a teacher. Unfortunately, a teacher's salary is too low to cover the family's daily costs. So Alvard also keeps livestock and cultivates land. 

Alvard would like to cultivate more land, as well as to develop farming. With the requested loan she plans to purchase garlic seeds and forage. With the help of this loan Alvard will develop her agriculture and increase her income. With increased income, Alvard will insure better living conditions for her family, as well as help her children and grandchildren, who live separately. Alvard lives together with her husband.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and forage.

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
Knarik is a tailor. She sews in a rented booth in the city market. Knarik would like to enlarge her business by opening one more booth. She needs a new sewing-machine for the future booth. 

With the requested loan Knarik plans to purchase a new sewing-machine. Opening a new booth, Knarik will develop her business and increase her income. This will help her to insure a better future for her family. Knarik lives together with her husband, mother-in-law, father-in-law and son.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing-machine.

loans.name: Seryozha

texts.en: Seryozha works in the sale and rental of wedding dresses and accessories, as well as organizing weddings. Seryozha would like to open a new booth and develop his business further. With the requested loan Seryozha plans to purchase new wedding dresses and clothing, as well as to rent another booth and expand his business. With the help of this loan he will increase his working capital, which is very important for him to start his own family in the future. Seryozha lives together with his parents and grandmother.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding dresses and accessories booth and buy additional inventory

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en: Ashot is engaged in farming. He needs some financial investments to purchase forage for the livestock. With the loan's help, Ashot will develop his agriculture and expand his business. Ashot will sell more agricultural products and increase his income. This means a brighter future for Ashot and his family.

loans.use: to pay for forage.

loans.name: Anaclet

texts.fr:
Anaclet est né au Rwanda. Il est marié et il a 5 enfants de 1an 3mois à 10 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans des études secondaires 
Anaclet est salarie. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter les matériels de construction il va acheter 20 sacs de ciment, 2 tours de camion de sabler, 20 triplex, 15 kgs des clous pour la réhabilitation de sa maison et payer la main d’œuvre.
Dans les prochaines années, Anaclet voudrait avoir d’autres ses propres maisons. Avec les profits il voudrait améliore le bien être de sa famille et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Anaclet was born in Rwanda. He is married with five children ranging in age from 15 months to 10 years old. Two of them attend school. Anaclet completed four years of secondary school.

Anaclet is an employee. This is his first loan cycle with ACB, and he will use the credit to purchase building materials including 20 bags of cement, two truckloads of sand, 20 triplex cables and 15 kg of nails to renovate his house. He will also pay for the required labor. 

Over the next few years, Anaclet would like to own more houses. He plans to use the profits to improve his family’s wellbeing and provide for his children’s tuition.

loans.use: to buy the building materials needed to renovate his house, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Jean Christophe

texts.fr:
Jean Christophe est né au Rwanda, il a 35ans. Il est marié et il a 3 enfants de 2 à 5 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Il a fait 6 ans des études secondaires.
 
Jean Christophe est propriétaire de restaurant et il fait aussi un petit commerce de quincaillerie. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter les matériels pour renouveler son restaurant (ciments, tube 30/30, tôles métallique et payer la main d’œuvre).
 
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est minimiser le prix. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Christophe voudrait renforcer son business de quincaillerie et  être le distributeur des matériels de construction. Avec les profits il voudrait améliorer le bien être de sa famille et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Christophe was born in Rwanda. He is married and has three children, from 2 to 5 years old. Four of the children are in school. He completed 6 years of secondary school.   

Jean Christophe runs a restaurant and also sells hardware store products. This loan cycle is his first one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy supplies (cement, 30/30 tubes, sheet metal) for renovating his restaurant and for covering the cost of labor. His strategy for the growth of his business is to minimize prices. 

In the next few years, Jean Christophe would like to be a major merchant in his region and to be the distributor of construction supplies. With the profits, he would like to improve the well-being of his family and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies (cement, 30/30 tubes, sheet metal) and to pay for labor

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr:
Michel  est né au Rwanda et a 54 ans. Il est marie et elle a 5enfants de 11 à 26 ans, dont 5 scolarisés. .Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans des études secondaires. Michel est salarie. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour payer le minerval de ses enfants.  
Son stratégie pour la croissance de son business est amenée ses enfants dans des écoles professionnelles pour avoir l’intelligence plus avancer. Dans les prochaines années, Michel voudrait être l’enseignant dans des différents universités du Rwanda, et pour sa famille il voudrait continuer é assure le bien être de sa famille et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Michel was born in Rwanda and is 54 years old. He is married and has 5 children from 11 to 26 years old, including 5 in school. His level of education is 6 years of high school. Michel is employed. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to pay for his children's school fees.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to bring his children to trade schools in order to have the most advanced intelligence. In the coming years, Michel would like to be a teacher in different universities of Rwanda, and, for his family, he would like to continue to ensure the well-being of his family and to educate his children.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Etienne

texts.fr:
Etienne  est né au Rwanda et a 48 ans. Il est marie et il a 6 enfants de 3 à 12 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. .Son niveau d’éducation est 2 ans poste primaire. Etienne est salarie. C’est son troisième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter du ciment, les fenêtres et des portes pour le finissage de sa maison de location en vue d’augmenter la valeur de sa maison pour avoir plus des revenues.  
Son stratégie pour la croissance de son business est réhabiliter sa maison pour avoir beaucoup plus les revenue. Dans les prochaines années, Etienne voudrait continuer à être pasteur et évangéliste, et améliore le bien être de sa famille et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Etienne was born in Rwanda and is 48 years old. He is married and has 6 children between the age of 3 and 12, of whom 4 attend school. His own education level is second year secondary school. Etienne is a salaried employee. This is his third loan from ACB, he will use his credit to purchase cement, windows, and doors to finish his house for rental in order to increase the value of his house to make more revenue.
His strategy to enhance his business is to renovate his house which will give him much more income. In the coming years, Etienne wishes to continue to work as pastor and evangelist, and improve his family’s well being and send his children to school.

loans.use: to puchase cement,windows and doors to finish his house for rental to increase its value and have more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 2 sets of 'simple' satin fabric, 4 sets of 'original' satin fabric, 20 sets of fabric for men's clothing, and 30 sets of fabric for women's clothing, and to pay for transportation (ticket) costs.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Aissatou est une vendeuse de "thiouraye" (encens), de parfum, de beurre de karité, de savon artisanale et de vêtements.Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants.Son revenu lui assure des revenus assez modestes qui lui permettent toutefois d' épauler son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille sur le plan alimentaire, de la santé et de l'alimentation. Elle sollicite un prêt de 50000F pour acheter 3 seaux de "thiouraye"(encens). Son ambition est d'implanter au marché central de sa localité une cantine de vente en gros de ses produits.
texts.en: Aissatou sells "thiouraye" (incense), perfume, shea butter, artisanal soap, and clothing. She is married and has six children. Her business provides her with an income that, though modest, nevertheless allows her to help her husband take care of the family's food and health needs. She is seeking a loan of 50,000 F to buy 3 buckets of "thiouraye" (incense). Her ambition is to set up a display at the central market in her local area to sell her products in bulk.

loans.use: To buy 3 buckets of "thiouraye" (incense).

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme très âgé.Il continue néanmoins à s'activer dans l'élevage pour aider ses enfants.Il a remboursé plusieurs prêts à l'UIMCEC.Il sollicite actuellement un prêt de 200000F pour acheter une vache et son veau.Il vendra la vache après six mois d'embouche et élèvera le veau qu'il vendra au bout de deux ans.Les bénéfices lui serviront à appuyer sa famille notamment ses quatre filles et ses cinq garçons. Son unique ambition est d'accompagner ses enfants jusqu'à ce qu'ils puissent se prendre eux même en charge.
texts.en: This borrower is an elderly man. He is still active in animal rearing in order to help his children. He has repaid several loans obtained through UIMCEC. He is currently seeking a loan of 200,000 F to buy a cow and its calf. He will sell the cow after six months of rearing and will raise the calf for sale after two years. The profit will serve to support his family, particularly his four daughters and five sons. His only ambition is to help his children reach the point where they can provide for themselves.

loans.use: To buy a cow and its calf.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune , membre d'une famille de 12 personnes.Il n'est pas marié et pratique le métier de carreleur avec lequel il gagne des marchés dans toute sa localité.Il arrive ainsi à entretenir la famille et même à employer des jeunes auxquels il apprend en même temps le métier.Afin de diversifier ses activités et d'augmenter ses revenus, il vient d'ouvrir une boutique pour la vente de téléphones portables et d’accessoires. Il sollicite ainsi un crédit de 50000F pour acheter des accessoires téléphoniques (kits oreillers, pochettes, batteries...).Les bénéfices tirés de son commerce lui permettent de mieux entretenir sa famille .Son ambition est d'acheter un véhicule pour faciliter ses déplacements professionnels.
texts.en: This borrower is a young man, part of a family of 12. He is not married and is a tiler by profession, which allows him access to all the markets in the area. He is thus able to support his family and also employ the younger members, whom he trains. In order to diversify his activities and increase his income, he has recently opened a store to sell mobile phones and accessories. He is thus seeking a loan of 50,000 F to buy phone accessories (headsets, cases, batteries, etc.) The profits from his business allow him to better support his family. His ambition is to buy a vehicle to facilitate his business trips.

loans.use: To buy phone accessories (headsets, cases, batteries, etc.)

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée mère de huit enfants dont un seul garçon.Elle a commencé il y'a dix ans un petit commerce de produits agricoles au bord de la route nationale avant de venir s'installer au nouveau marché central.Elle y vend des divers tissus et des parfums.Avec ce commerce, elle prend non seulement en charge ses besoins personnels mais arrive aussi à appuyer son mari dans l'entretien de la famille.Elle sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un prêt de 250000F pour acheter 5 caisses de parfum et des tissus afin de préparer les fêtes à venir. Son ambition est d'acheter un véhicule pour son fils qui est employé comme chauffeur  par un grand transporteur de la ville.
texts.en: This borrower is a married mother of eight children, of whom one is a boy. Ten years ago, she started a small retail business selling agricultural products on the side of the national highway before establishing herself at the central market, where she sells various fabrics and perfumes. With this business, she not only provides for herself, but is also able to support her husband in taking care of the family. She is seeking a loan of 250,000 F with UIMCEC to buy five crates of perfume and fabric in anticipation of the coming festivals. Her ambition is to buy a vehicle for her son, who is employed as a driver by one of the main carriers in the city.

loans.use: To buy five crates of perfume and fabric.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is a Rwandan rice farmer who is married and has six children. He has been a farmer for the past 10 years; he learned rice farming from a formal training program. 

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.use: To support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogne is a Rwandan rice farmer who is married and has one child who is four years old. He has been a farmer for the past eight years, having learned rice farming from his parents. 

He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and finally in harvesting activities. 

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is a rice farmer who is married and has five children. He has been a farmer for the past 20 years, having learned rice farming from formal training. 

He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and finally in harvesting activities. 

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune commerçant âgé de 25 ans qui tient une mercerie au marché central de sa ville depuis deux ans.Auparavant, il a pratiqué plusieurs petits métiers.Il a d'abord été vendeur d'eau et de crème glacée pour une femme à laquelle il versait chaque soir 2000f et gagnait lui même 1000f.Il s'est ensuite engagé comme manœuvre maçon avant de devenir marchand ambulant dans la capitale.Ne parvenant toujours pas à gagner assez de revenus pour participer à la prise en charge de sa famille notamment de sa mère et de ses six frères, il se rend chez son oncle qui tient une grande boutique de mercerie et devient son apprenti.Un an après, ce dernier l'aide à ouvrir sa propre boutique de mercerie au marché de sa localité. Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce,il sollicite actuellement un pret de 400000F auprès de l'UIMCEC afin d'acheter 30 douzaines de garnitures, 50 rouleaux de popeline, 5 couleurs de percale, 20 rouleaux de satin.La vente de ces produits lui rapportera des bénéfices assez substantiels pour la prise en charge de sa famille. Son ambition est d'acheter un terrain et d'y construire une maison.
texts.en: The borrower is a young merchant of 25 who has run a haberdashery in the central market of his town for 2 years. Previously, he had several jobs. Firstly he sold water and ice cream for a woman to whom he paid 2000f each evening and earned 1000f for himself. Next he became a masonry workman, and then he became an itinerant merchant in the capital. Still earning insufficient funds to participate in the upkeep of his family, particularly his mother, and his six brothers, he went to his uncle who owns a large haberdashery and became his apprentice. One year later, the latter helped him to open his own haberdashery shop in the market of his locality. To increase his stock, he is now requesting a loan of 400000F from the UIMCEC in order to purchase 30 dozen trimmings, 50 rolls of poplin, 5 colours of percale, and 20 rolls of satin. The sale of these products will bring in sufficient profits to support his family. His ambition is to buy a plot of land and build a house on it.

loans.use: to purchase 30 dozen trimmings,50 rolls of poplin,5 colours of percale,20 rolls of satin.

loans.name: Theophile

texts.en:
Theophile is a rice farmer and is engaged. He has been a farmer for the past 10 years, having learned rice farming through a formal training program. 

He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and finally in harvesting activities. 

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.name: Concilie

texts.en:
Concilie has been a rice farmer for the past 5 years. She is married, with 2 children, and she learned rice farming from a formal training program within her cooperative.

She will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est né dans une famille d'éleveurs nomades.Il s'est installé dans une grande ville depuis bientôt six et y pratique le commerce de bétail.Il achète en effet des chèvres et des moutons et les revend au marché hebdomadaire qui se tient chaque dimanche dans sa localité.Il a en plus constitué un petit troupeau de chèvres qui lui rapporte du lait améliorant ainsi l'alimentation de ses 4 enfants.Il cultive aussi de l'arachide, du mil et du haricots , destinés à la nourriture de la famille.Il est membre de l'UIMCEC qui lui a octroyé 6 prêts tous remboursés sans retards.Il sollicite un nouveau prêt de 100000F pour acheter 10 moutons qu'il revendra à l'approche de la fête de korité.Son ambition est d'acquérir un grand champs et des chevaux pour augmenter sa capacité d'exploitation agricole.
texts.en:
The borrower was born in a family of nomadic farmers. He settled in a large city almost six years ago, where he retails livestock. He indeed purchases goats and sheep and resells them on the weekly market held every Sunday in his locality.
In addition, he put together a small goat herd which provides him with milk, thus improving nutrition for his four children. He also grows groundnuts, millet and beans intended for the family's consumption. 
He is a member of UIMCEC, which granted him six loans, all of which were repaid promptly. He is requesting a new 100,000 XOF loan to purchase ten sheep which he will resell closer to the Eid-ul-Fitr holiday. His ambition is to purchase a large field and horses to increase his farming capacity.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep.

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is married, with no children yet. He has been carryng out this farming for the past six years. He learned this kind of farming from his cooperative.

He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

texts.en:
Elisee is a father of three children and he has been growing rice for the past 10 years. He was trained by his cooperative on how to grow rice.

He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.  With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.name: Boyambi Plus Group

texts.en:
Boyambi Plus is a Community Bank of 19 owners of small businesses, chaired by Charlotte. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI HOPE DR Congo to grow their businesses.

Charlotte, 53 years old, is divorced and sells plates, and carrots, and spices. She started her business in 2004. Today, Charlotte is happy to be one of Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC’s clients. 

She intends to use the next loan to purchase some more plates and carrots and spices to resell in order to reinforce her working capital. Currently, she earns a profit of $40 per week. Charlotte’s ambition is to open a store in her area. She is the mother of seven children whose ages vary between 16 and 31 years.  All of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase some plates and some carrots and spices to resell in order to reinforce her working capital

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 45 years old and widowed, with 3 children, ages 15 to 25.  She runs a local commodities store in Waterloo, a neighborhood in Freetown. She also has two children who are currently attending secondary school.

Aminata has owned this business for 15 years and sells rice, beans and palm oil at her market. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is price fluctuation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more local items. Aminata says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business more.

loans.use: To purchase more local commodities such as rice, beans and palm oil.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is a single man and very hardworking. He was trained on how to grow rice by his cooperative. He has done farming for the past two years.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 28 years old, married, and has one child, age one. She runs a general merchandise store in Waterloo near Freetown. She also takes care of one relative with her. 

Aminata has been in this business for seven years. She is a wholesaler who sells onions, flour, and rice at her store. She also receives income from her husband. She says that the main challenges to her business are problems of transportation and price fluctuation. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more food commodities. Aminata says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business in various branches.

loans.use: To purchase more onions, flour, and rice.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is the father of a two year-old child.  He has been doing rice farming for the past 9 years.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 38 years old and married, with 4 children between 5 and 21.  She runs a clothing store in Waterloo near Freetown.

Fatmata has owned this business for 5 years and sells lace, cotton, traditional patterned material her at store. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenge to her business is the transportation problem from Freetown to Waterloo.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase lace, cotton and traditional patterned material. Fatmata says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to be a supplier to other partners.

loans.use: To purchase more lace, cotton and traditional patterned material.

loans.name: Main Dans La Main Plus Group

texts.en:
Freddy, aged 38 and single, is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Main dans la Main Plus”, which is composed of 11 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Freddy runs a cellphone booth. He has been in business since 2007. He manages his cellphone booth in his area located mid-west of the city of Kinshasa. He is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC and has already received twelve different loans and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to buy some more prepaid cards to resell, with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of about US$40. 
His ambition is to open a general store.

loans.use: to purchase some more prepaid cards to resell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 37 years old and married with four children, aged between 4 and 18. She runs a spare parts store in Waterloo near Freetown. She also takes care of one relative as well as her immediately ones.

Kadiatu has owned this business for four years and sells engine oil, used tyres and spanners at her store.  Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more engine oil, used tyres and spanners. Kadiatu says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business more.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil, used tyres, and spanners.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 35 years old and married with 2 children, ages 12 and 18. She runs a spare parts store in Waterloo near Freetown. She also takes care of 2 relatives as well as her immediate family.

Kadiatu has owned this business for 5 years and sells engine oil, used tires and wrenches at her store. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of sufficient capital and inflation. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more engine oil, used tires and wrenches. Kadiatu says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to  have capital of 60,000,000 SLL.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil, used tires and wrenches.

He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
