loans.name: Gerania Group

texts.es:
El grupo Geranias lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Ana María, coordinadora del grupo. Ella se tiene una pulpería donde invierte mensual aproximadamente 43,000 córdobas en productos granos básicos, gaseosas, carne, chiverías, jabón, detergente…etc. 
Las otras dos integrantes son Marlene  y Suzana quienes venden frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya desde hace tiempo.
texts.en:
The “Geranias” group is made up of three hardworking, enterprising women.  One of them is Ana María, group Coordinator.  She has a grocery store where she invests approximately 43,000 córdobas monthly in basic grains, soft-drinks, meat, snacks, soap, detergent, etc.

The other two members are Marlene and Suzana who have been selling fruit and vegetables in Masaya’s market for some time.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidas lo conformado tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Luisa María  quien vende cosméticos y tiene una pequeña fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita en especial enchiladas. Ella con ela crédito comprar mercadería para sus dos negocios.
Las otras integrantes son Valeska quien comercializa cosméticos y ropa y Fernanada quien desde hace 15 años vende nacatamales.
texts.en:
The group “Unidas” (United Ones) is composed of three hardworking, enterprising persons.  One of them is María who sells cosmetics and has a small fast food restaurant selling fried food, especially enchiladas.  She’ll use the loan to buy merchandise for both businesses.

The other members are Valeska, who sells cosmetics and clothes, and Fernanda who has sold Nacatamales (Nicaraguan style tamales) for the last 15 years.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and enchilada making ingredients.

loans.name: Jose Servando

texts.es:
José, habita en la ciudad de León, de 50 años de edad, padre de tres hijos. El es un hombre multifacético pues el además de ser comerciante dueño de una pulpería, es también agricultor y albañil (trabaja en la construcción), muy a pesar de que su nivel académico es básico solo curso hasta el sexto grado de primaria, el sabido sobrevivir con lo poco que la vida le ha enseñado. A la edad de 20 años inicio en el mundo del comercio, también combinaba sus otros oficios, como trabajos de albañil que le salían por ocasión y trabajando como agricultor, el siempre ha buscado la manera de sobrevivir de otra forma pues el es un hombre que le gusta el trabajo. Hoy en día lleva 7 años con su pulpería que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación. 
Requiere el préstamo para compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, maíz, trigo, huevo, pollo y carne. Con esta inversión el podrá ofrecer y vender mas productos, y surtir su pulpería pues necesita mas productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. En lo futuro el desea ampliar su pulpería, acondicionar mejor la pulpería, comprar dos vitrinas, de vidrio, comprar 2 estantes de metal. También quiere sembrar 2 manzanas de frijoles, 2 manzanas de maíz.
texts.en:
José lives in the city of León.  He’s 50 years old and the father of three children.  He’s a multifaceted man because besides being a grocer he’s also a farmer and bricklayer (he works in construction) even though his educational level is quite basic having only finished sixth grade in elementary school.  He’s learned how to survive with what little life has taught him.

At the age of 20 he started in the world of commerce while combining his other occupations, like the bricklaying jobs that he’d occasionally get, and working as a farmer.  He’s always sought out other ways to survive because he’s a man who likes to work.  Today, he’s had his home-based grocery store for 7 years.

He needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, corn, wheat, eggs, chicken and meat.  With this investment he’ll be able to offer and sell more products and stock his grocery store because he needs more products to satisfy customer demand.  In future, he’d like to expand the grocery store, equip it better, to buy two glass display cases and two metal shelves.  He also wants to plant two manzanas (Central American unit of land measurement) of beans and two manzanas of corn.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 48 years old. She is divorced and has a 31-year-old daughter. Alice is living with three additional dependents who are relatives; they help her with her business. 

In 2003, Alice established a business selling plastic bowls, buckets, and dishes. Alice started this business because she wanted to get a means of livelihood for her family. Alice earns about 1,000,000 Leone (SLL) every month from this business. 

Alice has a very good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 5,000,000 SLL to buy more of the products she sells. She hopes that this loan will increase her monthly profit by 300,000 SLL. 

In the future Alice plans to open a big shop in the city center where she will be sure to get high sales. She also plans to educate her dependents to the level they wish to attain and build a house. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy plastic bowls, buckets, and dishes for her business

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
La señora Martha, de 61 años, originaria de Quezalguaque municipio de León, esta casada, madre de dos hijos, ella es comerciante, es dueña de una pequeña pulpería, lleva 20 años en el negocio. Inicio con esta actividad debido a la situación económica que vivía y la carencia de empleo, pues antes era profesor de escuela primaria, en ese entonces ella tenia 40 años sus hijos necesitaban apoyo de ella y su esposo para poder estudiar así que busco un manera inmediata para darle respuesta a sus necesidades y fue entonces que decidió poner una pulpería siendo este su primer negocio, el cual la dado buenos ingresos y le ha permitido sobrevivir de una manera justa y digna. 
Solicito el préstamo para comprar inventario como granos básicos, aceite, jabón, leche huevo, carnes, shampoo, pan, mantequilla. Con  esta inversión a su pulpería espera ofrecer mas productos de consumo masivo, satisfacer la demanda que tiene sus clientes, mejorar los ingresos y por consiguiente el nivel de vida de su familia. Ella desea convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea para ampliar más sus ventas y hacer más estable su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs Martha, 61 years old, originally from Quezalguaque municipality of León, is married and mother to two children.  She is a storekeeper and owns a small grocery store, which she has been doing for 20 years.  She started this business because of her financial situation at the time and the scarcity of jobs.  Previously she was a teacher of a primary school.  At that time, she was 40 years old and her children needed the support from her and her husband to be able to study.  She therefore looked for a quick solution to her problems and decided to open a small grocery store.  This was her first business, which has provided her with good income and allowed her to survive in a just and dignified way.
She requested the loan in order to be able to buy inventory such as basic grains, oil, soap, milk, eggs, meats, shampoo, bread, and butter.  With this investment she will be able to offer more products and satisfy the demand from her customers, improve her income and therefore improve the standard of living of her family.  She wants to convert her grocery store to a general store and increase her sales and make her business more stable.

loans.use: to purchase inventory such as basic grains, oil, soap, milk, eggs, meats, shampoo, bread, butter.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
La señora Alberta y su esposo el señor Telesforo son padres D. familia y tiene dos hijas adolescentes que están estudiando.
Solicitan un préstamo para poder pagar la inscripción y comprar los uniformes y útiles que son cuadernos, lápiz, plumas, colores y los libros, ya que en este momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para pagar esta necesidad escolar D. sus hijas. 
Desean que terminen sus estudios para que tengan un mejor futuro.
Doña Alberta se dedica al cuidado D. su familia, Don Telesforo es quien se encarga D. los D. los gastos, con el ingreso que obtiene D. su trabajo en una fábrica.
texts.en:
Sra. Alberta and her husband Sr. Telesforo are the parents of two teenage girls who are in school. They are requesting a loan to pay their tuition and to buy uniforms and school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, pens, markers, and books. At the moment, they do not have the necessary funds to pay for what their daughters need for school.

They hope to see them finish their studies so that they can have a better future. Doña Alberta takes care of the family while Don Telesforo looks after the expenses with the income he earns from his job at a factory.

loans.use: to pay for her children's tuition, school supplies, and uniforms.

loans.name: Iris Emili

texts.es: Emili   es  una  joven  emprendedora,  actualmente  elL.   vive   con sus  padres   y  los ayuda   económicamente   con los  gastos  D.   su  hogar, ellos  tienen  una  tienda  D.   abarrotes  que  le permite   obtener  ingresos  para  salir  adelante   día  con día,  es  por  ello  que  su mayor  sueño  es  contar con inventario D.  mercancía  disponible para   cuando  sus  clientes   acuden a su  negocio  puedan  encontrar   todos lo productos  que  ellos  desean,  ve  en el crédito L. posibilidad   D. hacer   crecer   su  negocio   y   poder  seguir  apoyando   a  su  familia, agradece  el apoyo para  L. realización D.  su proyecto.
texts.en:
Emili is an enterprising young woman who currently lives with her parents and helps them financially with the household expenses. She and her family have a grocery store, which allows them to generate income to move forward day after day. Her greatest wish is to have enough merchandise available for when her customers come into her store looking for all the products that they want.

Emili sees this loan as a possibility of making her business grow so that she can continue supporting her family. She is grateful for the support that has been provided so that she can complete this project.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
La señora Angelina tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de artículos escolares. 
A su negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía. Solicita su cooperación en este crédito que esta solicitando para invertir en comprar paquetes de cuadernos, lápices, plumas, carpetas, mochilas, hojas para las copiadoras y  biografías. 
Desea armar paquetes escolares para vender ya que cerca de su negocio esta un escuela y poder ofrecer a buen precio. 
Con este préstamo mejorar las ganancias e ingreso de su negocio, podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio pagara el crédito, ya que su esposo el señor Teodoro se encargara de las gastos familiares con las ganancias que el obtiene de sus ventas de tacos en diferente partes de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Sra. Angelina has been selling school supplies for more than three years. Her business is lacking a variety of merchandise. She is seeking assistance with this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of packages of notebooks, pencils, pens, folders, backpacks, and sheets of paper for photocopying and writing reports.

Angelina wants to assemble school kits to sell since her business is located near a school. She will offer these kits at a good price.

With this loan, Angelina hopes to improve the revenues and profits of her business. This will enable her to improve the quality of life of her family. With the revenue she generates, she will be able to repay the loan. Her husband Sr. Teodoro will take charge of the family expenses with the income he generates selling tacos in different parts of the city.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, pens, folders, backpacks, and sheets of paper.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Cesar es muy trabajador y   responsable,  día   con  día  se   esfuerza  por  sacar a delante a  su  familia   la  cual  es lo mas importante  en su  vida,  es por  ello   que  el desea   acondicionar  su  domicilio  y requiere  instalar  un  techo de  aluminio  en  el patio  de  su casa, ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de  ofrecer a   sus  familiares  y  amigos  una   mejor   estancia  cuando  los visitan   en su  domicilio, agradece el apoyo  brindado  para la realización de su proyecto.
texts.en:
Sr. Cesar is a hardworking and responsible gentleman. Day after day, he strives to succeed on behalf of his family because they are the more important people in his life. For this reason, he wants to complete his home by installing an aluminum roof over the patio of his house.

He sees this loan as the possibility of offering his relatives and friends a better place to stay whenever they visit his home. Cesar is grateful for the support that has been provided so that he can complete this project.

loans.use: to install an aluminum roof over his patio.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La señora María Luisa desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de tamales que ella misma prepara, de diferentes guisos como lo son de pollo, puerco y queso con rajas, que distribuye a sus vecinos y amistades a un precio accesible, los vende en paquetes de 12 y 6 tamales. María Luisa desea un crédito para comprar materia prima como la maseca, carne, pollo y demás ingredientes para la elaboración del producto ya que de esta forma podrá seguir con su venta y así generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. María Luisa has been preparing and selling tamales for 10 years. She prepares different types of tamales filled with chicken, pork, and slices of cheese. María Luisa sells her food to neighbors and friends at an affordable price and the tamales are sold in packets of either 6 or 12.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as cornmeal, meat, chicken, and other ingredients for making her product. This will allow her to continue making sales and generating better revenues.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making tamales.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La señora Carolina cuenta con su propio negocio desde hace 4 años denominado “Miscelánea Sayra”  donde ofrece diversidad de producto de todas marcas. El negocio se ubica en su domicilio para no tener que trasladarse de un lugar a otro y poderlo atender sin ningún problema a su familia. Carolina es una mujer muy emprendedora que le gusta tener retos, por tal motivo quiere comprar una copiadora para ofrecer a sus clientes un nuevo y mejor servicio. De esta manera el negocio seguirá generando mayores ganancias y así podrá cubrir sus gastos.
texts.en:
For the past four years, Sra. Carolina has managed her own business called “Miscelánea Sayra” where she offers a range of products of all brands. This business is located in her home so that she can avoid having to move from one place to another. As a result, she has been able to attend to her family without any problems.

Carolina is an enterprising woman who likes to be challenged. For this reason, she wants to buy a photocopier so that she can offer her customers a new and better service. In this manner, her business can continue generating more revenue so that she can cover her expenses.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
El señor Mauricio es un hombre muy trabajador y padre de dos pequeños por quienes sale adelante para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. La casa donde actualmente vive esta familia, la construyo con ahorros propios que con el tiempo se le fueron agotando, a la vivienda le faltan algunos detalles, para esto Mauricio quiere un préstamo para arreglar el baño ya que las paredes aun no están enjarradas y le faltan accesorios como las llaves y la regadera, de esta manera se prevendrá de que alguno de sus hijos pueda contagiarse de alguna enfermedad. 
Mauricio y su esposa trabajan en maquiladora todos los días de la semana y en ocasiones los fines de semana para tener un ingreso extra, para poder sustentar los gastos del hogar y de esta manera darles a sus hijos un mejor confort.
texts.en:
Sr. Mauricio is a hardworking gentleman and the father of two small children. He wants to succeed so that he can offer them a better quality of life.

The house where he currently lives with his family was built using his own savings. Over time, his funds were depleted and his home still lacks a few details. For this reason, Mauricio is requesting a loan to repair a bathroom because the walls have not been installed and the room still lacks accessories such as faucets and a shower. This will prevent diseases from spreading to his children.

Mauricio and his wife work at a factory every weekday and occasionally on the weekends to earn extra money. This allows them to maintain their household expenses and provide their children greater comfort.

loans.use: to finish the construction of a bathroom.

loans.name: Griselda Veronica

texts.es:
Al negocio de venta de ropa de la señora Griselda le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar ropa, (para mujer, hombre, niños, y accesorios para bebes).  Ya que sus clientes le están solicitando que tenga a la venta ropa nueva. 
Con este ingreso podrá ayudarle a su esposo el señor Mario, con los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos que tiene. 
Doña Griselda planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá de su negocio con la inversión de la compra de mercancía. Don Mario es empleado de una agencia aduanal el se encarga de los trámites de exportación, desea ayudar a su esposo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Griselda’s clothing business lacks great variety in the inventory, but she does not have the necessary funds to invest in merchandise. She is requesting a loan to buy clothing for women, men, and children, as well as baby accessories. Griselda already has customers who are asking her to sell new clothes.

With the income she earns, she will be able to help her husband Sr. Mario with the family expenses and the schooling of their three children. Doña Griselda plans to repay the loan with the earnings from her business as a result of investing in more merchandise. Don Mario is an employee of a duty-free agency where he is in charge of export shipments. Griselda wants to help her husband with her business.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Nasario

texts.es:
El señor Nasario hombre muy trabajador que piensa en el bienestar y confort de su familia, desde hace 4 años el se dedica a la manufacturación de muebles de madera que el mismo diseña,  teniendo su propio local en su vivienda donde ya variedad de clientes le solicita muebles como lo es base para cama, recamaras completas, buros, cocinas integrales, marcos para fotos, repisas y mas todo de acuerdo sus clientes le soliciten. Para seguir prosperando en su negocio el necesita comprar la materia prima como madera, clavos, pinturas y otros instrumentos para la elaboración de sus muebles ya que de esta manera el podrá seguir generando ingresos a su familia. 
Nasario aparte de este ingreso trabaja en maquiladora por las mañanas y la profesión de carpintería la realiza por las tardes ya que esto lo realiza por gusto.
texts.en:
Sr. Nasario is a hardworking gentleman who thinks about the well-being and comfort of his family. For the past four years, he has been manufacturing wooden furniture that he designs himself. He has his own shop in his home where a variety of customers request furniture such as beds, bedroom sets, dressers, kitchen cabinets, and other items such as picture frames and shelves.

In order to continue prospering his business, Nasario needs to buy raw materials such as wood, nails, paint, and other supplies for making his furniture pieces. This will allow him to continue generating income for his family. Nasario also works at a factory during the morning hours. He works as a carpenter in the afternoons, which is mainly done for fun.

loans.use: to buy materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Emma Laura

texts.es:
La señora Emma Laura es madre de dos hijos los cuales tiene que mantener una de 15 años y uno en edad escolar, ya que desde hace años se separo de su marido aunque le ayuda no es mucho para el sostén de ellos. Emma trabaja en un correo como secretaria, como la casa donde ella vive esta en una calle donde los vendedores ambulantes se instalan, construyo locales aun precio accesible para que no sufrieran las inclemencias del tiempo. Uno de los locales el techo es de lamina galvanizada y en el verano este material se pone muy caliente por ello quiere pone losa para  ofrecer un mejor servicio.
Para empezar este proyecto necesita material para la construcción y pagar mano de obra. Aparte de ayudar a estas personas en dar mas barato el local, tendría más ingresos para poder mantener a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Emma Laura is the mother of two children in her care, a 15-year old and another who is of school age. She separated from her husband years ago and he has not provided much help to support them. Emma works as a secretary at a post office.

Her house is located along a street where many traveling vendors set up their businesses. She built vending stalls and offers them at an affordable price so that these merchants don’t have to suffer during the inclement weather. One of these stalls has a galvanized tin roof, but this material gets very hot during the summer, so she wants to install a slab as a way of offering better service.

To start this project, Emma needs to obtain the necessary materials and pay for labor. In addition to helping people by providing a low-cost location to conduct business, she will have more income to support her two children.

loans.use: to install a slab in one of the vending stalls that she rents to her tenants.

loans.name: Dina Marina

texts.es: La señora Dina Marina desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de tacos, gorditas y dulces en una escuela primaria de la ciudad. Ofreciendo por paquetes de tres  de diversos guisos a un precio accesible para los niños y maestros. Dina Marina solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima como lo es la harina y demás ingredientes para la elaboración de su producto ya que esta próxima la entrada al nuevo ciclo escolar y así de esta manera podrá estar preparada.
texts.en: Mrs. Dina Marina has been selling tacos, gorditas and sweets in an elementary school in the city for 20 years.  She offers a bundle of three assorted items at a price that the students and teachers can afford.  Dina Marina is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials, such as flour and other ingredients for the making of her products since the beginning of the new school year is approaching and this way she can be ready.

loans.use: to purchase raw material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise and a griddle for the making of tortillas.

loans.name: Santa Cipriana

texts.es: La señora Cipriana tiene de 2 hijos ya ambos mayores de edad, su hijo menor tiene 24 años, ella vivió 11 años con el papá de ellos de profesión Fotógrafo y ahí fue donde a ella le nació el gusto por la fotografía durante ese tiempo acompañaba al que era su esposo a realizar los trabajos de fotografía que el tenia  y  le ayudaba en organizar el material de trabajo pero siempre con la ilusión de que algún día ella podría hacerse cargo de un evento, sus primeras fotografías profesionales fueron en una graduación de uno de sus hijos de esto ya hace 8 años y desde entonces la fotografía a ha sido la fuente de ingresos de ella.  Cipriana tiene un evento próximo de 15 años por tal motivo quiere estar preparada con el material de trabajo para poder cumplir su compromiso.
texts.en: Mrs. Cipriana has 2 grown children, her youngest is 24 years old.  She lived with their father, a photographer, for 11 years, this is where her liking of photography was born.  During this time she would accompany her then husband to his photo jobs. She would help him organize his work materials with the desire to someday being the one in charge of an event.  Her first professional photographs were at the graduation of one of her sons, which was 8 years  ago.  Since then, photography has been a source of income for her.  Cipriana has a 15th birthday event coming up and wants to be ready with all the material needed to be able to fulfill the engagement.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business.

loans.name: J. Santana

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora J Santana le está haciendo falta la construcción de un cuarto al frente de su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es  block, cemento, varilla y arena, para empezar a construir la recamara que será para su hijo, y así podrá tener su propio espacio en la casa. 
Doña J Santana planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas de productos de belleza por medio de catálogos, ya que su esposo el señor José se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una agencia, como guardia de seguridad. 
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
J. Santana needs a room to be built at the front of her house.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy material like cement blocks, cement, rods, and sand.  She needs these to start building a bedroom for her son.  That way he will have his own space in the house.

J. Santana plans to pay back the loan with the earnings she gets from selling beauty products by catalog.  

Her husband, José, takes care of the family expenses and school expenses with the salary he gets from working as a security guard for an agency.  They want to improve their family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to start building a room on the front of the house.

loans.name: Damaso

texts.es: Damaso de 54 años es empleado de un centro comercial desde hace 11 años, realizando la función de despachador de pan, es casado y vive en una casa de interés social que su hijo  adquirio, estas casas son muy pequeñas y ellos decidieron ampliarla solo que como la mano de obra es muy cara con sus propios ahorros no alcanzaron a poner la losa, solicitan un préstamo para poder realizar su proyecto y ofrecer a su familia mayor comodidad.
texts.en: Damaso is 54 years old and has been employed in a commercial center for the last 11 years, where he has a bread store.  He is married, and lives in publicly subsidized housing which his son acquired.  These houses are very small, and they have decided to expand theirs, but as labor is very expensive, they can't stretch to laying the floor slabs with their own savings.  They are asking for a loan to be able to complete their project and provide more comfort for their family.

loans.use: to lay concrete floor slabs.

loans.name: José  Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. José  es  una persona  muy trabajadora, actualmente el  tiene  un  negocio de   comida para  cual   desea   realizar  la compra  de mercancía, ya  que  el se  preocupa  por  brindarle a  sus  clientes   el  mejor  servicio,gracias  a   este  negocio  el  obtiene  sus  ingresos  para  sacar adelante dia  con dia a su  familia   la   cual es lo mas  importante  que  tiene  en  su   vida,  ve  en  el  crédito la posibilidad  de   hacer  crecer  su  negocio por  lo  que agradece   el apoyo  brindado para  la realización de su proyecto.
texts.en: Señor José  is a very hard-working man.  He currently has a food business for which he wants to purchase some supplies, as he cares about providing his customers with the best service.  Thanks to this loan, he will obtain ingredients which will move his family ahead in life on a daily basis; this is what is most important to him in his life.  He sees in the loan the possibility of growing his business; because of this, he is grateful for the support that is being offered to him to accomplish his project.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food.

loans.name: Alma Patricia

texts.es: La señora Alma Patricia es casada, madre de dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, tres años atrás ella veía como con el sueldo que ganaba su esposo trabajando 10 horas en una maquiladora de la localidad no les alcanza con los gastos básicos de alimentación y educación, se estaba viendo en la necesidad de tener que buscar un empleo pero eso implicaba el tener que descuidar a los niños; platicando con su esposo tomaron la decisión de iniciar un negocio en el cual le permitiera  hacerse cargo del mismo, sin tener que descuidar sus labores de ama de casa, desde hace 2 años Alma tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes, dulces, lácteos y mas, ella sabe que entre mas producto tenga mayores pueden ser sus ganancias para sostener los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Alma Patricia is married; she is the mother of two children who are attending school.  

Three years ago she saw that the salary that her husband was earning from working 10 hours a day in a local factory, was not stretching to cover their basic expenses of food and education. She saw the necessity of looking for a job, but that would mean having to neglect her children.  Talking it over with her husband, they took the decision to start a business which would allow her to manage it without having to neglect her work as a housewife.  For the last two years, Alma has had a store selling groceries, sweets, dairy products and other things.  She knows that with more product, she can have increased earnings that will cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
El señor Humberto se dedica al transporte público de esta misma ciudad Acuña desde hace 21 años. En este momento Humberto el no conduce ninguna unidad ya que tiene dos choferes que le trabajan y le pagan una cuota como renta. Comenta que en este momento uno de los camiones necesita mantenimiento por eso quiere un préstamo para comprar las partes que necesita y pagara al mecánico que le hará el trabajo. El señor Humberto ya es una persona grande de edad y eso no le impide trabajar por lo que desempeña como supervisor en el trasporte urbano, cerciorándose que los camiones vallan a lugar del destino correcto y una velocidad moderada. Aparte de su ingresos como renta de unidades el recibe un pensión mensual para sostener sus gastos.
El señor Humberto es el que porta una camiseta color blanca.
texts.en:
Señor Humberto has been working in public transportation in Acuña for the last 21 years.  Currently Humberto does not drive a vehicle himself, as he has two drivers who work for him, and who pay him a rental fee.  He comments that at the moment one of these vehicles needs maintenance, and this is why he wants a loan to purchase the parts he needs, and to pay the mechanic who will do the work.  

Señor Humberto is an older person, but this does not prevent him for working.  He serves as a supervisor for the urban transport service, making sure that the vehicles go to the right destination and at a reasonable speed.

In addition to his income from the rental of the vehicles, he receives a monthly pension to cover his costs.  

Señor Humberto is the man in the white T-shirt.

loans.use: to maintain a vehicle.

loans.name: Elvira Genoveva

texts.es: La Sra. Elvira es una profesora de primaria jubilada desde hace ya once años, ella vive con su mama la cual esta enferma, y  bajo sus cuidados, por las mañanas da apoyo a sus pequeños vecinos que anda mal en sus estudios y lo hace con amor, para que ellos puedan sobresalir con sus calificaciones, vende productos de catalogo (cosméticos) para así poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su  mama y poder pagar sus medicamentos ya que es una persona discapacitada por su avanzada edad, ella va a pintar el exterior de su vivienda, ya que esta muy deteriorada por el tiempo, esta muy contenta de habernos encontrado y así poder llevar a cabo su proyecto, y a futuro poder instalar el vitropiso en el interior de su vivienda ya que cuenta actualmente con piso de concreto
texts.en:
Señora Elvira is a primary school teacher who has been retired for 11 years.  She lives with her mom who is sick and under her care.  In the mornings, she provides help to her young neighbors who are struggling with their studies, which she does with love so that they will be able to excel with their skills.  She sell products from a catalog (cosmetics), so that she can provide her mom with a better quality of life, and be able to pay for her mom's medicines as she is a disabled woman of advanced age.

She is going to paint the exterior of her house as it has greatly deteriorated over time.  She is very happy to have found us, and so to be able to carry out her project.  In future she will be able to lay floor tiles inside her home, as currently she has a concrete floor.

loans.use: to paint the exterior of her home.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: La señora Celia es madre soltera, que ve por el bienestar de su único hijo que ya es mayor de edad y estudia en otra ciudad una carrera universitaria. Como es sabido dar escuela a un hijo no es nada fácil ya que se llevan gastos y demasiados esfuerzos, sobre todo que Celia sea sola. Pero esto no le impide a la señora ofrecer a su hijo un mejor estudio para que se alguien en la vida y pueda tomar mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Celia hace años trabajo para un hospital de gobierno como asistente medico y por los años laborados fue jubilada de esta manera es como percibe ingresos para sostener los gastos. A Celia ahorita se le complica ya que entra el nuevo ciclo escolar lo cual necesita pagar las colegiaturas, comprar útiles escolares y estancia en el lugar donde vive su hijo.
texts.en:
Celia is a single mother, who looks out for the well-being of her only son. He is now an adult and is pursuing university studies in another city.  As we know, putting a child through school is not an easy thing, since this involves costs and and a lot of effort; especially since Celia is on her own.

But this is not preventing her from offering her son a better education so that he can be someone in life, and have better work opportunities.

Celia worked for years in a government hospital as a physician assistant, and for the years she worked, she was granted a retirement pension.  This is how she receives income to pay expenses.   Celia is having a difficult time right now, since the new school year is starting, which means she needs to pay tuition fees, buy school supplies and pay for her son's accommodation in the place where he is living.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees and to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put a fence up at his house.

loans.name: Percibal

texts.es: El señor Percibal desde hace 6 años trabaja para un maquiladora de la ciudad, con el fin de ofrecer a su familia un mejor calidad de vida. Es padre de dos niños de 4 y 5 años que están apunto de comenzar el preescolar, por lo que Percibal se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para comprarles uniformes y los útiles escolares por que en esta etapa las listas son muy largas les piden colores, lápices, hojas, libros de colorear, papelería de colores, tijeras y mucho mas. Percibal no cuenta con el dinero sufiente para cubrir ese gasto por tal motivo pide el apoyo para comprar a sus pequeños todo lo necesario para que su aprendizaje sea sustentado.
texts.en: Percibal has been an assembly plant work for 6 years, with the goal of providing a better quality of life for his family. He is the father of two children, ages 4 and 5, who are about to begin pre-school. Because of this, he needs to request a loan in order to buy his children school uniforms and supplies. Nowadays the list of supplies needed is a very long one and includes paints, pencils, sheets of paper, coloring books, colored paper, scissors and many other items. Percibal does not have sufficient money to cover these costs and therefore is asking for help to buy his little ones all they need to further their learning.

loans.use: to buy his children school uniforms and supplies.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La señora Liliana y su esposo el señor Sergio tienen dos hijos que actual mente están estudiando. 
Solicitan un préstamo para poder pagar la colegiatura, compra de uniformes y útiles escolares que son libros, plumas, cuadernos, lápices, carpetas y mochilas. Ya que no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder cubrir esta necesidad escolar que sus hijos necesitan para iniciar el siclo. 
Dona Liliana y Don Sergio trabaja de encargados de una ranchos cerca de la ciudad con una parte se los sueldos  planean pagar el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para la familia. 
Desean que sus hijos tengan una buena educación escolar para su futuro.
texts.en:
Liliana and her husband Sergio have two children who are currently in school. They are asking for a loan to pay for high school, to buy uniforms and school supplies such as books, pens, notebooks, pencils, folders and backpacks. They don't have enough money to pay for what their children need to start the term. Liliana and Sergio work as the caretakers of a farm close to town. They plan on paying off the loan with a part of their salaries, since that is the income source for the family. 

They want their children to have a good education for the future.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses.

loans.name: Beatriz Adriana

texts.es: Beatriz es madre soltera de 3 hijos y se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, artículos para el hogar y calzado nuevo por catalogo, al verse ella con la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos con las necesidades básicas, alimentación, calzado,  vestido, educación emprendió un negocio que le permitiera atender a sus 3 hijos y al mismo tiempo proveerlos de  lo necesario para que pudieran vivir bien y así fue como desde 4 años este negocio ha sido su única fuente de ingresos; ella quiere comprar mas artículos de segunda mano para invertirle a su negocio y con las ganancias que ella saque incrementar los productos para su venta y al mismo tiempo mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Beatriz is a single mother with 3 children who sells used clothing and new home furnishings and footwear by catalogue. Faced with the responsibility of supporting her children and providing them with basic necessities such as food, shoes, clothing and an education, she started a business that would allow her to take care of her 3 children and at the same time provide them with what they needed to get ahead. For the past 4 years this business has been her only source of income. She wants to buy more second hand clothing in order to invest in her business. With her profits she will increase the quantity of goods for sale and at the same time improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Juan De  Dios

texts.es: El joven Juan, es un chico que tiene negocio de venta de calzado, cintos, botas y chamarras de piel desde hace ya tres años,  el vende su mercancía de casa en casa, y también en su vivienda, pero gracias a la gran cartera de clientes que tiene se agota su mercancía así es que ha pensado en obtener mas capital para realizar la compra, Juan quisiera en un futuro tener la posibilidad de rentar un local para exhibir su mercancía.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man who has a business selling shoes, belts, boots and leather jackets.  He has been doing this for 3 years now.  He sells his merchandise door-to-door, and also from his home.  

However, thanks to his long list of customers, his merchandise is running out.  So he has thought about obtaining more working capital, in order to buy more.

In the future, Juan would like to be able to rent a location where he can display his merchandise.

loans.use: To buy shoes, belts, and leather jackets for sale.

loans.name: Reyna Yaneth

texts.es: Reyna de 24 años es casada y tiene 2 niñas una de 1 mes de nacida y otra de 6 años que en este año inicia su primer ciclo escolar en la primaria; ella trabaja 10 horas diarias en una maquiladora como operadora desde hace 2 años, su esposo trabaja como operador en una maquiladora. Reyna y su esposo además del empleo que tienen cada uno de ellos  se dedican a la venta de Gorditas en espacio que acondiciono en su mismo domicilio, los días que ella vende son Jueves, Viernes y Sábado, solicitan un apoyo para acondicionar bien este local; pintarlo, comprar mesas  y un poco de publicidad para atraer nuevos clientes; esto con la ilusión de que algún día Reyna pueda dejar de trabajar y poder atender su hogar  y el negocio familiar.
texts.en: Reyna, 24, is married and has 2 children.  One of her children is a 1-month old baby, and the other is 6 years old and is in first grade.  Reyna works 10 hours a day as an operator  in a maquiladora.  She has been doing this work for 2 years, and her husband is also employed as an operator in a maquiladora.  In addition to their jobs, Reyna and her husband also work selling gorditas (traditional Mexican snacks) in a space that they set up in their own home.  They sell on Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays.  They are requesting support to set up this space better; they will paint it and buy tables, and also buy a bit of advertising to attract new customers.  They are doing this with the hope that someday Reyna will be able to stop working and devote herself to her home and the family business.

loans.use: to make improvements to her business premises

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.es: Ana Bertha de 47 años y su esposo Cesar de 43 años,  tienen 25 años de casados y son padres de 3 hijos; su hija de 24 años esta casada, la de 22 años es madre soltera de un niño y su hijo mas pequeño tiene 17 años el esta estudiando la preparatoria. Hace 3 años por medio de un programa de gobierno Ana y su esposo adquirieron una casa llamada PIE DE CASA, ellos han ido construyendo poco a poco ya que cuando les entregaron la casa solo era un pequeño cuarto y espacio para construir con ahorros propios ellos ha ido mejorando esta casa, la familia crece y ya necesitan mas espacio con ahorros propios iniciaron los cimientos de un cuarto con la ilusión algún día terminarlo y asi que cada miembro de la familia pudiera tener su propio espacio. Ellos necesitan el apoyo para levantar paredes de un cuarto.
texts.en: Ana Bertha is 47 and her husband, Cesar, is 43. They have been married for 25 years and are the parents of 3 children: their daughter, 24, is married, their daughter, 22, is a single mother with a child and their youngest, a son, is 17 and attends high school. Three years ago, through a government social housing program called Pie de Casa, Ana and her husband acquired a house that they have been expanding little by little. When the house was given to them it consisted of only one small room [approximately 270 sq. feet] with space to build. They have been improving this house with their own savings. Their family is growing and they need more space. With their own savings, they started putting in the foundation of a room with the dream some day of finishing their home so that each family member would have his or her own space. They need this loan to erect the walls of  a room.

loans.use: to put up the walls of a room.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is a father of four children whose wife is a farmer. He has been doing farming for the past five years. He has been doing this farming for the past 10 years. He was taught on how to grow rice by his cooperative. 

He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities. 

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the business

loans.name: Maria Julieta

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria Julieta le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior y construir la barda alrededor de la casa. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar el material que necesita y es (pintura, block, cemento, arena, varilla) y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Doña Maria Julieta tener mas seguridad, protección y con mejor calidad de vida de su familia. 
Planean pagar el crédito con las el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una agencia como encargada y su esposo el señor Pablo se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como técnico automotriz de una compañía de carros.
texts.en:
The home of Sra. Maria Julieta is lacking the exterior finishes and a security wall around her house. She is requesting a loan to buy the necessary materials such as paint, blocks, cement, sand, and rods, as well as pay to have someone perform the work. As a result, Doña Maria Julieta will be able to provide more security, protection, and a better quality of life for her family.

She plans to repay the loan with the salary she earns from her job working for an agency as a manager. Her husband Sr. Pablo will take care of the family expenses with the income he earns from his job as a mechanic of an automobile fleet.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to complete the exterior finishes of her house and to build a security wall.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: El  Sr. Gilberto es operador de taxis desde hace ocho años, su  esposa y el tienen con un negocio de venta de ropa usada, accesorios y aparatos eléctricos. Para poder llevar un buen ingreso a su hogar y tener una vida cómoda para sus hijos, ellos acudieron a nuestra institución para solicitar un crédito para inversión a su negocio, y sus ganancias aumenten, su proyecto a futuro es tener las posibilidades económicas para rentar un local comercial,en esta ocacion nos  fue  imposible tomar  la  fotografia en el  negocio de  venta  de productos  esto  debido  al  horario  de trabajo del señor  Gilberto.
texts.en:
Sr. Gilberto has been a taxi driver for eight years. He and his wife also have a business selling used clothing, accessories, and appliances. This business brings in good income into their household and has allowed them to provide a comfortable life for their children. Gilberto and his wife have approached Credituyo in order to request a loan to invest in their business so that they can increase their earnings. Their plans for the future are to pursue the possibility of renting a shop.

On this occasion, it was not possible to have the photograph taken at Gilberto’s retail business because of his work schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothing, accessories, and household appliances.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is a mother of a two year old child. She has been farming for the past four years and was taught farming by her parents. 

She will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and finally for harvesting. 

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will increase her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for her rice farming.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: La Sra. Felicitas es una señora muy responsable y seria en su trabajo, junto con su esposo el Sr. Jesús , trabajan día con día para el sustento de su familia, la Sra. felicitas prepara platillos de comida variada para vender y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, ella requiere ahora invertir en la compra de mas productos para preparar platillos  más variados y así poder complacer a todos sus clientes, y al mismo tiempo hacer que sus ganancias aumenten.
texts.en:
Sra. Felicitas is a responsible woman who is serious about her work. She and her husband Sr. Jesús work day after day in order to support their family. Sra. Felicitas prepares and sells dishes of different foods so that she can help her husband with the household expenses.

She now wants to invest in the purchase of more products for preparing various dishes. This will allow her to satisfy all of her customers and at the same time increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a concrete slab in his home.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is a father of two children.  He has been doing farming for the past five years. He was taught farming by his parents.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for rice farming labour.

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es: El Sr Fidencio se acerco a nuestra institución para solicitar un crédito ya que tiene la necesidad de impermeabilizar el techo de su vivienda debido a que en temporada de lluvias el agua se trasmina a través del techo ocasionando humedad y por lo tanto enfermedades para él y para su familia, esto le preocupa mucho ya que también la humedad se está empezando a pasar por las paredes de toda la casa.
texts.en: Sr. Fidencio approached Credituyo to request a loan because he needs to waterproof the roof of his home.  During the rainy season, water will seep through the roof and the resulting moisture promotes diseases that could make him and his family ill.  He is also concerned about the moisture that is starting to permeate through the walls of his entire house.

loans.use: to waterproof the roof of his house.

loans.name: Jean  Pierre

texts.en:
Jean.Pierre is a father of four children. He is a rice farmer and has been doing farming for the past 18 years.  He was taught rice farming by his parents.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor which will help him with rice farming.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan soltero, trabajador, sus hijos ya mayores, sus planes mejora su nivel de vida, artesano desde hace un tiempo elabora vitrina. Se ha presentado dificultades con la salud, sus proyecto es establecer un modulo en el mercado. Inicio  con fondos propios y para con el objetivo  de salir  adelante.  El  Préstamo será invertido en la comprara materia prima como: laminas de vidrio, silicón, entre otros productos. Generándole mayores utilidades para invertir en las mejoras de la infraestructura del negocio. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo socio económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a hardworking gentleman. He is single and his children are grown. His plans include improving his standard of living.

Juan is a craftsman who spends his time making display cabinets. He has experienced health problems, but he still has plans to establish a vending post at the market. Juan started his business with his own funds and has plans to move forward. This loan will be invested in raw materials such as sheets of glass, silicon, and other supplies. He hopes to generate better profits so that he can invest in improvements to the infrastructure of his business.

Juan is grateful for the financial support that has aided in the socio-economic development of his family.

loans.use: to buy glass, silicon, and other materials for making display cabinets.

loans.name: Jose  Humberto

texts.es: El Sr Humberto solicita a nuestra institución un crédito para poner una pequeña losa de concreto al frente de su  vivienda y así proteger a su familia de las inclemencias del tiempo, comenta el sr Humberto que sobre todo en épocas de lluvia el agua se mete por la puerta principal ocasionando que la sala de su casa se moje y quede un ambiente de humedad, provocando enfermedades a su familia.
texts.en: Sr. Humberto is requesting a loan from Credituyo so that he can install a small concrete slab at the front of his house that will protect his family from inclement weather.  He says that during the entire rainy season, the main entrance hall of his house gets damp and starts holding moisture, thereby promoting diseases that could make his family ill.

loans.use: to install a small concrete slab in his house.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa madre soltera  su hijo estudia,  planes es mejorar su nivel de vida.           La clienta es comerciante tiene de proyecto  de la compra de un vehículo para transportar su productos siendo de una gran ayuda.la mayor necesidad que tiene es mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda. Con préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, piedrines, piso, estribu, golosa entre otros materiales ya que construir un cuarto así ampliando  su vivienda. Obtendrá          comodidad  y seguridad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a single mother of a son who is in school. Her plans include improving her standard of living. Rosa is a merchant and has plans to buy a vehicle for transporting her products, which will be of great help.

Her greatest need is to improve the infrastructure of her home. With this loan, she will buy construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, blocks, gravel, floor tiles, buttresses, screws, and other supplies so that she can build a room and expand her home. This will provide greater comfort and security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room.

loans.name: Jean Batiste

texts.en:
Jean Batiste is a father of two children. He is a rice farmer and has been doing rice farming for the past 10 years.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to pay for labor which will help his rice farming.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a father of two children, the older of whom is five years. He is a Rwandan rice farmer and he has been doing rice farming for the past eight years.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor which will work on his rice farm during this season.

loans.name: Peruth

texts.en:
Peruth is a mother of six children, the eldest of whom is 28 years old.  She does rice farming and has been doing rice farming for the past 15 years.  She was taught farming by her cooperative.   She will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor which will work on her farm.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a father of three children. He is a rice farmer and he has been growing rice for the past 12 years.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his rice farming.

texts.en:
Aaron is a father of three children. He has been doing farming for the past four years. He was trained in how to do rice farming by his cooperative.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his rice farming.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a rice farmer.  He is married and has four children, the eldest of whom is 20 years old.  He has done rice farming for the past seven years.  He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his rice growth.

loans.name: Jean D Amour

texts.en:
Jean D Amour is a married, with three children. He is a rice farmer and has been doing this type of farming for the past 30 years.  He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his rice farming.

He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

He will use Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

loans.name: Rosa Obdulia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es muy visitada por la belleza de su centro colonial, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, la gran variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.
 
Doña Rosa tiene 34 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 15, 14, 12 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja, dos de sus hijos están estudiando en el colegio y su último hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como comerciante, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de carnes, negocio en el que lleva 15 años, cuenta con un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad, labora en él desde las 5 de la mañana hasta la 3 de la tarde.
 
Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de carne para su negocio.

Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Bankito Progresista” (Little Progressive Bank). She lives in Cuenca, which is the most visited city because of the beauty of its colonial center. Cuenca is surrounded by four rivers and its people have maintained their culture and traditions. A large variety of cuisines are available to captivate the taste buds of both locals and foreigners alike.

Doña Rosa is 34 years old, married, and has four children (ages 15, 14, 12, and 7). Her oldest child works, the next two attend high school, and the youngest is enrolled at an elementary school in the city. Her husband works as a merchant. They own the house in which they live.

Sra. Rosa is a merchant who sells all types of meats. She has been in this business for 15 years. Rosa has her own shop at a market in the city. She works from 5am to 3pm.

Rosa is receiving her fifth loan with the Communal Bank. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of meat for her business. Her dream is to not have any debts.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Azarius

texts.en:
Azarius is a rice farmer. He has been doing this work for the past five years. His parents taught him how to be a rice farmer. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: growing seedlings in the nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and, lately, in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labour on his rice farm

loans.name: Concepción Lastenia

texts.es:
La Señora Concepción es socia del banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es muy visitada por la belleza de su centro colonial, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, la gran variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.
 
La Señora. Concepción tiene 35 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 10 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Concepción se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal hace 5 años, vende todo el tiempo que tiene libre ya que labora en los quehaceres de una casa medio día y lleva en este trabajo 5 años.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para incrementar sus productos.

Su meta es llegar a ser directora de la marca Yanbal.
texts.en:
Sra. Concepción is a member of the Communal Bank “Bankito Progresista” (Little Progressive Bank). She lives in Cuenca, which is the most visited city because of the beauty of its colonial center. Cuenca is surrounded by four rivers and its people have maintained their culture and traditions. A large variety of cuisines are available to captivate the taste buds of both locals and foreigners alike.

Sra. Concepción is 35 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 14, 10, and 2). Her eldest daughter is a high school student and the second daughter attends an elementary school in the city. Her husband works as a bricklayer. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Doña Concepción has been selling Yanbal cosmetics for five years. She sells on a full-time basis, but whenever she has free time she will work half a day as a housekeeper at a private home. Concepción has also had this job for five years.

Concepción is receiving her fifth loan with the Communal Bank and will invest the money in the purchase of cosmetics so that she can increase her inventory. Her goal is to become a sales director for the Yanbal brand.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a father of five children and a Rwandan rice farmer. He has been doing this work for the past five years. This business is one that he learned from his parents. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: preparing seedlings in the nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and, lately, in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labour on his rice farm

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora Ana es socia del banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es muy visitada por la belleza de su centro colonial, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, la gran variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propio y extraños.
 
Doña Ana tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 13, 11 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos  en la escuela. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico y labora en su propio taller, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora Ana labora en su propio negocio, ella tiene una tienda y bazar 6 años y labora de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de productos de primera necesidad y arículos de bazar, esos productos sirian: arroz, azúcar, fideos, huevos, detergentes, aceites, tarjetas , peluches, regalos, ropa, etc. para surtir más su negocio.
 
Su sueño es viajar a New York.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Bankito Progresista Communal Bank.  She lives in Cuenca, a city that many people visit for its beautiful colonial downtown area.  Four rivers run through the city; its people maintain local culture and traditions; and its great gastronomic variety captivates the palates of both locals and visitors.

Ana is 34 years old and married.  Her marriage has produced three children who are 13, 11, and 5 years old.  Her eldest son is in middle school and her two younger sons are in elementary school.  Her husband is a mechanic by profession and he works in his own garage.  They own the house they live in.

Ana works at her own business, a convenience store and stationary shop she has owned for six years.  She works Sunday to Sunday from seven in the morning to nine at night.

This is the fourth loan she is taking out with the communal bank and she will invest her loan in purchasing much-needed products such as rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, detergent, oil, cards, hair accessories, gifts, clothes, etc. and stationary items to better supply her store. 

Her dream is to visit New York.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, detergent, and other products

loans.name: Jean D’Amour

texts.en:

He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: preparing seedlings in the nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and, lately, in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: to pay labor to help him on the rice farm.

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is the father of five children. He has been farming rice for the past five years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds and harvesting. Jean Pierre wishes to use the profits from his farming to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his rice garden.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia de banco comunal Tocte, vive por la comunidad de Vegaspamba lugar que se encuentra rodeado de una bella naturaleza, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales, muchos laboran en artesanías o salen a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades.

Doña María tiene 45 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, tres de ellos son casados e independientes, dos estudian y trabajan y sus dos últimos hijos  estudian en el colegio. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad siendo el fruto del trabajo conyugal.

La Señora. María labora en la limpieza de casas, esta actividad la desempeña hace 6 años y trabaja todo el día. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes y chanchos.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento de pollos para iniciar con esta actividad.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa más grande para estar cómoda con toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is a member of the Tocte communal bank. She lives in the Vegaspamba community, a place that is surrounded by natural beauty. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. They are agriculturalists, raise livestock and many are artisans or go into the city to work at different jobs.

Maria is 45 and married and this union has produced 7 children. Three of her children are married and independent, two study and work and her youngest two are still in elementary school. Her husband works in the construction area as a bricklayer. The house they live in is their own property and was acquired through joint effort.

Sra. Maria works as a house cleaner, a job she has been doing for the past 6 years and she works all day. At home she raises guinea pigs and pigs.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 3 years and her new loan will be used to purchase chickens and chicken feed so she can begin a new business.

Her dream is to have a larger house in order to provide more comfortably for all of her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: María Zoila

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia de banco comunal Tocte, vive por la comunidad de Tocte lugar que se encuentra rodeado de una bella naturaleza, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales, muchos laboran en artesanías o salen a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades.

Doña María tiene 57 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, casados e independientes, ahora vive en compañía de dos nietos quienes se encuentran de 11 y 9 años de edad y están estudiando en la escuela. Su esposo se dedica a laborar en la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. María labora en la agricultura y  lo que cosecha es más para el consumo de su casa y el sobrante lo vende. También cría  cuyes, cerdos, gallinas y vacas los que los vende cuando tiene  alguna necesidad económica.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de hierba y abono para mejorar sus potreros.

Su meta es  tener más animales.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is a member of the Tocte Community Bank. She lives in Tocte, a place surrounded by natural beauty. The people there have maintained their culture and traditions. Most of the community members work in agriculture and raising animals. Others make hand-crafted goods or go into the city for work. 

María is 57, and she and her husband have seven adult children, all of whom are married and independent. Currently they live with two of their grandchildren, 11 and 9 respectively, who are studying at the local school. Her husband works in agriculture, and they home they live in is on their property.
