María also works in agriculture. Though much of what she grows is for household consumption, she sells the excess crops. She also raises guinea pigs, pigs, chickens, and cows, which she sells when she is in financial need.

This will be her third loan with the community bank, and she will use the money to buy sod and fertilizer to improve her pastures.

Her goal is to raise more animals.

loans.use: purchase sod and fertilizer to improve her pastures

loans.name: Elvira De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Elvira es socia de banco comunal Tocte, vive por la comunidad de Tocte lugar que se encuentra rodeado de una bella naturaleza, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales, muchos laboran en artesanías o salen a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades.

La Señora. Elvira tiene 47 años, es madre soltera y ha concebido 3 hijos de 22, 16 y 10 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado e independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Elvira se dedica al cuidado de ganado en una finca, lleva 7 años en este trabajo y labora de domingo a domingo. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cerdos, cuyes, borregos y gallinas a  los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de hierba para sus animales y de abono para mejorar sus potreros.

Su meta terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the communal bank "Tocte."  She lives in the community of Tocte, a place surrounded by natural beauty, with people who maintain their culture and traditions.  The people there work in agriculture and animal husbandry, and many also work in handicrafts or leave the city to work in different activities.

Elvira is 47 years old.  She is a single mother with three children aged 22, 16, and 10 years.  Her oldest child is married and independent, and her middle child works and helps her financially.  Her youngest child studies in a local school.  She owns the house that they live in.

Elvira cares for livestock on a farm.  She has been doing this work for 7 years, and she works every day.  At her house she raises pigs, guinea pigs, lambs and hens that she sells when she needs the money.

She has been in her communal bank for 3 years, and she will invest the proceeds of this loan in grass to feed her animals and fertilizer to improve her paddock.  

Her goal is to finish her house, as it still lacks some finishing touches.

loans.use: to buy grass to feed her animals, and fertilizer

loans.name: Blanca Edith

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Fe Y Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Blanca, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos los mismos que son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es radiotécnico.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y a la cual le ha gustado ganar algo por sus propios medios para lo cual hace 11 años puso en su casa un pequeño bazar en el cual vende todo tipo de productos como: ropa, zapatos, peluches, perfumes, bisutería y cosas para regalos. Cuando necesita mercadería se desplaza hasta Guayaquil para comprar más mercadería ya que allá les sale más barato. Con este negocio ella pudo ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos ya que esto representaba una carga muy difícil, pero pudieron salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, peluches, perfumes, bisutería entre otras cosas. Lleva 13 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le da el banco.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Fe y Progreso" meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi.  This place has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, because of the large quantity of that fruit that was found in the city in those days.

In this place we meet Blanca, 59, who is married and has 3 children who are adults and are independent.  Her husband is a radio technician.

Blanca is a very tenacious woman who enjoys earning something on her own.  To do this she put a small store in her house 11 years ago where she sells all types of products such as: clothing, shoes, stuffed animals, perfumes, costume jewelry and gift items.  When she needs merchandise she goes to Guayaquil to buy, since she finds the goods cheaper there.  With this business Blanca was able to help her husband with the expenses and the education of their children.  This has been a very difficult burden, but they have managed to get ahead.

Blanca will use this loan to buy clothing, shoes, stuffed animals, perfumes, costume jewelry and other items. She has been with her communal bank for 13 years, and she likes it because of the help that the bank gives her.

Her dream is to continue to make progress with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, stuffed animals, perfumes, costume jewelry and other items

loans.name: Mildred Del Rosgario

texts.es: Mildred  trabaja para el MINED en el Colegio San Francisco desde hace 21 años. Esta solicitando  su 8vo credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto para brindarle mas privacidad a sus hijos, los cuales estan creciendo y necesitan tener su propio espacio para que se desarrollen, ademas si el dinero alcanza pretende hacer unas pequeñas reparaciones a la casa. Sueña con poder mejorar su casa y brindarle a su familia lo mejor que pueda.
texts.en: Mildred has worked for MINED (the ministry of education) in the San Francisco school for 21 years.  She is requesting her 8th loan in order to build a room to provide more privacy for her children, who are growing and need to have their own space for their development.  In addition, she plans to use the money to make some small repairs to her house.  She dreams of improving her house and providing the best that she can for her family.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Jacoba Yolanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Fe Y Progreso.

La señora Jacoba es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado siempre con los créditos. Tiene  67 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 8 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive un nieto que ya tiene 18 años y que es como su hijo. Su esposo es jubilado.

Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, golosinas, sodas entre otras cosas, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo.  Su tienda tiene 18 años y empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que su tiendita es su razón de vivir ya que en ella adema de ganarse la vida se distrae con sus clientes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Jacoba lives in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí.  It has been known for many years as the city of real tamarinds due to the large quantity of this fruit that it produced years ago.  Jacoba meets with her fellow members of the Fe Y Progreso (Faith and Progress) communal bank every two weeks.

Jacoba is a founding member of her communal bank, and she likes it because of the help that her loans have always given her.  She is 67, married, and has 8 children who are independent adults.  She lives with one grandson who is 18 and is like her own son.  Her husband is retired.

Our friend has a grocery store in her home where she sells all kinds of products like:  rice, sugar, oils, detergents, candy, soft drinks, etc.  She works there every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m., and her husband helps her with her work.  She has had her store for 18 years, and she started it with her first loan that she received from the institution.  She is very grateful this since her store is her reason for living.  In addition to earning her living from it, it is also a way to distract herself with her customers.

She will use this loan to further stock her store.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other basic goods.

Her goals are to get ahead with her business so that it will grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, sausages, and other basic goods.

loans.name: Zoila Azucena

texts.es: Zoila de 29 años de edad es soltera trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 7 años como responsable de servicios generales. Esta solicitando  su 5to credito para la construccion de un cuarto en su casa, pues desea acondicionar un poco la casa ya que es pequeña y como vive con sus hermanas desea acondicionar su propio espacio para tener mayor privacidad.  Espera poder seguir siendo beneficiada con el fondo kiva, pues anteriormente logro la construccion de la cocina gracias al financiamiento que obtuvo en AFODENIC y Kiva.
texts.en: Zoila  is 29-years-old and single.  She has worked at the mayor's office in Juigalpa for 7 years and is responsible for general services.  She is requesting her 5th loan to construct a room in her home.  She hopes to fix up her house a little bit since it is small and she lives with her sisters.  She hopes to fix up her own space so she can have more privacy.  She hopes to keep being benefitted with funds from Kiva.  She was previously able to construct her kitchen thanks to the financing she received from Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: to construct a room

loans.name: María Janeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Fe Y Progreso.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 38 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  22, 15 y 5 años de edad, actualmente está en su séptimo mes de  embarazo, dos de sus hijos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es operador de maquinas pesadas.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa interior por catalogo y de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Nuestra amiga vende en su casa aunque a veces también sale por los alrededores a ofrecer sus productos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Lleva seis años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la ayuda que recibe del banco.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Janeth lives in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí.  It has been known for many years as the city of real tamarinds, due to the large quantity of this fruit that it produced years ago.  She meets with the members of her communal bank, Fe y Progreso (Faith and Progress), every two weeks.

María is 38; married; and has 3 children who are 22, 15, and 5.  She is currently 7 months pregnant.  Two of her children are in high school, and one is in elementary school.  Her husband operates heavy equipment.

She is a housewife who started selling lingerie and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories) to make her own money.  Our friend sells out of her house but also sometimes goes to the surrounding areas to see her products.  She offers her products on credit and collects every week or two weeks according to what her customers request.  The beauty products are delivered to her home, and she gets the lingerie from a distributor downtown.  She has done this work for 10 years, and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and lingerie.  She has been a member of her communal bank for 6 years, and she likes it because of the help she has received from it.

Her dream is to get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and lingerie.

loans.name: Rosalpina

texts.es: Rosalpina de 47 años de edad es soltera trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 9 años como auxiliar de RR HH. Esta solicitando  su 10mo credito para construir un muro de su casa ya que con las lluvias se le mete el agua del patio y quiere evitar que se le dañe su casa o que se enferme su familia.  Expresa sentirse muy agradecida por el apoyo que AFODENIC y Kiva le han brindado, pues anteriormente obtuvo 2 creditos financiados por kiva, uno para mejorar su casa y otro para comprar una computadora, lo cual le ha servido muchisimo a sus hijos que estudian.
texts.en:
Rosalpina, 47, is single and has worked in the Mayor’s office of Juiglapa for the past 9 years as a Human Resources Assistant.  She is requesting a loan for her 10th cycle, money to build a wall at her house since when it rains, the water comes in through the patio and she wants to avoid damaging her house or that her family gets sick.

She is thankful for the support that AFODENIC and Kiva have given her.  She previously had 2 loans through Kiva, one to improve her house and the other to buy a computer.  The computer has  been very helpful to her children who are in school.

loans.use: to build a wall

loans.name: Jessica Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Fe Y Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jessica, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  seis años de edad, el mismo que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de zapatillas de la marca Veliza y productos de Oriflame (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja de lunes a viernes, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa. Tiene cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y zapatillas. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para financiar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran bazar en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Jessica lives in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí.  It has been known for many years as the city of real tamarinds due to the large quantity of this fruit that it produced years ago.  Jessica meets with her communal bank, Fe y Progreso (Faith and Progress), every two weeks.

Jessica is 29, married, and has a 6-year-old son, who is in elementary school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

She is a housewife, and she sells Veliza slippers and Oriflame products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories) to make her own money.  She works Monday through Friday.  She sells on credit and collects every week.  Her products are delivered to her home.  She has done this work for 4 years, and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and slippers.  This is her fourth loan with her communal bank.  She liks it because her loans help her a lot to finance her business.

Her dream is to have a large bazaar downtown.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and slippers.

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Teresa de 28 años de edad es soltera, tiene un bebe de 1 año de edad, labora como empledada domestica desde hace 5 años ademas vende productos AVON, ZERMAT y otras cositas que sus clientes le encargan; esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa, pues quiere embaldosar el cuarto, pues es de tierra y se le hace lodo cuando llueve. El mayor sueño de Teresa es poder tener su casita con las condiciones basicas para su bebecito, pues es su razon de ser.
texts.en: Teresa is 28 and single.  She has a 1-year-old baby.  She has worked as a domestic employee for 5 years.  She also sells Avon and Zermat products and other little things that her customers order from her.  She is requesting her third loan with the objective of improving her home.  She wants to tile a room since it has a dirt floor and becomes mud when it rains.  Teresa's biggest dream is to be able to have her own little home with basic comforts for her little baby, who is her reason for living.

loans.use: To tile a room

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Fe Y Progreso.

La señora  Blanca es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son como de su familia. Tiene 65 años de edad, es madre soltera  de dos hijos los mismos que en la actualidad ya son mayores de edad e independientes.
 
Ella desde hace mucho tiempo atrás tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus hijos y tuvo que ser padre y madre a la vez ya que el padre de sus hijos los dejo y desde allí ella tuvo que ver como sacaba a sus hijos adelante por lo cual empezó un negocio de venta de ropa de todo tipo, sus forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 18 años en este negocio y gracias a esto pudo salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante hasta que Dios se lo permita.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí.  It has been known for many years as the city of real tamarinds, due to the large quantity of this fruit that it produced years ago.  Blanca meets with her communal bank, Fe y Progreso (Faith and Progress), every two weeks.

Blanca is a founding member of her communal bank.  She likes it because her fellow members are like family.  She is 65 and a single mother of 2 children who are independent adults.

She has had to be both mother and father to her children because the father of her children left them.  She had to take good care of her children, which is why she started a business selling all types of clothing.  She sells by going door to door and taking orders.  She sells on credit and collects from her customers every week.  She has had this business for more than 18 years, and thanks to it, she was able to get ahead.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.  

Her dream is to get ahead if God will allow it.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es: José Alejandro de 30 años de edad solicita su 4to crèdito para arreglar la vivienda donde habita,  pues algunas paredes estan dañadas y quiere fortalecerlas para seguridad de su familia, cuenta con el apoyo de su compañera de vida que tambien trabaja por eso ambos comparten con los gastos familiares y con el pago de sus cuotas, tiene buenas referencias comerciales, personales y laborales. Su amyor sueño en la vida es que su familia goze de salud y seguir estudiando para adquirir nuevos conocimientos.
texts.en: José Alejandro is 30 and is requesting his fourth credit to make repairs to his home where he lives.  Some of the walls are damaged, and he wants to reinforce them for the security of his family.  He has the support of his wife, who also works.  They both share their family's expenses, and with their wages, they have good commercial, personal, and work references.  His biggest dream in life is that his family enjoys health and to keep studying to gain new knowledge.

loans.use: To make repairs to his home.

loans.name: Maykol Jaxon

texts.es: Maykol Jaxon  de 24 años trabaja como docente del ceta Inatec desde hace 2 años, solicita este credito para construir una habitaciòn y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su familia, este joven es bien querido por sus vecinos, compañeros de trabajo ya que es bien humilde y sencillo, su mayor sueño es estudiar una post grado  para adquirir nuevos conocimientos  y continuar trabajando con los creditos para asi poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda y sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Maykol Jaxon is 24 years old and has worked for two years as a teacher at the National Institute of Technology, Center for Agricultural and Technical Education. He is requesting this loan to build a room and thereby improve his and his family's living conditions. This young man is beloved by his neighbors and coworkers because he is very humble and kind. His greatest dreams are to pursue graduate studies so he can acquire more knowledge and to continue to work with these loans, which make it possible for him to improve his home and living conditions little by little.

loans.use: to build a room onto his house

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es: Isidoro de 50 años de edad, labora como contador del CETA INATEC desde hace 4 años, solicita su 4to credito para mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda construyendo una habitacion, dando de esta manera mejores condiciones a su familia, su esposa es una persona profesional tambien es asalariada ambos comparten con los gastos familaires, su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia no le falte lo basico en el hogar y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en: Isidoro is 50 years old and has worked for four years as an accountant for the National Institute of Technology, Center for Agricultural and Technical Education. He is requesting his fourth loan in order to improve the infrastructure of his home. He will build another room and thereby improve his family's living conditions. His wife is a salaried professional too and they share the household expenses. Isidoro's greatest dreams in life are for his family to have all of the basic necessities in their home and for his children to continue studying so that they can become respectable people.

loans.use: to build a room onto his house

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Trabaja como Bibliotecaria en el CETA INATEC desde hace 19 años desempeñandose como Bibliotecaria y cajera , solicita su 8vo credito para arreglar la cocina de su vivienda ya que el techo y las paredes se encuentran en mal estado y asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones.  Maria Teresa se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable y muy trabajadora, bajo su cuido esta su madrecita y un sobrino, a quienes les da lo mejor de si misma para que no les falte nada, su mayor sueño en la vida es es que mamà goze de mucha salud y seguir mejorando su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa has been working as a librarian at CETA INATEC for 19 years.  She is requesting her 8th loan to fix up the kitchen in her home as the roof and walls are in a bad state of repair.  In this way, she will provide her family with better living conditions.

Maria Teresa is a very responsible and hard-working woman.  She has her mom and a nephew in her care and she provides for them the best she can so that they don't want for anything.  Her biggest dreams in life are for her mom to enjoy good health and to continue improving her humble home.

loans.use: to fix up her kitchen

loans.name: Zoila Elena

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre, al visitar este lugar nos regala la belleza de la naturaleza, su gente es carismática, alegre y trabajadora, mantienen la cultura de sus padres y laboran en la agricultura, cría de animales y artesanías como es la elaboración de sogas.

Doña Zoila tiene 52 años, es casada fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos,  5 son mayores de edad, casados e independientes, sus tres últimos hijos son de 16, 14 y 1 año 7 meses de edad de los cuales 2 estudian en un colegio de la localidad. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Zoila se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, como pasa en casa cría cerdos, gallinas y cuyes a los que los vende en su comunidad. También hace 8 años se dedica  a la artesanía, ella elabora sogas.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su quinto crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de nylon para seguir realizando sogas.
 
Su meta es crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the Vegaspamba community bank and lives in the community of the same name.  On visiting this place we are struck by its natural beauty and its charismatic, cheerful and hard-working people who maintain their parents' culture and work in farming, livestock raising and handicrafts, for example making rope.

Zoila is 52 years old, married, and has eight children from her marriage.  Five of her children are grown up, married and live independently.  Her three youngest children are 16; 14 and 1 year, 7 month.  Two of them attend a local school.  Zoila's husband works in farming and they own their own home.

Zoila does her household chores and also raises pigs, hens and guinea pigs at home which she later sells in her community.  In addition, she has been in the craft business for eight years, making ropes.

This is Zoila's fifth loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying nylon so that she can continue making ropes.  Her goal is to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy nylon.

loans.name: Mariela Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora. Mariela es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, vive en la comunidad del Progreso, al visitar este lugar nos regala la belleza de la naturaleza, su gente es carismática, alegre y trabajadora, mantienen la cultura de sus padres y laboran en la agricultura, cría de animales y artesanías como es la elaboración de sogas.

La Señora. Mariela tiene 24 años, es casada y ha concebido una hija de 6 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña Mariela se dedica a cuidar una hacienda y realiza varias actividades en la misma, trabaja allí hace 3 años y de lunes a viernes. Hace 7 años también se dedica a la artesanía, ella elabora sogas.
 
En la banca comunal se encuentra hace 9 ciclos y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de nylon para seguir en el negocio de las sogas.
 
Su meta es  terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.
texts.en:
Mrs Mariela is a member of the communal bank Vegaspamba. She lives in Progreso, a place of natural beauty. The local people are charismatic, cheerful, hardworking and respect the culture of their parents. They work in agriculture, animal husbandry and crafts such as rope-making.

Mrs Mariela is 24 years old. She is married and has a 6 year old daughter who studies at the local school. Her husband works as a mason and they live in their own house.

Mrs Mariela takes care of an estate where she has different duties to perform. She has been working there for 3 years, Monday through Friday. She is also involved in handicrafts and has made ropes for the last 7 years.

She has already had 9 loans from the communal bank. With this new loan she is going to buy nylon to continue making ropes. 
 
Her goal is to finish her house as it still needs a few finishing touches

loans.use: to buy nylon.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge de 24 años de edad, trabaja como docente de formacion Tecnica en el Ceta INATEC.   Solicita  su 1er  crèdito para comprar un solar para en el futuro construir su propia vivienda y tener que ofrecerle a su familia. En su centro de trabajo es reconocido como una persona responsable con sus obligaciones,  honesto, trabajador y muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo, su sueño en la vida es tener su propia casa y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: 24-year-old Jorge works as a teacher providing technical training at CETA INATEC (an agricultural technical education center).  He is requesting his first loan to buy a plot of land on which to build his own home in the future so that he has something to offer his family.  At work, Jorge is known as a person who is responsible with his obligations, honest, hard-working and very well liked by his colleagues.  His dream in life is to own his own home and help his family.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La SeñoraMaría es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre, al visitar este lugar nos regala la belleza de la naturaleza, su gente es carismática, alegre y trabajadora, mantienen la cultura de sus padres y laboran en la agricultura, cría de animales y artesanías como es la elaboración de sogas.

La Señora. María tiene 50 años, es madre soltera de 7 hijos, una hija es casada e independiente, cuatro trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos son  de 16 y 14 años y estudian en el colegio. La casa en la que habita es heredada.

Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la cría de cuyes y gallinas. También se dedica a la artesanía, ella realiza sogas y esta actividad  aprendió desde muy joven siguiendo el ejemplo de su madre.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra 2 años, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para crecer en la cría de animales.
 
Su meta es sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Vegaspamba Community Bank. She lives in the community of the same name. Visitors to Vegaspamba will notice its natural beauty, as well as its its charismatic, happy, hard-working residents who do their best to preserve local culture. Many Vegaspamba residents are farmers or craftsmen who produce rope, etc. 

Maria is 50 years old and a single mother of seven. One of her daughters is married and living independently. Four others work and contribute to their mother's household. The two youngest, age 16 and 14, are still in school. This family lives in a house that has been passed down through their family. 

Maria spends a lot of time on housework, but also raises pigs and chickens. She also makes rope, a craft she learned many years ago from her mother. 

She has been a member of her community bank for two years now. With this new loan, she plans to buy a cow to raise, which should help her continue raising her family.

loans.use: buy a cow.

loans.name: Gulnara Del Rosario

texts.es: Gulnara de 35 años de edad labora  como secretaria del poder Judicial desde hace 4 años, solicita 2do crèdito con AFODENIC para  aRreglo de paredes en su vivienda y asi gozar de  mejores condiciones, su esposo trabaja como pintor  automotriz en su propio negocio, ambos son responsables y dedicados a su trabajo y a su familia, profesan la religion evangelica, su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia permanezca unida y que siempre exista en amor de Dios.
texts.en: Gulnara, 35 years old, has worked as a secretary for the Judiciary for 4 years. She is requesting her second loan with AFODENIC to repair the walls of her home and so enjoy improved living conditions. Her husband has his own business as an automotive painter. They are both responsible and dedicated to their work and family, and profess the evangelical faith. Her greatest dream in life is that her family stay together and always live in the love of God.

loans.use: to repair the walls of her home

loans.name: Blanca Ninosca

texts.es: Blanca Ninosca labora como docente de primaria desde hace 10 años, ella vive con su abuelita y con su unico hijo, solicita su 8vo crèdito el  cual lo invertira en compra de materiales para construir una habitaciòn para brindar mejores condiciones a su familia, es muy reconocida por ser responsable y cumplida con sus obligaciones,  su sueño es que su hijo estudie para que en el futuro sea un hombre de bien y tener estabilidad laboral para seguir apoyando a su linda familia.
texts.en: Blanca Ninosca has worked as an elementary school teacher for ten years.  She lives with her grandmother and her only son.  She is asking for her eighth loan, which she will use to purchase materials to build a room that will provide her family with better living conditions.  She is well known for being responsible and trustworthy in her obligations.  Her dream is for her son to get an education so that in the future he will be a good man with the job stability to keep helping his wonderful family.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Gloria Susana

texts.es:
La Señora. Gloria es socia del banco comunal Las del Rio, vive por la comunidad de  Palmira lugar que es de clima frió, cuenta con lindos paisajes naturales, su gente es carismática, alegre y trabajadora, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones, laboran en la agricultura, cría de animales y mucha de su gente laboran en la ciudad en diferentes áreas de trabajo.

La Señora. Gloria es muy joven tiene 19 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de 1 año y 8 meses de edad. Su esposo es pintor de casas, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Avon y también ropa, labor que la realiza hace un año, trabaja de lunes a viernes sin horario fijo y vende recorriendo la ciudad.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir compra de cosméticos y ropa para incrementar su negocio.
 
Su meta es  tener un local para poder vender cómodamente su mercadería.
texts.en:
Ms Gloria is a member of the communal bank Las del Rio. She lives in Palmira which has a cold climate and beautiful natural landscapes. The local people are charismatic, cheerful, hardworking and uphold their traditions and culture. They work in agriculture and raise animals. Many of them work in the city in different sectors.

Ms Gloria is very young - she is 19 years old - and lives in a common law marriage. She has a son aged 1 year 18 months. Her husband is a house painter. He has no house of his own and so lives with his mother and shares the household expenses. 

Our member, Ms Gloria, has been selling Avon cosmetics and clothes for the past year. She works Monday through Friday, without a fixed schedule, travelling around the city to sell her products. 

This is her 3rd loan with the communal bank and she is going to use it to buy cosmetics and clothes to grow her business.

Her goal is to have a convenient place where she can sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Eva Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Eva es socia del banco comunal Las del Rio, vive por la comunidad de  El Progreso lugar que es de clima frió, cuenta con lindos paisajes naturales, su gente es carismática, alegre y trabajadora, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones, laboran en la agricultura, cría de animales y mucha de su gente laboran en la ciudad en diferentes áreas de trabajo.

Doña Eva tiene 38 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 21, 19, 17 y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros trabajan para sus gastos personales, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y su última hija en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es comerciante de ropa, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora Eva se dedica a la atención de su tienda la misma que tiene hace 5 años, trabaja en ella desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. También realiza campeonatos de  indor fútbol.
 
Nuestra socia se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para el negocio de su esposo.
 
Su meta es mejorar su cancha de football.
texts.en:
Eva is a member of the Las del Rio Communal Bank. She lives for the community of El Progreso, with its cold climate, its beautiful natural landscapes, and its charismatic, cheerful, and hardworking people.  They preserve local culture and traditions and work in farming, raising animals, and many work in the city in different fields.

Eva is 38 years old and married, with four children who are 21, 19, 17, and 11 years old.  Her two eldest children work for their personal expenses, her third son is in high school, and her youngest daughter goes to the local elementary school.  Her husband runs a clothing store and they own the house they live in.

Eva looks after their store, which they have had for five years.  She works there from eight in the morning until eight at night.  She also organizes indoor soccer championships.

Our member is seeking her third loan, which she will use to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing for her husband's business.

Her goal is to improve her football field.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Clara Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. Clara es socia del banco comunal Las del Rio, vive por la comunidad de El Progreso lugar que es de clima frió, cuenta con lindos paisajes naturales, su gente es carismática, alegre y trabajadora, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones, laboran en la agricultura, cría de animales mucha y de su gente laboran en la ciudad en diferentes áreas de trabajo.

Doña Clara tiene 36 años, está separada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos de 19, 17, 13, 11 y 9 años de edad, sus últimos hijos son gemelos de 1 año y 9 meses, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le  ayudan económicamente, su tercera hija está estudiando en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en la escuela. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora Clara tiene una tienda  hace 4 años, labora en ella desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. También se dedica a la cría de borregos, cuyes y cerdos a los que los vende en su comunidad. Hace un año se dedica a la elaboración de sogas.
 
Nuestra socia se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir para la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda y en cuyes.

 Su sueño es tener mayor capital para agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of the 'Las del Rio' community bank and lives in El Progreso community.  This is a cold-climate area which has beautiful natural landscapes.  The locals are charismatic, cheerful and hard working people who maintain their culture and traditions.  They work in farming, livestock raising, and many of them work in different jobs in the city.

Clara is 36 years old and separated.  She has seven children from her marriage who are 19, 17, 13, 11 and 9, and twins who are 1 year and 9 months.
Her eldest two children work and help out financially.  Her third child (a daughter) is in high school and her next two are in elementary school.  She owns her own home.

Clara has owned a store for four years.  She works there from 7 o'clock in the morning until 8 o'clock at night.  She also raises lambs, guinea pigs and pigs which she sells in her community.  In addition, she has been making ropes for one year.

Our member is on her second loan and she will invest it in buying essential household products for her store and guinea pigs.  Her dream is to have more capital so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy essential household products and guinea pigs

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 34 años, es casado con Marleny y ambos tienen 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicado en el distrito de LLochegua. 

Andrés es un técnico electrista que viene ganándose la vida desde hace 7 años, le agradece a Dios por darle esa sabiduría, desde entonces se levanta muy temprano para poder atender a sus clientes que tanto requieren este servicio.
Andrés esta contento con este negocio, porque sabe que le genera un buen ingreso económico y que gracias a ello puede darle un bienestar a su querida familia, además cuenta con el apoyo de su querida esposa. Lo único que le aqueja, es que al manipular cualquier artefacto siempre está en contacto e inhalando de sustancias toxicas que dañan su salud. 






Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que el se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. 

Con los 1500 soles que solicita, comprará más accesorios y repuestos para poder realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Andrés is 34 years old and married to Marleny.  The couple have two children and live together in their own home which is located in Llochegua district.

Andrés is an electrician who has been earning a living for seven years.  He thanks God for having given him this wisdom.  He gets up very early in the morning so that he can visit his customers who need this service so badly.

Andrés is happy with his business because he knows that it makes him a good income and, thanks to the business, he is able to provide for his much-loved family.  He also has the support of his beloved wife.  The only thing which bothers Andrés is that when he is fixing appliances he is always in contact with them and inhaling toxic substances which harm his health.

This is Andrés' first loan from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time.  He will use the 1,500 soles that he is requesting to buy more accessories and spare parts so that he is able to carry out his work.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo Irineo y sus 6 hijos en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito D. LLochegua. Delfina viene administrando su peluquería por casi 12 años, siendo sus hijas, quienes la apoyan en el trabajo, atendiendo a los clientes con una amabilidad y cortesía. Durante este tiempo, ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. sus clientes y la destreza que tiene para hacer variedad D. cortes y peinados, asimismo es solicitada en eventos ya sea para matrimonios y quince años. Ahora desea implementarse D. más productos para ofrecer un buen servicio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP por lo que ella se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago D. sus cuotas.Con los 2000 soles que solicita, comprará muebles para acondicionar su peluquería.
texts.en:
Delfina, age 54, lives with her husband Irineo and their six children in their own home in the District of Llochegua. She has managed a beauty salon for almost 12 years. Her daughters help her with the work. Delfina attends to her customers with kindness and courtesy. During this time, she has managed to gain the trust of her customers. Her skills enable her to offer a variety of cuts and hairstyles. In addition, her services are requested for events such as weddings and quinceañeras. Now she wants to introduce more products so that she can offer a good service.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to complete her payments on time. With this loan of 2000 PEN that she requested, Delfina will buy furniture to equip her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her beauty salon.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 32 years old, is married to a petty trader and has a 3-year-old child. He has an additional dependent (his brother) who lives with him. Joseph has been operating a telephone center and selling recorded DVD plates for the past two years. This business has helped him to get adequate income to meet his and his family's needs. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day. Joseph earns about SLL 900,000 monthly from this business.

Joseph has a very good loan repayment history. He needs a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to buy mobile phone credit cards and recorded DVD plates. He hopes that this loan will increase his monthly profit by SLL 300,000. In the future, Joseph plans to educate his daughter to the highest possible level and to build a house for his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone credit cards and recorded DVD plates

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata, 35 years old, is married and has 3 children aged 18, 16 and 10 years old. In 2000, Aminata established her cloth business because she wanted to raise enough money to help her husband support their family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, Aminata earns about SLL 1,200,000 monthly from this business.

Aminata has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan. She would like a loan of SLL 4,000,000 in order to buy cotton and lace materials for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Aminata plans to open a shop so that she can buy more stock and realize more profit in order to assist her husband to take good care of the home and educate the children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 1 bale of cotton and 5 bales of lace

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia tiene 46 años, casado con Obaldo de 44 años, con quien tiene 6 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de LLochegua. Teodosia es una mujer muy laboriosa, que desde muy niña tuvo que trabajar por ganarse la vida y lograr tener un futuro. Al ver que ella era considerada dentro de su barrio como una de las personas más participativa en las actividades, aprovecho para instalar un negocio que es la venta de pollos, claro que a los inicios le fue muy difícil mantener en pie su negocio, pero con el tiempo logro confianza y habilidad en la venta. El único problema que tiene es que los pollos debe comprarlos en la ciudad de San Francisco que queda a 30 kilómetros, por lo que continuamente debe trasladarse para así abastecerse de capital de trabajo. Este es su primer  crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 soles que solicita, comprará más pollos.
texts.en:
Teodosia is 46 years old and married to Obaldo, age 44. They have six children and live in their own home in the District of Llochegua. Teodosia is a hardworking woman who has been earning a livelihood since she was a young girl so that she could have a future. She is regarded in her neighborhood as one of the most active people because of her business activities. Teodosia took the opportunity to start a business selling chickens. Maintaining her business was very difficult at the beginning, but over time she gained confidence in her sales ability. The only problem she deals with is having to buy chickens in the city of San Francisco, which is 30 kilometers away. She must travel constantly in order to stock up on inventory.

This is her first loan with MFP and Teodosia promises to submit her payments on time. The loan of 1500 PEN will be used to buy more chickens.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for butchering.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Daniel. He is married and has four children who are 6, 8, 12, and 14 years old. In 2001, Daniel established his spare parts and lubricants business. This business has helped Daniel to provide a livelihood for his family for the past years. My family and I depend only on this business, said Daniel.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Daniel has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan to buy outer tires, rings, timing chain and crank shaft. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Daniel plans to establish a vehicle/motorcycle trade, build a house and support his children's education. He travels to Freetown twice a month by public transport to buy his business stock.  He serves riders and drivers in the township of Makeni City. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy outer tires, rings, timing chain and crank shaft

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: This is 26-year-old Mamie. She is married to a driver and has three children ages 2, 5 and 9 years old. In 2001, Mamie established her textiles business. She began her business because she learned from her mother as she was helping her to trade in the market until she got married.  Mamie’s husband helped her to open her own business so that she could help provide support for the family.  Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan for Le 5,000,000.  Mamie requires a loan in order to buy one bale of lace @ Le 1,500,000 and one bale of real wax cotton @ Le 3,500,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000.  In the future, Mamie plans to open a shop. By acquiring loans, she will be able to buy more goods. She wants her children to have a good life and go through good schools so the loan will help to pay their school fees. The rains and high cost of transportation are her major business challenges. She serves the surrounding villages and the city centre. Mamie buys quality textiles and maintains good relationships with her customers.  She travels twice monthly to Conakry or Freetown by road to buy her business stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy lace and real wax cotton

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Jariatu.  She is married and has three children aged 7, 9 and 14 years old. In 2001, Jariatu established her cooking utensils business. She began her business because she needed to support her husband in providing a livelihood for their family .Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Jariatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan to buy drinking buckets, kitchen baskets, plastic bowls and sets of pans for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Jariatu plans to expand her business to the point of becoming a wholesaler, educate her children and help her husband build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for drinking buckets, kitchen baskets, plastic bowls and sets of pans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase peak milk, sardines, butter, sugar, and batteries

loans.name: Ibrahim Kebbay

texts.en:
This is 47 year-old Ibrahim.  He is married to a nursing aid worker, and has 5 children aged 2, 7, 10, 15 and 18.   In 2001, Ibrahim established his business selling provisions such as mayonnaise, milk, sardines, margarine, black mint etc.  He serves people around the city and in the surrounding villages. He began his business because needed a reliable source of income to support his family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 each month. 

Ibrahim would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more mayonnaise, milk, sardines, margarine and black mint to sell. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, he plans to open a bigger shop.  By accessing more loans, he will be able to buy more stock and help his young children with their education. The rainy season and rise in transport costs are his biggest challenges.  Competition is high but he treats his customers well, and so his business is popular.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy mayonnaise, milk, sardines, margarine and black mint

loans.name: Hawa A.

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Hawa. She is married to a businessman and has 3 children, aged 11, 15 and 20 years. 

In 2001, Hawa established her textiles business. She began her business because she did not go to school; she decided to join her mother into business. When she got married, her husband set up her own little business for her so that she could help in supporting their family.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le1, 200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. Hawa requires a loan in order to buy wax cotton and dry cotton for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL250,000. 

In the future, Hawa intends to open a shop. She will make it possible to pay the loan on time so that she will be able to access more loans. She wants her three children to go through university education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bales of wax and dry cotton for her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Fatmata. She is married to a policeman and has 3 children, aged 4, 9 and 15 years. All of her children go to school. 

In 2001, Fatmata established her clothing and bedding business. She began her business because she learned from her mother, who trained her to do this business. "My business is special to me because I make profit from it, which I use to help my husband in supporting our family," said Fatmata. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL3, 000,000. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy men's jeans - 2 dozen @ SLL480,000, wax cotton - 1 pieces @ SLL1,950,000, ladies skirts - 1 dozen @ SLL48,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL300,000. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to open a shop and continue accessing loans that will enable her to achieve her dreams. She wants her children to live a good life and have a good education. Rise in transportation costs and rainy season are major challenges for her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for men jeans - 2 dozen @ SLL480,000, wax cotton - 1 pieces @ SLL1,950,000, ladies skirt - 1 dozen @ SLL48,000.

loans.name: Sagheeran's Group

texts.en:
Sagheeran’s husband has a bicycle repair shop. He offers his customers repair services and sells bicycle spare parts as required. Sagheeran has a son and a daughter. Both of them are very little in age and are not of school-going age yet. She takes care of her children very well and also performs her household tasks with a great sense of responsibility. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to support her husband financially. With the loan, he will buy bicycle spare parts and repair tools to offer better quality services to his customers and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for many years and Sagheeran is confident that an investment will be very helpful for him.

loans.use: To buy tools & spare parts for bicycles

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 38 years old and married with 4 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She sells rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Mary Jean has borrowed and paid for 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been selling rice for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and a general store.

Mary Jean aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is illiterate and remains at home. She is very active and performs her household tasks very well. Her husband sells vehicle tires and tubes. His shop is located in the market. He is very fair in his rates and provides good quality products and services to his customers. She doesn’t have any children. 

Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy tires and tubes of different brands and companies to raise his profits and sales. He is very experienced in his business and has been doing it for the past 27 years. Sughran hopes that an investment will help him earn more profits from his business and she will be able to save some profits for their old age.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy vehicle tires & tubes to sell

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is married and her husband deals in scrap. He provides scrap to other scrap dealers and to different factories. His business is doing well and he needs continuous investment to fulfill the orders on time. Bushra is a seamstress who sews clothes for her neighborhood clients for a profit. She learned this art from her mother and now she earns a reasonable income every month. This income helps her pay the utility bills.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy scrap in bulk to be able to fulfill the client orders on time and earn more profits. He has good experience in his business and has been operating it for the past 13 years. Bushra is confident about the positive growth of her husband’s business after the loan investment. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan from Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bushra.

loans.use: To buy scrap in bulk

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is married and her husband is a hairdresser by profession. He is an expert in his work. His talent and good service help him to increase his clientele base in his community. He offers his services through his shop. Bashiran supports her husband by selling animals. She purchases young animals from the animal market, raises them and sells them to the butchers. Besides her business, she also carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. She is the mother of three daughters. All of them are illiterate and support her in her daily household responsibilities. 

Bashiran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her animal sales business. With the loan, she will buy goats and sheep to raise and sell. She has been operating her business for some time now and is very confident that an investment will be a profitable one for her business.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Aminata. She is married to a petty trader and has 2 children, aged 18 and 29 years. 

In 2001, Aminata established her local goods stuff business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy millet - 2 bags @ SLL600,000, pepper - 3 bags @ SLL70,000 and garri - 4 bags @ SLL50,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL300,000. 

In the future, Aminata plan to educate her children to university level and build a dwelling house for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for millet - 2 bags @SLL600,000, pepper - 3 bags @ SLL70,000 and garri - 4 bags @ SLL50,000.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz’s husband is a butcher by profession. He provides fresh and good quality meat to his customers at very reasonable rates. His good services help him handle a good clientele base. Shahnaz is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is the mother of three children but none of them is able to attend school due to financial constraints.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats to be able to fulfill larger orders on time. Wedding season is near and Shahnaz is hopeful that her husband will be able to get great profits as a result of a loan investment. He has good experience in his business and has been operating it for the past 15 years. Shahnaz is confident about the positive growth of her husband’s business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 61 year-old Mohamed. He is married and has 8 children, aged 14, 16, 18, 20, 24, 26, 29 and 31 years. 

In 1972, Mohamed established his plastic slippers business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy children's plastic  slippers - 2 cartons @ SLL400,000, women's slippers - 3 cartons @ SLL450,000, men's slippers - 2 cartons @ SLL450,00 and assorted foam slippers - 5 bundles @ SLL300,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL300,000. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to open another outlet and hopes to send his children to college. He is hardworking and honest and, therefore, wants to continue his business until he retires. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for children's plastic  slippers - 2 cartons @ SLL400,000, women's slippers - 3 cartons @ SLL450,000,  men's slippers - 2 cartons SLL450,00 and assorted foam slippers - 5 bundles @ SLL300,000.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is married and her husband works in a private office at a monthly wage. Rehana is an educated lady. She is attached to a teaching profession and teaches in a nearby school. She has given birth to two sons. Her eldest one is a motor mechanic and the second one is studying in class 5th. Rehana is also a very good housewife and performs her household tasks very well.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her son’s motor workshop business. With the loan, he will buy spare parts and repair tools to provide better quality services to his customers. He is very good at his work and works with full dedication. He has been operating his business for the past five years. Rehana hopes that an investment will bring more profits to him and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair tools

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 43 year-old Kadiatu. She is married to a petty trader and has 3 children, aged 10, 12 and 18 years. All of her children are going to school. 

In 1996, Kadiatu established her palm oil and other local stuff business. She began her business because, although she is educated, she developed the passion of doing business when she got married.  Her husband helped her in starting her own little business till now and she can boast of having a good business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL1,100,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase palm oil - 5 drums @ SLL700,000 and garri - 30 bags @ SLL50,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL300,000. 

In the future, Kadiatu intended to go into supplying shop owners and retailers. She wants her children to live a good life and have a good education. She is a hard working and determined business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for palm oil - 5 drums @ SLL700,000 and garri - 30 bags @ SLL50,000.

loans.name: Aminata Issa

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Aminata.  She is divorced, and has four children who are 9, 13, 15, and 18 years old. In 1996, Aminata established her cosmetics, toiletries, baby clothing, and jewels business. She began her business because she learned from her mother. She used to help her mother after school hours by selling in the market. She later began her own little business and now this business is the main source of her income for the support of her children. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy 1 carton of cream @ Le 540,000,  2 cartons of Vaseline @ Le 600,000,  4 cartons of underwear @ Le 150,000, 1 carton of baby creams @ Le 360,000 and 2 cartons of assorted baby suits @ Le 120,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Aminata plans to educate her children to the university stage and build a house. Rise in transportation costs and the inflation rate are her major business challenges. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cream, Vaseline, underwear, baby cream and assorted baby suits

loans.name: Ruqiyya's Group

texts.en: Ruqiyya is 41 years old, married and has two sons. The eldest one runs a boutique and the youngest one has a furniture showroom.  Ruqiyya supports her son by making ready-made garments, which he displays in his boutique. She also has business contacts with different garment sellers at the market and offers them a good variety of ready-made garments at reasonable rates. Her husband is a factory worker and works for a low income. Ruqiyya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her ready-made garments business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk to expand her ready-made garments business. She has been operating her business for the past seven years and is very sure that her business will improve a lot after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a 54-year-old widow with six children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Since her husband died, she has been solely taking care of the family. She has been operating a hardware shop for 16 years. She got the initial capital from her late husband’s salary. Her hardship is the high revenue and her vision is to have a bigger wholesale shop and to educate her children. Rebecca needs the loan to buy different types of nails to sell.

loans.use: To buy different types of nails to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 30-year-old hardworking man living in his own house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been farming and riding a motorcycle for three years and this has facilitated him to build a permanent house and provide for his children. His hardship is road accidents and his vision is buying another motorcycle and finishing his house. Richard needs the loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en: This is 45-year-old Yawa. She is married and has four children who are 30, 25, 18 and 13 years old. For the past 15 years, Yawa has been selling cow skin to raise money to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Yawa serves mostly very poor people, as they cannot afford to buy meat but buy the cow skin because it is very cheap. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. Yawa has a good credit history and now needs a loan of Le 3,000,000. She needs a loan to buy more dried cow skin for her business. Yawa hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Yawa plans to build a house and educate her children very well. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more dried cow skin for her business.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is a 25-year-old young man. He is single and lives in Rafah city in Gaza Strip located in Palestine. Abdullah has a souvenir and accessories store that is the only source of income for him. Abdullah wants to purchase more souvenirs and accessories for his store to prepare for the coming Muslims Eid, but the amount of money Abdullah has isn't enough to pay for all of it, so he is in need of a loan for $1,200 from FATEN. When Abdullah gets the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase more goods and have a collection of various souvenirs and accessories, which will lead him to sell more and increase his income. Abdullah is photographed inside his store.

loans.use: To purchase more souvenirs and accessories to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 51-year-old married man with six children. He owns a house in Kasese,Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him and his desire is to educate his children up to university.

Julius has been operating a retail shop for five years, having acquired his initial capital from selling coffee. His hardships are debtors and inflation. His vision is a large scale retail shop. Julius needs this loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes  to sell.

loans.name: Hayam

texts.en: Hayam is a 35-year-old young woman.  She is married and has five sons and two daughters. She lives in Rafah City in Gaza Strip located in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets a decent salary. His salary is the only source of income the family has. Hayam wants to help pay the university fees for one of her sons. For this reason, and because of the low income the family has, Hayam need to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Hayam gets the FATEN loan, she will help her son to continue his university study and enable him to have a better education level. Hayam is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay university fees for her son.

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is a 45-year-old man. He is married and has six sons and four daughters. He lives in Rafah city in Gaza Strip located in Palestine. Emad is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets decent salary. He needs to pay for purchasing a new home refrigerator with better technology options, but his decent salary doesn't 'allow him to do that, so he is in need of a loan for 1,000 from FATEN. When Emad gets the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay easily to purchase a new home refrigerator and let his family live in healthier and better conditions.
Emad is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a new home refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 40 containers of palm oil

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu, 25 years old, is married and has 1 child aged 5 years old. Salamatu established her textiles business in 2004 because she got money from her father, who sold a piece of land and gave her some money to use as capital to begin selling food. As her capital continued to flourish, Salamatu switched over to the sale of textiles. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 890,480 monthly from this business.

Salamatu has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000 in order to buy 4 rolls of lace. 1 bale of real waxed cotton and 20 pieces of local cotton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 550,000 . In the future, Salamatu plans to further her education in nursing, educate her children and buy land. Salamatu travels once a month with a vehicle to get her goods from Guinea and Freetown. She is serious, hardworking and very excited about the expansion of her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy lace, waxed cotton and local cotton

loans.name: Volodymyr

texts.ru:
Володимир женат, у него есть 7-летняя дочка. Он живет в Ивано-Франковске, Западная Украина и работает таксистом в местной транспортной службе. Он предоставляет не только перевозки по городу, но также и пассажирские перевозки по всей Украине. Володимир работает в этой сфере вот уже 7 лет. Его валовый доход в месяц составляет 7 000 гривен.  

Володимир планирует использовать кредит в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести газобаллонное оборудование и переоснастить свой автомобиль для работы на сжиженном газе, что существенно снизит расходы на топливо. Этот бизнес – главный источник доходов для семьи клиента. До работы в службе транспортных перевозок Володимир работал в государственной службе охраны, но потом рассчитался и начал работать таксистом, когда жена родила дочку. В целях Володимира – дать образование дочери и со временем приобрести авто поновее. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Volodymyr is married and has a 7-year old daughter. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk in Western Ukraine and works as a taxi driver in the local transport service. He offers not only local   transportation services in his town but also long-distance transfers throughout the Ukraine. Volodymyr has been working in this business for seven years. His gross monthly income is 7,000 UAH.

Volodymyr plans to use his loan of 5,000 in order to buy equipment for compressed natural gas and make alterations to his car allowing it to run on CNG, which will substantially decrease his fuel expenses. This business is the main source of income for the client’s family. Before joining the transportation service, Volodymyr used to work in the state security service, but then, after his wife gave birth to a daughter, he left that employment and started working as a taxi driver. Volodymyr's goals are to provide for his daughter’s education and eventually to purchase a newer car.
Note: loan description is in Russian.

loans.use: to buy equipment for compressed natural gas and make alterations to his car allowing it to run on CNG, which will substantially decrease fuel costs.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана замужем, у нее двое детей. Оксана живет и работает в Дрогобыче, Западная Украина. У нее есть две торговые точки, где Оксана продает овощи и фрукты. Ее товар всегда свежий и по хорошей цене, поэтому многие постоянные клиенты едут к ней за покупками даже из других частей города. Оксана начала свое дело, когда осталась без работы 14 лет тому назад. Начинала с того, что вместе с мужем на стареньком авто они вывозили овощи и фрукты во дворы жилых домов и продавали их прямо с машины. Со временем приобрели киоск, а потом и еще один.  На данный момент у Оксаны товара на сумму в 20 000 гривен.  

Оксана планирует использовать кредит КИВА на сумму 12 000 гривен для того, чтобы достроить свой торговый киоск. У Оксаны есть желание работать и умение вести свой бизнес. Она – тот предприниматель, который может работать, расширять свой бизнес собственными усилиями и усердным трудом. В своем деле ей помогает вся семья. В ближайшем будущем Оксана хотела бы расширять свой бизнес и открывать дополнительные торговые точки. За счет прибыли Оксана планирует обеспечить детей возможностью получить достойное образование. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Oksana is married and has two children. Oksana lives and works in Drogobych, Western Ukraine. She has two shops where she sells fruit and vegetables. Her products are always fresh and sold for a good price, so many regular customers shop with her, even coming from other parts of the city. Oksana began her business when she was left without a job fourteen years ago. She started when she and her husband brought vegetables and fruit in an old car directly to houses and sold them from their car.  After a while, she bought one kiosk and then another. At present, Oksana's goods are valued at 20,000 hryvnia. 

Oksana plans to use a Kiva loan for 12,000 hryvnia to finish building another kiosk. Oksana has the desire to work and the ability to conduct business. She is an entrepreneur who can work to expand her business through her own effort and hard work. In her case, it helps the whole family. In the near future Oksana would like to expand her business and open additional shops. With her profit, Oksana plans to provide her children with the opportunity to get a decent education.

loans.use: to finish building a sales kiosk

loans.name: Ganna

texts.ru:
Ганна замужем. Она живет в небольшом городке под названием Королево. Ганна занимается продажей разнообразного товара в своем отделе в местном центральном универмаге,  а именно она продает женскую одежду, шторы, спальные одеяла и постельное белье. В этом универмаге конкурентов у Ганны нет. Она работает в этой сфере уже 11 лет. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8 000 гривен.  

Ганна обратилась за кредитом в КИВУ для того, чтобы приобрести новые спальные комплекты, ткань для шитья и женскую одежду. Дополнительная прибыль поможет Ганне увеличить и семейный бюджет, а в будущем, возможно, и открыть еще одну торговую точку, что ей давно хотелось бы осуществить.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Ganna is married. She lives in a small town called Korolyovo. Ganna sells various goods in her department at a local department store, and she sells women's clothing, curtains, blankets and bed linens. In the department store, Ganna has no direct competitors. She has worked in this field for eleven years. Her monthly income is 8000 hryvnia.

Ganna asked for a Kiva loan to acquire new bed linen sets, fabric, and women's clothes. The additional revenue will increase Ganna's family budget, and possibly allow her to open another shop in the future, which she has long wanted to do.

loans.use: to acquire new bed linen sets, fabric, and women's clothes

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.ru:
Анжела замужем. Она родом из Берегово. Анжела предприниматель, который занимается продажей мужской одежды. Она торгует этим товаром на базаре уже около 15 лет. Торговая точка расположена очень удачно, что способствует хорошим продажам. У Анжелы товара на 15 000 гривен. Ее прибыль составляет 3 500 гривен в месяц. 

Анжеле необходим кредит в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить товар для осеннего сезона. Анжела знает свою профессию и имеет богатый опыт работы, поэтому заранее готовится к похолоданию, что неизменно повлечет за собой повышение спроса на качественную и прочную обувь. Увеличив количество товара, она сможет и увеличить свой доход благодаря дополнительным продажам. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Anzhela is married. She comes from Beregovo. Anzhela is an entrepreneur who sells men's clothing. She has been selling these goods at the market for nearly fifteen years. Her shop is in a very good location, which contributes to good sales. Anzhela's goods are worth 15,000 hryvnia. Her profit is 3,500 hryvnia per month. 

Anzhela needed a loan of 20,000 hryvnia to buy goods for the fall season. Anzhela knows her profession and has extensive experience, so she plans ahead for cooler weather which invariably leads to increased demand for high quality, sturdy shoes. By increasing the quantity of her goods, she can increase her revenue through additional sales.

loans.use: to buy goods for autumn.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia es una mujer emprendedora de 33 años, quien está felizmente casada con Johan, su esposo, con quien tiene 4 hermosos hijos, está familia  vive en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana).
