Siempre tiene clientes, además como mantuvo un buen record de compras de una distribuidoras de gaseosas, le van a dar exhibidoras para sus productos, ella tiene grandes planes con su negocio, si bien por ahora el negocio esta bajo, ella cree que mas adelante podrá ampliar ya que uno de sus proyectos primordiales es el de agrandar su bodega y poner una fuente de soda.Este es el préstamo numero 17 entre Carmen y la institución, se siente bien en el grupo que esta y le agrada mucho poder trabajar con la institución MFP, y espera poder trabajando así ya que ella es socia fundadora de este banco comunal.Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles ella comprará más abarrotes y productos para su bodega, pues necesita invertir para poder percibir ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen, 53 years old, is a happy, hard-working, married woman. She and her husband live in her own house with her brother-in-law and their 4 children who are now adult and independent. Carmen's work consists of selling groceries from her house. For 9 years now she has done this, and can count on her husband's help.

What Carmen likes about her work is that it is independent; she has time available to do other activities.  She always has customers, and because she has a good sales record with a soft drink distributor, she is going to receive display cases for her products. Carmen has big plans for her business, although at the moment the store is small. She believes that further along, she will be able to expand. One of her most important projects is to enlarge her store and install a soda fountain.

This is Carmen's 17th loan with this institution. She feels good about her group and is very grateful to be able to work with MFP.  And Carmen, who is a founding member of her communal bank, wants to continue the relationship. 

With the 1,200 new sols requested she will buy more groceries and products for her general store, because she needs to invest to be able to receive earnings.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and products for her general store, because she needs to invest to be able to receive earnings.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 31 años, es una mujer muy feliz; pues vive junto a su esposo Freddy con quien tiene 2 hijos: Brayan y Cielo, en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Cachunayo. Desde sus cortos 18 años comenzó en el noble oficio de la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de alverjas, maíz y demás hortalizas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el apoyo que recibe de su esposo, pues le ayuda en los constantes cuidados que le brinda a sus sembríos. Además de tener los terrenos cerca al río lo cual le beneficia en el crecimiento inmediato de sus cultivos. “Ahora estoy en la cosecha de alverja, donde obtendré buenas ganancias”, afirma. Su principal problema son los gastos de los estudios de su hijo mayor, pues comenzó a estudiar y ahora minimiza los gastos de mantenimiento de sus cultivos. Más agradece el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja como taxista en el trasporte público; cubriendo las rutas Tarma – Palca, donde obtiene un dinero extra. Por ello más adelante está pensando comprar su propia casa, y de esa manera aliviar los gastos de arriendo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Luzmila de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 20 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus sembríos de maíz de 10 parcelas.
texts.en: Luzmila, age 31, is a very happy woman; she lives with her husband Freddy, with whom she has 2 children: Brayan and Cielo. They live in a rented home in the Cachunayo locality. She has worked in the noble office of agriculture from the young age of 18. Her main crops are peas, corn and other vegetables. What she most enjoys about her work is the support she receives from her husband, who helps her to offer constant care to the crops. As well, they have their lands near to the river, which benefits the crops' growth. "I am now harvesting the peas, and I will make a good income", she says. Her main problem is her oldest son's education fees, as he is starting his studies. She is trying to minimize the cost of maintaining her crops. She is even more grateful for her husband's support. He works as a taxi driver in public transportation, covering the Tarma-Palca route and making an additional income. Because of this, they are thinking of buying their own home in the future, thus freeing themselves from the cost of renting. Luzmila belongs to the "Senor de Muruhuay" communal bank, and this is her tenth loan with MFP. She is grateful for the support that she is recieving. Furthermore, she promises to be punctual with the payment of her quotas. Luzmila, upon receiving your support, will invest the requested loan in the purchase of 20 bags of natural fertilizer to spread on the 10-parcel field where she has sown corn.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, de 40 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Omar quien trabaja con ella y juntos desean poderle brindar a su querido hijo Aldair una mejor vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Marcela trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, junto a su esposo siembran semestralmente habas, maíz, choclos y gladiolos, los cuales venden en los mercados de Tarma y La Merced, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta los mercados donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus productos y así obtener mejores precios y está segura de lograrlo, ya que su esposo comenzó con un negocio de compra y venta de diversos productos en la capital del país, donde obtiene buenas ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde se siente beneficiada en su crecimiento como agricultora. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Marcela de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales que esparcirá en su próximo sembrío de maíz.
texts.en:
Marcela, age 40, is a happy and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Omar.  He works with her, and together they wish to be able to give their beloved son, Aldair, a better life.

By working with their crops arduously every day Marcela tries to change the life that she currently lives.  Together with her husband they semiannually plant corn, sweet corn, and gladiolas.  They sell them at the markets in Tarma and La Merced, which is where they get the best prices.

What she likes the most about her work is taking care of the crops so that they are free of pest infestations.  She has been doing this for 20 years.  She considers the most difficult part to be taking her crops to the markets where she sells them.  The sacks she takes are very heavy.

Later she hopes to improve her products and get better prices.  She is sure that she will do it.  Her husband started a business of buying and selling diverse products in the capital of the country.  He gets good prices there.

She belongs to the Señor de Muruhuay Communal Bank.  This is her ninth loan with MFP, where she has benefitted in her growth as a farmer.  Therefore, she pledges to be punctual with her payments.  Upon receiving your support Marcela will use the requested loan to buy various sacks of natural fertilizers to scatter on her next corn crop.

loans.use: to buy various sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.es: Ellen, de 46 años, es una mujer siempre sonriente, emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante y progresar. Ella es madre de cuatro hijos, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos y su pareja. El trabajo de Ellen consiste en la venta de menús desde su casa, ahí hace esta actividad ya desde hace 20 años, con eso educó y crió a sus hijos. Ellen realiza esta actividad con la ayuda de su hija, quien con una ayudante más colaboran con ella en su trabajo.Todo le gusta de su trabajo, ya que le encanta cocinar y es bueno trabajar en algo que le gusta y que le permite ganar dinero. Ella aparte de tener este negocio también tiene en alquiler dos mototaxis y un lavadero de vehículos que le generan mas ingresos extras a la actividad que ella realiza. Este es el décimo préstamo entre Ellen y la institución MFP. A ella le gusta trabajar con su grupo y esta muy agradecida de trabajar con la institución ya que en las veces anteriores le ayudaron a crecer en su economía.Con el monto solicitado 600 soles, ella comprará algunos víveres e ingredientes para la venta de comida que realiza.
texts.en:
Ellen, age 46, is an enterprising woman who is always happy.  She has the desire to get ahead and progress.  She lives in her own house with her four children and her life partner.

Ellen sells food at her house.  She has been in this business at her house for 20 years.  With this business she educated and raised her children.  Her daughter helps Ellen with this business activity, and she has another helper who works with her.  She likes everything about her work because she loves to cook.  It is good to work at something that you like, and it allows her to earn money.

Besides this business she also rents out two “mototaxis” (three wheeled motorized vehicles) and has a car wash that generates extra income for her business activity.

This is the tenth loan between Elien and the MFP institution.  She like working in her group, and she is very grateful to be working with the institution.  MFP has previously helped her finances to grow.  She will use the requested 600 soles to buy some supplies and ingredients for the sale of the food that she makes.

loans.use: to buy some supplies and ingredients for the sale of the food that she makes.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es: Evelyn en una joven mujer, tiene 24 años, es muy trabajadora y sobre todo la conocen por ser muy responsable. Hace varios años que vive con su pareja y sus dos menores hijos en la casa de sus suegros.El trabajo de Evelyn consiste en la venta de comida. Cuando empieza a caer la noche ella sale con su mesa y sillas a la vereda de su casa para empezar su jornada de trabajo diario, ella vende comida con productos regionales, lleva ya más de un año en este trabajo que hace sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el tiempo que tiene a disposición por el día para poder cuidar a sus pequeños hijos, siempre vende regular. Espera más adelante poder agrandar su negocio y poder tener un terreno propio ya que no le gusta estar aún viviendo en casa de sus suegros.Este es el préstamo numero dos entre Evelyn t la institución MFP, espera poder seguir trabajando juntos pues se siente bien tanto con la institución así como con sus compañeras de grupo. Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, ella comprará ingredientes e insumos para la preparación de su comida, además necesita algunos implementos necesarios para realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a young woman, 24 years of age. She is very hardworking and above all is known for being very responsible. She has lived with her partner and their two minor children in the home of her in-laws for several years. Evelyn's work consists of selling food. When night begins to fall she goes outside with her table and chairs to the sidewalk in front of her house to begin her daily work shift. She sells foods using regional products and has been doing this work, alone, for more than one year. What she likes about her work is the time she has available during the day to be able to care for her young children, and her sales are always pretty good. 

In the future she hopes to be able to expand her business and have her own plot of land since she doesn't care to be living still in the home of her in-laws. This is the second loan between Evelyn and the institution MFP. She hopes to be able to continue working together since she feels good about the institution and the other members of the group. With the 800 soles she has requested, she will purchase ingredients and supplies for the preparation of her food. She also needs some implements for doing her work.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies for preparing her food, and also some implements she needs to do her work.

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Chilcatotoras, vive por la parroquia de Turi, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y muchos laboran diariamente en la ciudad de Cuenca, su población mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora María tiene 55 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, 4 de ellos son casados e independientes y sus hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente. Su esposo labora como albañil y la casa en la que habita es el fruto del trabajo conyugal.

Doña María se dedica a la ganadería y vende la leche que obtiene de sus vacas. Hace 5 meses también cuenta con una tienda de comestibles en la que trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y  lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
 
Su meta es mejorar su tienda y ampliarla.
texts.en:
Ms. María is a member of the communal bank Mujeres de Chilcatotoras [Women of Chilcatotoras]. She lives by the Turi parish, a place with a cold climate. Her people devote themselves to livestock and crop farming, and many labor daily in the city of Cuenca. The people maintain their culture and traditions. 

Ms. María is 55 years old, married, and as fruit of her marriage has conceived seven children: four of them are married and independent, and her unmarried children work and help her financially. Her husband works in construction and the house they inhabit is the fruit of the couple's own efforts. 

Doña María devotes herself to livestock farming and sells the milk she obtains from their cows. Five months ago she also began a grocery store where she works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank and will invest it in the purchase of basic staples for stocking her store. 

Her goal is to improve and expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase basic staples for her store.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina tiene 39 años, es una mujer amable, sencilla y sobre todo muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edwin de 40 años y su querido hijo Cristian de 05 años, a quien desea brindar un mejor futuro. La tienda de abarrotes de Reina es una de las más concurridas en el poblado de Quimbiri, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse y la ultima en cerrarse.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus consumidores sobre la calidad y variedad de cada producto, lleva 10 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda en espera de clientes ya que de eso depende sus ingresos económicos gracias a la venta de sus mercaderías, Reina compró variedad de bienes para su hogar y para el bien de su negocio solicita el crédito para poder comprar las provisiones necesarias para su puesto de ventas. Este será su tercer crédito de Reina y esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de ustedes para seguir prosperando. En su banco comunal es una socia participe. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche y entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Riena is 39 years old. She is a friendly, simple and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her 40-year-old husband Edwin and her dear 5-year-old son Cristian, who she hopes to provide with a better future. Reina’s grocery shop is one of the busiest in the town of Quimbiri. Her great charisma and the kindness in her customer service have made her the favorite among her neighbors, who do not hesitate to make their purchases starting very early, since they know that hers is the first store to open and the last one to close.
What she likes the most about her job is giving advice to her customers about the quality and variety of every product. She has been in this business for 10 years, and what she considers the most difficult is having to stay in her store all day waiting for customers, since this is what her income is dependent on – thanks to the sale of her merchandise. Reina bought a variety of goods for her home and, for the good of her business, she is requesting the loan to be able to buy the necessary provisions for her sales point. This will be Reina’s third loan and she is very happy to know that she will once again have your support to continue prospering. She is an active member in her communal bank.  With the three thousand new Peruvian soles requested, she will buy provisions for her grocery store: sacks of rice, sugar, milk and other goods.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, milk and other goods.

loans.name: Nelly Estela

texts.es:
La Señora Nelly es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Chilcatotoras, vive por la parroquia de Turi, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca, su población mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña  Nelly tiene 28 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 8, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la escuela. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive con su mamá con quien comparte los gastos. 

La Señora Nelly se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar ya que cuida de sus hijos que aun son pequeños, también cría cuyes y ganado comercializando la leche que obtiene de sus vacas. Otra de sus ocupaciones es la agricultura y lo que cosecha es  para el consumo de su casa. 

Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas y en el alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ms. Nelly is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres de Chilcatotoras" who lives by the Turi parish. This is a place with a cold climate whose people devote themselves to livestock and crop farming. Many work in the city of Cuenca, and the people keep up their culture and traditions. 

Doña Nelly is 28 years old, married, and has conceived as fruit of her conjugal bond three children who are eight, five and three years of age. Her first two children attend school. Her husband works in construction. She does not have her own home and so lives with her mom with whom she shares expenses. 

Ms. Nelly devotes herself to the household tasks as she is taking care of her children who are still young. She also raises guinea pigs and cattle, selling the milk she obtains from her cows. Another of her occupations is crop farming and what she harvests is for the consumption of her household. 

This is her third loan in the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of hens and feed for her animals. 

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy hens and animal feed.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía, de 22 años, es una joven muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridos hijos Rivao de 05 y Carlos de 01 año de edad, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana Rosalía abre su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus vecinos, ella es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre los termina convenciendo de comprar algo más. Su tienda esta muy bien surtida de productos de primera necesidad tales como arroz, leche, variedad de cereales y menestras ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar los productos más consumidos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su entorno vecinal, lleva 03 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el lapso del día. Rosalía solicita el crédito para poder comprar  lo nesario para su bodega. Para el bien de sus ingresos económicos,espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para poder vender más productos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y se siente muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente los pagos  programados. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más sacos de arroz, azúcar conservas y entre otros productos.
texts.en: Rosalía is 22 years old. She is friendly and hardworking young woman. She lives in her own home with her two beloved children, Rivao, 5 and Carlos, 1. They are the main reason she works so hard. Early every morning, Rosalía opens her store to serve her neighbors. She is a very deft saleswoman and knows how to treat her customers and she always convinces them to buy something more. Her store is very well stocked with basic necessity products such as rice, milk, some cereals and vegetable stews. She always takes care to buy the products that are the most popular. What she likes the most about her job is talking to customers and finding out about things that are happening n the neighborhood. She has been doing this activity for 3 years and she thinks the hardest thing is being on her feet all day long. Rosalía is asking for the loan to be able to buy what she needs for her store. For the good of her income, she wants to expand the fixtures in her store to be able to sell more products. This is her second loan with MFP and she feels very happy to know she will have financial support. This way, she will feel sure that she can buy what she she has ordered and she is willing to make the payments on time. With the two thousand nuevos soles she has asked for, she will buy more sacks of rice, sugar, preserves and other products.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, preserves and other products.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
La Señorita Sandra es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Chilcatotoras, vive por la parroquia de Turi, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería,  agricultura y muchos labora en la ciudad de Cuenca, su población mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señorita Sandra tiene 19 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 4 años de edad. Vive en casa de sus padres, su padre se dedica a laborar como albañil y su madre a la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es propia.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica al cuidado de su hija y está estudiando turismo en una universidad de la ciudad. En su casa se dedica a la cría cuyes y pollos.
 
En el banco comunal es socia fundadora de este hermoso grupo, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir para ampliar el galpón de cuyes.
 
Su meta es ser una gran profesional.

En la fotografía de encuentra nuestra socia con su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the Mujeres de Chilcatotoras communal bank. She lives in the Turi parish. It has a cold climate and ots people work with cattle, and farming. Many of them work in the city of Cuenca. Its people keep their culture and tradition.  

Sandra is 19 years old. She is a single mother of a 4 year old girl. She lives in her parents' house. Her father is a bricklayer and her mother is a farmer. They own the house they live in. 
 
Sandra takes care of her daughter and she is studying tourism at the university in the city. She raises guinea pigs and chickens in her house. She is a founding member of this beautiful group. The money from the loan will be invested in expanding the guinea pig enclosure. 
 
Her goal is to be a great professional woman. In the photo, she is with her little daughter.

loans.use: to enlarge the guinea pig enclosure.

loans.name: Saliciana

texts.es: Saliciana, de 34 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Teofilo de 40 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos verdes de su pradera han sido en la vida de Saliciana un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio, sus cultivos de cacao, café y frutos de plátano, poseyendo en total 02 hectáreas de terreno. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos desde su chacra hasta los centros de acopio situado en la ciudad de San Francisco. Con el crédito solicitado comprará materiales para terminar de acondicionar su vivienda. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras para luego poder heredarlos a sus queridos hijos. Este será su séptimo crédito con MFP y por lo cual necesita el apoyo de los financistas para llevar consigo  su propósito, además se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente y esta agradecida por ser socia de su banco comunal. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará calaminas, clavos y tablones.
texts.en:
34-year-old Saliciana is a very responsible and hardworking mother. She lives in a house she owns with her husband, 40-year-old Teofilo, and her three beloved children, whose quality of life she wishes to improve. In Saliciana's life, the green fields of her land have been a very pleasant place to work. Her parents taught her this kind of labor since she was very young, and now she owns her own land which she works on with great care and sacrifice. She has cacao, coffee and plantain crops and owns a total of 2 hectares of land. What she likes most about her work is to harvest her land, because that is how she feels that the months of hard work are rewarded by the quality of her produce. She has been in the business for 15 years and believes that the hardest part is transporting her crop from her farm to the stockpile centers located in the city of San Francisco.
With the requested loan she will purchase materials in order to finish setting up her house. In time, she hopes to save enough money to buy more land so she can leave it to her beloved children as inheritance. This will be her seventh loan with MFP and because of that she needs the support of the lenders in order to fulfill her goal. Furthermore, she is committed to making her repayments punctually and thankful for being a member of her communal bank. With the 3.000 nuevos soles she requested, she will purchase corrugated metal sheets, nails and wood planks.

loans.use: to purchase corrugated metal sheets, nails and wood planks for her house.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es:
Cindy, es una mujer alegre y joven, vive en casa de sus suegros junto a su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 3 y 2 años de edad. El trabajo de Cindy consiste en la venta de zapatos, ella compra los zapatos de la ciudad de Lima y los vende en la ciudad cerca de su casa y cuando le faltan mercadería por vender busca clientes entre sus familiares y amigos. Este trabajo lo hace sola, únicamente cuando sale en busca de los clientes sale con la compañía de su pareja, quien es músico en una conocida orquesta de la ciudad.
Cindy realiza este trabajo recién hace seis meses, hasta ahora le ha ido bien y espera que le vaya igual. En el futuro ella espera poder consolidar su negocio para así generar ingresos más beneficiosos para su economía.
Este es el segundo préstamo entre Cindy y la institución MFP, le agrada mucho el grupo que esta donde llegó gracias a que la garantizara una señora fundadora, es por eso que espera pueda seguir cumpliendo como hasta ahora.Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, ella comprar zapatos para seguir con el negocio que empezó meses atrás.
texts.en:
Cindy P. is a happy young woman who lives in her in-law's house together with her partner, with whom she has two children aged 3 and 2 years old.  

Cindy's works consists of selling shoes.  She buys the shoes in the city of Lima and sells them in the city near to her home, and when she needs sales she looks for customers among her friends and family.  She does this work on her own; it is only when she goes out to look for customers that her husband comes with her.  He is a musician in a well-known orchestra in the city.

Cindy has been doing this work for the last six months.  So far, it has been going well, and she hopes it will continue to do so.  In the future, she hopes to be able to solidify her business so as to generate more beneficial earnings for her financial situation.

This is the second loan for Cindy with the MFP institution; she is very grateful for the group which she joined thanks to the assurances of one of the founding ladies.  For this reason, she hopes to continue being compliant with her repayments, as she has up to this point.

With the requested amount of 800 New Soles, she will buy shoes so as to be able to continue with the business that she started a few months back.

loans.use: to buy shoes so as to continue with the business that she started a few months ago.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 36 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 06 queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanta voluntad y entrega han logrado cultivar Silvia y su esposo, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao y café y achiotes, dependerá la calidad y el precio que obtenga.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y frondosos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es transportar los pesados sacos de los productos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, lugar donde recibe mejores precios por sus granos. Silvia solicita el crédito para contratar jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en el mantenimiento respectivo de sus plantas como en la poda y el deshierbo de malezas. Más adelante, espera sembrar más plantas de cacao ya que cuenta con espacios sin cultivar. Este será su octavo préstamo con MFP y se siente feliz por contar con el apoyo de los financistas ya que gracias al apoyo de ellos esta prosperando, Silvia en esta oportunidad también espera beneficiarse con el crédito por lo cual ella esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en el desmonte y cosechas de sus productos.
texts.en:
Silvia, 36, is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home along with her six beloved children, who are the main motivation for all her efforts. The products, the growth of which, with so much willingness and dedication, Silvia and her husband have accomplished, have helped them a lot in their lives' progress. Every morning she begins to work on their land, since she knows that the quality of her crops and price she obtains will depend on the care she provides to her plantings of cocoa, coffee and achiote. What she most enjoys about her work is caring for the crops and she feels very happy when she sees them large and leafy. She has been in this business for ten years, and considers the most difficult part to be transporting the heavy sacks of her product to the city of San Francisco [Peru], a place where she receives better prices for her crops. 

Silvia is seeking the loan to hire laborers to provide them support in the respective maintenance of their plants, such as pruning and removing weeds. In the future she hopes to plant more cocoa, since she has spaces which remain uncultivated. This will be her eighth loan with MFP and she is happy to have the lenders' support since, thanks to their support she is prospering. Silvia wishes to benefit from the loan at this time as well, and so she is willing to make her payments punctually. With the 2,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting, she will hire day laborers to help them with clearing the land and harvesting the products.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Yhony

texts.es: Yhony, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri de 25 años, es una mujer carismática y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Crispín de 22 años y su querido hijo Dyron de 02 años, a quien desea brindarle un buen provenir. Yhony mujer de ardua labor, lucha por sobresalir adelante con su puesto de ventas donde ofrece al público variedad de productos entre  menestras, cereales y entre otros, ella abre las puertas de su bodega desde tempranas horas y esta lista en espera de sus primeros parroquianos quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que ofrece terminan comprándole de dos a mas productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dialogar con los niños, quiene son sus pequeños consumidores y siempre acuden a la tienda por los mandatos de sus madres. Yhony menciona que adquirió el capital gracias al apoyo de los financistas quienes depositaron su confianza en ella y hoy su negocio le es muy rentable. Con el tiempo, anhela  crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP y en esta oportunidad espera seguir beneficiándose con el crédito  para seguir prosperando y por lo cual ella esta decidida a cumplir con el pago de su préstamo puntualmente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles comprará, variedad de conservas, azúcar, leche, arroz y otros productos.
texts.en:
Yhony is from the city of Quimbiri.  She’s 25 years old.  She’s a charismatic, hardworking woman living in a rented house with her husband, Crispín, 22, and her beloved son, Dyron, 2, that she wants to provide a good future for.

Yhony, a woman who works hard, strives to get ahead with her stand where she sells a variety of products, like vegetables and cereals, among others, to the general public.  She opens her store’s doors very early and awaits her first customers of the day who, aware of the variety of goods she stocks, end up buying two or more items from her.  What she most enjoys about her work is chatting with the children who are her little consumers and always come to her store on some errand for their mothers.

Yhony mentions that she got the capital thanks to support from lenders who trusted her and today her business is quite profitable.  In time, she hopes to make her business grow and offer her customers still better service.  This will be her second MFP loan and she hopes to continue to benefit herself through the loan to continue making progress.  She is, therefore, determined to repay her loan punctually.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy a variety of canned goods, sugar, milk, rice and other products.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 35 años es una mujer trabajadora y alegre. Está esperando un bebé y está muy feliz, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 12 años.El trabajo de Liz consiste en la venta de salchipapas y hamburguesas por las noches. Este trabajo lo realiza sola en su casa desde varios años. Durante los últimos días no estuvo saliendo ya que debido a su estado de gestación, pero ella confía en que poco a poco estará volviendo a sus laborales normalmente. Le gusta todo lo que hace, pues le encanta cocinar y siempre esta disponible para todo tipo de trabajo. Siempre tiene clientes y vende mucho, por el momento solo espera mantener su negocio como va ya que siente que esta bien por ahora.Este es el décimo préstamo entre Liz y la institución MFP, se siente cómoda con el grupo al que pertenece y espera poder seguir trabajando con Prisma ya que esta muy agradecida por que le dan la oportunidad de crecer.Con el monto solicitado 1100 soles, ella comprará ingrediente e insumos para su negocio, ya que esta retomando la actividad después de algunos días de haber dejado.
texts.en:
Liz, aged 35, is a hard-working and happy woman.  She is expecting a baby, and is very happy about it.  She lives in her own house together with her husband and 12-year-old child.

Liz's work consists of selling salchipapas (sliced hot dog and french fries) and hamburgers in the evenings.  She has been doing this work on her own from home for several years.  She hasn't been able to work recently due to her pregnancy, but she is confident that little by little she will return to her normal work.  She likes everything about what she does, as she loves to cook and is always available for any type of work.  She always has customers, and sells a great deal.  For now, she is only hoping to keep her business going as it is, as she feels its going very well for now.

This is the tenth loan for Liz with the MFP institution.  She feels comfortable with the group to which she belongs, and hopes to be able to continue working with Prisma, as she is very grateful for them giving her the opportunity to grow.

She will buy ingredients and supplies for her business with the requested amount of 1,100 Soles, as she is returning to her work after having to take some time off.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her business, as she is returning to work after having to take some time off.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha es socia del banco comunal Las Cuencanitas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una hermosa arquitectura colonia y esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía es muy variada, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Martha tiene 42 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 21 y 19 años de edad quienes trabajan. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Martha es vendedora ambulante de confeti y juguetes, actividad que la desempeña hace 15 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de juguetes y confeti para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es continuar con su negocio pero con su propio capital y sin deudas.
texts.en:
Ms. Martha is a member of the communal bank Las Cuencanitas who lives in the city of Cuenca. This city has beautiful colonial architecture, and is washed by four rivers. The city's cuisine is highly diverse, its people friendly and polite, and they maintain the culture and traditions of their forebears. 

Doña Martha is 42 years old, the single mother of two children, 21 and 19, who are working. She does not have her own home and so she rents. 

Ms. Martha is a street vendor of confetti and toys, a business she has had for 15 years. She works seven days a week without a fixed schedule. This is her second loan with the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of toys and confetti for her business. 

Her dream is to stay in business but with her own capital and without debt.

loans.use: to purchase toys and confetti.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. Dolores es socia del banco comunal Las Cuencanitas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una hermosa arquitectura colonia y esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía es muy variada, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Dolores tiene 44 años, es separada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 26, 17 y 15 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Dolores se dedica a vender choclomote (delicioso plato típico de Cuenca), vende su producto ambulantemente en una carreta, trabaja de lunes a sábados.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 10 años  y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra mote, choclo, queso y huevos para su negocio.
 
Su meta es darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Dolores is a member of the communal bank "Las Cuencanitas".  She lives in the city of Cuenca; this city has beautiful colonial architecture, and is surrounded by 4 rivers.  It's cuisine is very varied, its people are kind and friendly, and they keep up their culture and the traditions of their ancestors.

Doña Dolores is 44 years old.  She is separated, and has 3 children from her marriage aged 26, 17, and 15.  Her eldest child works and helps her out financially; her two younger children are attending school.  She doesn't own her own home, so she lives in a rental.

Señora Dolores works selling choclomote (a delicious dish that is typically Cuencan).  She sells her product as a street vendor, and works from Monday through Saturday.

She has been part of the communal bank for ten years, and she will be investing her loan in purchasing hominy, corn, cheese and eggs for her business.  Her goal is to provide her children with the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy hominy, corn, cheese and eggs.

loans.name: Yabar

texts.es: Yabar tiene 44 años, es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de dos años y otro de un mes de nacido, vive en casa propia. El trabajo de Yabar consiste en salir temprano de su hogar en busca de cargamento en el mercado de Bellavista. Ahí él tiene clientes a quienes presta el servicio de transporte de mercaderías, y por las tardes él se va al mercado mayorista para seguir con ese trabajo, Lleva haciendo este trabajo ya por aproximadamente cinco años, y lo hace solo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene su tiempo a disposición, además que siempre tiene clientes ya que es un muy cuidadoso cuando le toca hacer transporte de la mercadería. Espera poder mantenerse como hasta ahora ya que tiene un trabajo fuerte y por el momento no puede exigirse mucho. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, está contento con el grupo que conforma y espera poder seguir recibiendo más préstamos de la institución ya que gracias a los desembolsos recibidos comprar un vehículo ya que antes  trabajaba en triciclo. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, el realizará el pago de su moto y hacerle algunos ajustes técnicos.
texts.en:
Yabar, 44, is a hardworking and very responsible man, who lives in a committed relationship with his partner with whom he has two children, two years old and the other a newborn of one month. He lives in his own home. Yabar's work consists of leaving his home early in search of cargo in the marketplace of Bellavista. There he has customers to whom he provides transportation services for merchandise. In the afternoons he goes to the wholesale market to continue working. He has been doing this work now for approximately five years, and works alone. What he likes about his work is that he is on his own time, and also that he always has customers, since he is super careful when it comes to transporting merchandise. He hopes to keep on the way he has been up to now, since he has a lot of work and for the time being is not able to demand much mO. of himself. 

This is his fourth loan with MFP. He is happy with the group he belongs to and hopes to continue receiving mO. loans from the institution. Thanks to the disbursements he has received he bought a vehicle, since befO. he was working by tricycle. With the 1,000 soles he has requested he will make payments on his motorcycle, as well as some technical adjustments to it.

loans.use: to finish paying off the vehicle he uses to transport wholesale merchandise.

loans.name: Mónica Jhanina

texts.es:
La Señora Mónica es socia del banco comunal Las Cuencanitas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una hermosa arquitectura colonia y esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía es muy variada,  su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señora Mónica tiene 36 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos de 13, 6, 3, 2 años y un bebé de 7 meses, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos hijas en la escuela. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Mónica es comerciante ambulante, vende varios artículos como antenas, guantes y más productos de temporada, lleva 15 años en el negocio trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería como: guantes, pilas, gorras, fosforeras, antenas, etc. para seguir con su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mónica is a member of the Las Cuencanitas communal bank. She lives in Cuenca city. This city has beautiful colonial architecture and is surrounded by 4 rivers. Its gastronomy is quite varied, and its people are kind and friendly, and maintain the culture and traditions of their fathers.

Mrs. Monica is 36. She is in a common-law marriage and has 5 children with her partner, ages 13, 6, 3, 2, and a baby of 7 months. Her oldest son is in high school, and her two daughters are in elementary school. Her husband is a merchant. They do not have their own home, as they rent.

Mrs. Monica is a street vendor. She sells various items such as antennas, gloves, and seasonal products. She has had this business for 15 years and works every day of the week without a fixed schedule.

This is her second loan in the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of merchandise such as: gloves, batteries, caps, matches, antennas, etc., in order to continue with her business.

Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase gloves, batteries, caps, matches, antennas, etc.

loans.name: Milka

texts.es: Milka  es una mujer muy carismática, trabajadora y sobre todo muy activa, es madre de una hija de 4 años, viene con ella y su esposo en casa de su suegra. El trabajo de Milka consiste en la venta de golosinas en su casa, además vente productos por catálogo como cosméticos y accesorios, por ello tiene una gran cantidad de productos en stock. Lleva ya en esta actividad casi cinco años y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo y puede estar junto a su hija. Siempre tiene clientes, ya que es muy conocida entre las consultoras de producto de belleza, por ello espera arreglar e implementar su pequeño puesto para exhibir su productos, tanto de golosinas como los productos de belleza. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con trabajo. Con el monto solicitad,  comprará productos entre golosinas y bebidas, asimismo abastecerse de cosméticos.
texts.en: Milka is a very charismatic and hard-working woman, and above all she is very active. She is the mother of a 4 year old daughter. She, her daughter, and her husband live in her mother-in-law's home. Milka sells candies in her home, and she also sells products such as cosmetics and accessories through a catalogue. For this reason, she has a large quantity of products in stock. She has already done this work for almost five years, and what she enjoys about her job is that she has time and can be with her daughter. She always has customers, as she is well-known among the beauty product consultants. For this reason she hopes to repair and stock her small stall in order to display her products; the candies as well as the beauty products. This is her third loan from MFP, and she hopes for the support of every one of you in order to continue with her work. With the requested loan, she will purchase products: candies and drinks, and stock up on cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase candies and cosmetics.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Banga, in the province of South Cotabato. She does not have any children yet and prays that she will have one soon.

Edelyn is a farmer. She and her husband own the land that they till together. They grow rice, corn, and vegetables for sale. Edelyn also runs the couple's small sari-sari (convenience) store. She sells items such as vinegar, sugar, soap, and shampoo.

Edelyn has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 51-year-old married woman who lives with her family in the town of Banga, in the province of South Cotabato. She and her husband are both farmers.

Elena helps her husband grow rice and corn.  She also manages the couple's sari-sari (convenience) store, where she sells items such as shampoo, soap, sugar, and canned goods. She works hard to improve their businesses and provide for her family's household needs.

Elena has requested a loan to purchase 2 sacks of fertilizers, 1 quart of herbicides, and more items to sell at the sari-sari store. She hopes the businesses will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of fertilizers, 1 quart of herbicides, and more items to sell at the sari-sari store

loans.name: Tunjung Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut is 42 years old and lives in Melaya, West Bali.  Ni Ketut often helps her husband. She also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income. She has been raising pigs for eight years.  

Ni Ketut is the head of the Tunjung Wiguna group, which is made up of 10 neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s third loan with MUK.  With the Rp 1,500,000 that Ni Ketut receives, she will purchase three or four piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork. With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to save for her children's future.

loans.use: To purchase three to four piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar tiene 50 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor, vive en compañía de su esposa y 4 hijos de los 5 que tienen, en una casa que es propia. El trabajo de Cesar consiste en salir temprano de su casa en busca de clientes, a quienes ofrece helados en un triciclo que posee. Es así como recorre las diversas calles de su localidad, ofreciendo este producto, pues por vivir en una zona selva hay mucha demanda de refrescos y helados. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, por0que tiene tiempo para estar en su casa y poder administrar su horario. En adelante desea comprar un vehículo, para así vender helados y en menor tiempo recorrer las calles en busca de clientes. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, se reintegró a su grupo después de un ciclo, pues por enfermedad se tuvo que alejar para no fallar a su grupo con las cuotas. Él está muy agradecido de contar con la ayuda de MFP ya que gracias a la institución dice pudo construir su casa por que siempre creyeron en él y siempre le dieron la oportunidad de poder crecer. Con el monto solicitado, comprará helados para abastecer su negocio, y así trabajar doble turno.
texts.en: Cesar is 50. He is a very hard-working and enterprising man who lives with his wife and 4 of their 5 children in their own home. Cesar goes out early to look for customers, to whom he offers ice cream from his tricycle. He cycles through the various streets in his neighbourhood, offering this product. Because they live in a tropical area there is a great demand for drinks and ice creams. He greatly enjoys what he does, because he has time to be at home and he can control his schedule. In the future he wants to buy a vehicle for selling ice cream, in order to get around more quickly in search of customers. He is very grateful to be able to count on MFP's help, as he says that thanks to the institution he has been able to build his home because they always believed in him and always gave him the opportunity to grow. With the requested loan, he will purchase ice cream to stock his business, and thus double his work.

loans.use: to buy ice cream.

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es: Yrma tiene 57 años, es una mujer valiente y emprendedora, es viuda y es madre de dos hijos que ya son mayores y tienen su propia familia cada uno, ella vive junto a ellos en su casa propia que pudo comprar con bastante esfuerzo. Yrma se dedica a la venta de ropa, este trabajo lo hace en su casa durante tres años, felizmente tiene la ayuda sus hijas, a vender sus prendas entre amigos y familiares. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para realizar otras actividades, además de poder trabajar junto a sus hijas ya que como es viuda no le gusta mucho tiempo estar sola. En su negocio tiene clientes buenos y siempre son puntuales como ella. Espera poder mantener su negocio ya que le da lo suficiente como para que pueda vivir tranquila. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP0, está tranquila de pertenecer al grupo ya que se siente cómoda trabajando con personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado, comprará ropa para seguir con su trabajo junto a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Yrma is 57 years old.  She is a brave and enterprising woman.  She is a widow and has two children who are now adults and have their own families.  They live with her in her house that she as able to buy with a lot of hard work.  Yrma has been selling clothing out of her house for three years and she is happy that she has the help of her daughters.  She sells her clothing to friends and family.  What she likes most about her job is that it leaves her time for other activities as well as being able to work with her daughters as she is a widow and doesn't like to spend a lot of time alone.  She has good customers who are always punctual.

She hopes to be able to keep her business going as it gives her what she needs to live a peaceful life.  This is her ninth loan with MFP.  It gives her peace of mind to belong to her communal bank as she feels comfortable working with responsible people.  With the amount requested she will buy clothing so that she can continue her work with her daughters.

loans.use: purchase clothing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elyn

texts.en:
29-year-old Elyn is a married woman from the town of Banga, in the province of South Cotabato. She has a 9-year-old child.

Elyn has been a farmer for more than 10 years. She helps her husband plant rice and corn at their farm. They usually sell their harvest to rice traders in the town and earn about 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month from farming.

Elyn has requested a loan to purchase 3 sacks of fertilizer, 7 sacks of rice seed, and 4 liters of insecticide. She hopes for the farming business to be stable. She also hopes for her child to finish college someday.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of fertilizer, 7 sacks of rice seed, and 4 liters of insecticide

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en:
The Sarwa Wiguna group is made up of 10 women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali.  The group is seeking a loan of Rp 15,000,000 and each member will receive Rp 1,500,000.  The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement the family income, and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising. This is their third loan with MUK.

Ni Ketut, is the head of the Sarwa Wiguna group.  Ni Ketut would like to help support her family with her pig raising business. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork.  With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to save for her children's college fees.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 46 years old and married with 4 children. The oldest child is 25 years old.

Emily is a farmer working in the town of Banga, in the province of South Cotabato. She and her husband own the land that they till together. They primarily grow rice crops for sale, and farming is their main source of income. Emily does her best to improve their business and earnings.

Emily has requested a loan to purchase 3 sacks of seed, 2 sacks of fertilizer, and 2 quarts of herbicide. She hopes for her business to be stable. She also wishes to live longer and have many grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of seed, 2 sacks of fertilizer, and 2 quarts of herbicide

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
40-year-old Emily is a married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 17 years old, while the youngest is 5.

Emily is a farmer who tills land in Banga, in the province of South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice to sell to the people in her community. Aside from farming, she also runs a sari-sari (convenience) store. She sells items such as noodles, canned goods, and soap.

Emily has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and more items to sell at the store. She hopes to have a successful business in the future. She also hopes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and more items to sell at her sari-sari store

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a 27-year-old married woman with 2 children, aged 4 and 3. She has been a farmer for 7 years now. Her husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their farm. They primarily grow rice crops for sale. Erna does her best to help at the farm and take care of their children.

Erna has applied for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. She hopes that this loan will help them achieve an abundant harvest. She also hopes to be able to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a responsible father who aims to continue sending his two children to college. He has owned and managed a rice field for almost 12 years now, earning an average net profit of only P15,000 every harvest season. He wants to increase his production in order to earn a higher income to cover up his children's financial needs and satisfy their basic necessities.

Due to financial difficulties, Victor has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and pesticides to pay for the labor costs of transplanting rice seedlings. He believes that the loan will help increase his rice production and income in the next harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for the labor costs of transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 56-year-old widow with three adult children. The family lives in a barrio and plants rice and vegetables. As rice is their main source of income, they want to increase their rice production to earn more income and satisfy their basic needs.

Due to financial constraints, Nena has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay for the labor costs of transplanting rice seedlings. She hopes that, during the upcoming harvest season, they will increase their crop yields and income so they can meet their basic necessities and save for future emergencies. She dreams of putting up a general store in the future as another source of income. She believes that if there is patience, there is progress.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for the labor costs of transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra is a determined mother and has the drive and attitude to succeed. She had been managing a sari-sari (variety) store for almost 15 years. Monthly income of P10,000 from the business is used for education of her children, to buy food and pay monthly electric bills. Her three children have finished college and hold degrees. They are employed locally and sometimes help her in times of financial shortage.

Petra is now 59 years old and she wants to earn consistent profits. She is requesting a loan of P40,000 to buy soap, shampoo, soft drinks, breads, eggs, cooking oil and vinegar to sell in her store. These commodities will help her increase the sales from her business and thus increase her earnings. 

She is older and she wants to earn more profits to save for future emergencies. She doesn't want to rely on her children because they have their own expenses.

In the future, Petra hopes to establish a larger sari-sari store and to keep buying more merchandise to stock in her store so that she can meet all her customers' demand for high-quality products.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, soft drinks, breads, eggs, cooking oil and vinegar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is a 48-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 26 years old. Eufemia's husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Eufemia has been engaged in farming for 10 years. She grows rice and sells her harvest at the market. Eufemia works hard to help provide for her family's needs and send her children to school. She has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo has owned and managed a rice farming business in the village for almost 30 years. He is 52 years old and a father of five. As a responsible father, he aimed to uplift their status of living and give their children a bright future. He endures problems and hardships of life to improve their source of living. 

Due to inadequate capital, he wants to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay the labor costs to transplant rice seedlings. He hopes that in this coming harvest season, he will reap a large volume of rice and earn a higher income to use for their food and clothing and save for future emergencies. 

He believes that his dream will be a reality for he has the strong faith and determination to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay labor costs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old. She lives in her own home with her life partner and three grown-up children. 

She has a wood lamination business that she attends to every day with dedication and kindness. Marilyn's business is located in a very rural area, where she is surrounded by many farms. In addition to this business, she has her own corn farm.

Marilyn is an exemplary woman who never tires of working despite her advanced age. She has decided to request a loan of PHP 7,000 so the business will become stronger. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of wood, glue and other needs for wood lamination. In this way, she hopes to improve her sales, her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials for her wood lamination business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 38 years old and lives in Bagong Silang with her husband and four grown-up children. She describes herself as a hard worker and one who wants to move her family ahead in life.

For about the last three years she has been working as a housekeeper, where she does all types of work.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of wood and other materials needed in wood lamination to allow her to do a better job.

By purchasing these items, she will improve the quality of her work and have more customers. Her dream is to have her own premises to set up her carpentry shop in a better way, and to help her family financially.

loans.use: to buy wood and glue for her wood lamination

loans.name: Wilmalyn

texts.en:
Wilmalyn was born in the village of Ilagan, where she still lives now. She is 33 years old. She was the third child in a large low-income family. From an early age she had to help her mother with household duties, which is why she completed only seven grades of primary school. At 22, she got married. Before long she had a son and later on two daughters. At that time, Wilmalyn’s husband started raising sheep, but this work was not particularly profitable. However, steady income was necessary to support the growing family. And this is how, lacking formal education and practical knowledge, Wilmalyn decided to go into retail.

Like many in a similar situation, Wilmalyn started by selling at the local market. With three children to feed and without a reliable source of income, working as a vendor was the only opportunity to have earnings. After much effort, her first year of entrepreneurship turned out to be successful. The starting capital amounted to 4,000 PHP and already after the first year of work, Wilmalyn was able to increase her investment.

After selling food items in their village for five years, Wilmalyn opened a small grocery store in front of their home. From then on, retail became a family business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, spices, bread and snack foods

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 44 years old and is a married woman with 2 children aged 17 and 18. She is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. Hilda plants rice and corn crops and sells her harvest at the market. She works hard to increase her harvest and earnings.

Hilda has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to earn better and be able to improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Victoriano is 46, married and has four school-age children. He aimed to improve their source of living to be able to continue sending his four children to school. He has been a farmer for almost 20 years planting rice and some vegetables in their village. Since it is the main source of their income, he aimed to increase his production to satisfy their basic necessities. 

Having inadequate capital, he wants to ask for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost for transplanting rice seedlings. He hopes that the loan will help him to increase his yields and income to satisfy all his family needs. He believes that a man who has strong faith and determination will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost for transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old and is a married woman with a 22-year-old child. She is a farmer who tills the land in the town of Banga, South Cotabato, where her family also lives. Her husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their farm. They grow rice and vegetables to sell. Jane does her best to help keep their crops healthy. She also runs their sari-sari (convenience) store business where she sells items like toothpaste, shampoo, spices and other various products.

Jane has requested a loan to purchase 3 sacks of fertilizers, 2 quarts of herbicides and buy more items to sell at her sari-sari store. Jane hopes to have a progressive life.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of fertilizers, 2 quarts of herbicides and buy more items to sell at her sari-sari store

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is a responsible father and has a great plan for his family. He is 53 years old and has 8 children. He aims to continue sending all of his children to school because it is the only valuable thing he can give to them. Rice farming is the main source of their income. Despite the hardships of life, he still has the strong determination to pursue the business.

Jaime wants to increase his production in order to increase his income. This will help to satisfy his family's basic needs and support the education of his children. He asks for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay labor cost in transplanting rice seedlings. He hopes to increase his yields this cropping season. He believes that patience and hard work will enable him to achieve these goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay labor cost in transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
In the picture, Analisa and her husband stand in front of their rented house.

Analisa is 32 years old and a mother of two daughters, Andriana (8) and Aira (2). In 2006, she started selling fried rice in Jalan Dewi Sartika, a village in Cawang. The business is running well. From the income, she can pay the rent for their house and help her husband to pay for Andriana's school fee. 

Now, she asks for 2,000,000 Indonesia Rupiah (IDR) to pay for t-shirts to resell in her village. She hopes she can send Aira to a preschool when Aira is 3 years old. In the future, she hopes to save her money to buy a little house.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts for resale.

loans.name: Ildefonso

texts.en:
Every farmer desires to increase crop production to earn a higher income to support his family's needs. Likewise, Ildefonso aims to increase his rice production and income to finance the education of his two children and satisfy their basic necessities. He has owned and managed a rice farming business for almost 10 years, earning a profit of only 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per cropping. 

He asks for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to sustain his rice production. He hopes that this loan will help a lot to improve his source of income. In the future, Ildefonso wants to open a sari-sari store (a convenience store) in his village for his wife to manage. He mentioned that he needs to work harder to make his dream in a reality.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for rice farming.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 42 and chose to be single for he wants to take care of his parents, who are now old and incapable. He has owned and managed a rice farming business in their village for almost 20 years, earning a net profit of only PHP 25,000 per cropping. 

He aims to increase his rice production and income so that he can meet all their needs and save for future emergencies. He wants to ask a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor costs for transplanting rice seedlings. He is hoping that this coming season will yield a plentiful harvest and he will earn more income. 

He believes that through patience and hard work he can achieve his goal some day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay labor cost in transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married. She has three children age 24, 20 and 9. 

She earns a living through farming. She and her husband till land in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She helps to grow rice and corn crops to sell to their community. Jocelyn also raises ducks and sells eggs at the market.

Jocelyn has requested a loan to purchase three sacks of duck feed, two sacks of fertilizers and two quarts of herbicides. 

She hopes to have a happy family and successful children.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of duck feed, two sacks of fertilizers and two quarts of herbicides.

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
Gusti Ayu lives in the village of Tegal Cangkring with her husband, who is a farmer, and two children, who are still in elementary school. At the age of 33, she works diligently to develop the piggery at her home in spite of work at the bridal salon that she also has. 

Gusti Ayu has been cooperating with Kiva Field Partner MUK, staying in touch until now, when she can get a loan of 2,000,000 Rupiah (IDR). She and the other members of the Daya Pertiwi loan group are trying to develop their businesses even though the price of pig feed is increasing. With the addition of the current loan Gusti Ayu is hoping to buy 10 piglets and make an additional 500,000 IDR per month. 

Future profits will be used to finance their children's education and to meet the needs of their families, especially groceries.

loans.use: to buy 10 piglets

loans.name: Mayang Sari Group

texts.en:
Sariasih is a mother of four children. Now she is 41 years old. In 1999, she opened a kiosk to sell rice and side dishes like tofu, tempeh, fish, and vegetables. This business has been running well until now. 

Because now is a fasting month, she will use part of her loan to pay for bananas, sugar, yams and coconut milk. These are the ingredients to make "kolak". Kolak is like an appetizer for the "iftar" (breaking the fast). It is sweet and the main ingredient is bananas. In the future, she wants to save her money and repair her house.

loans.use: to pay for bananas, sugar, yams, and coconut milk.

loans.name: Azhuu

texts.en:
Azhuu is 41 years old and lives with his three children and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His two eldest children are college students and the youngest one is a high school student. His wife manages a soft drink producing factory. 

Azhuu operates car repair center. He has been repairing cars since 2004. During the summer season, he hires two employees and pays them each 200,000 MNT as a salary. 

He is remodeling his garage and he is planning to upgrade and improve his equipment and technology. 

He is a hard-working and diligent man who says, "The demand of car repair service is less during the winter. It is almost impossible to repair cars outside during the winter season. Thus, I want to expand my garage and repair cars in winter." 

He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and new equipment for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase materials and new equipment.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, 39 years old, is a married woman with two adult children. She lives in the province of Isabela. 

She is a hard worker and owns a mini-grocery located in front of their house. When she started her business, it was a small store but it has grown and improved. Her mini-grocery is completely stocked. Her customers come to buy all types of products and different groceries such as sugar, rice, noodles, and other items that sell well. This helps her to continue improving and reinvesting in her business. 

On this occasion, her loan will be used to buy snack foods, drinks and spices that her customers have requested so that her business will be complete. She will also expand her business to make it larger and more comfortable for her customers. She is hoping that in the future her business improves so that her family can enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase snack food, drinks, candies and spices.

loans.name: Suiumkan's Group

texts.en:
Suiumkan is the treasurer of this group. She is 48 and married. Together with her husband she has raised two daughters, both of whom work in Russia. Suiumkan works as a cleaner at school; in order to earn additional money to meet the daily needs she sells potatoes on the market. She started this activity ten years ago with an initial investment of 500 soms and now her monthly profit is 2000 soms per month. This profit helped her to meet the family needs. Suiumkan applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds to purchase more potatoes in order to increase the commodity turnover of her business. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase stationery.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 49 years old and married with two grown-up children. Remedios operates a vegetable and fruit stall next to her house. From there, she can take care of her child and generate income as the same time. She plans to use this loan to invest in her stand by buying vegetables and fruits. She also wants to rebuild the stand to make it nicer and bigger.

Remedios is a asking a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy different vegetables that she can sell in her community. With part of the loan she plans to buy some wood; now that she has more demand, she will need to invest more in her business. She will use the profits to expand the business and get her own house that she can live in comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, eggplant, and squash for her store.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married and 42 years old, with three children whom she sends to school. Her husband is a farmer who plants and harvests rice. Gemma runs a sari-sari store (convenience store) in which she sells products like coffee, sugar, breads, and cheese curls.

Gemma requests a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy vegetables such as string beans, eggplant, and bitter gourd for additional products to sell in her village.

Gemma's goal is to gain additional income from her business in order to continue sending her children to school through college. She hopes that the loan could help her attain this goal and see her children wearing professionals' uniforms someday.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as string beans, eggplant, and bitter gourd for additional products to sell in her village.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 30 years old and married with two children to educate. Despite her poverty, she never loses hope and still strives hard to provide sustenance for her family. She manages her small sari-sari (variety) store in front of her house.

According to her, minimal profits earned were not enough to sufficiently to meet all of her family's needs due to the expensive cost of commodities. Felipa finds it difficult to budget her income for family's daily expenses. She needs to keep making better sales to earn more profits.

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy breads, eggs, soap, shampoo, and toothpaste to sell in her store. Having additional products to offer would increase the capacity of sales from her business.

In the future, Felipa would like to continue selling more products to generate more earnings. She also wants to educate her children and have a degree someday.

loans.use: to buy breads, eggs, soap, shampoo, and toothpaste to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nanzaddorj

texts.en:
Nanzaddorj is 51 years old and lives with his two children and wife in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Govisumber province of Mongolia. His wife is retired and taking care of the business. 

Nanzaddorj started his business activity in 2007. He operates a grocery trading business. He successfully expanded his business by selling foods as well as also clothes at his shop. He also works as a security guard at the People's party building. During the evening, he is a taxi-driver. Because his shop is located right next to the high school #1, he can sell foods and retail products easily to the market.
