He is planning to expand his business activity and he is a loyal customer of Xas Bank. He is a diligent man who says "I want to expand my business activity and increase my family income." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to open a new vegetable counter.

loans.use: to open a vegetable counter.

loans.name: Nurhayati's Group

texts.en:
NurhayA. is 26 years old. In 2010 she started to sell "Gamis" clothes on credit. "Gamis" are Moslem clothes. From this business she can help her family's financial situation.

 Now, she will use a part of her loan to add more "Gamis" clothes with more variation. She believes that in this fasting month, her sales will increase. In the future she wants to expand her business by having her own kiosk, because now she only sells from her house.

loans.use: to buy "Gamis" clothes.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 36 and married to Army. Together, with her husband, she is bringing up three children. The first son is at school and the other two are preschool age. 

Olivia is a rolling vendor in the community. She stocks a variety of vegetables that she can sell door to door to the people of the community. Olivia is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy different vegetables such as cabbage, tomatoes, and beans. She has been doing this kind of work for one year. She is well known in the community as a hardworking and very patience person.

In the future, she wants to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beans, cabbages, tomatoes and squash for her rolling vendor.

loans.name: Elmar

texts.en:
Elmar believes that, "A quitter never wins and a winner never quits"; it is his guiding principle in life. Despite hardships and problems he still has the strong faith and determination to survive. He is 30 years old, married and has two infant children. As a father, he is responsible to provide for all of his family's needs in terms of financial, emotional and spiritual requirements. Rice farming is one of the major sources of their income. Hence, he wants to increase his productions and income to meet their basic necessities and to save for the future of their children. 

Due to financial difficulty, he wants to ask for an additional capital of PHP20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain their rice production. He believes that the loan will help a lot to increase their production. He mentioned that only hard work can enable him to make his business fruitful and profitable. He hopes that, in the future, he will achieve all his business goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase groceries such as canned goods, assorted biscuits, shampoo, soft drinks and sugar for her retail shop business.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Uranchimeg is 55 years old and lives with her daughter and husband in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is retired and stays at home and her daughter is currently unemployed. 

Uranchimeg started her business in 1999 by selling sunglasses at the Narantuul market during the spring, summer and fall seasons and window protecting materials in winter. She purchases sunglasses from the wholesalers and sold the sunglasses by retail to customers. Her total business turnover capital is about 1,000,000 MNT and her daily income is between 30,000 MNT to 40,000 MNT. The cost of goods is 60% of the income. She sells a wide range of stylish sunglasses for different ages and tastes. She has already collected much business experience in her field. She is planning to pass down her business to her daughter. Her family supports this family business. She mentioned that she spends lot of money on transportation because her home is located very far from the Narantuul market. 

Uranchimeg is a diligent and hard-working woman who says "I want to help my son, who is living separately, to buy a minivan so that I do not have to worry about his life and business." She is requesting a 1,250,000 MNT loan to buy mini-van for her son, who rents that car for the transportation business, and she will spend the rest of money on increasing her turnover capital.

loans.use: to buy a mini-van for her son.

loans.name: Asri Lestari Group

texts.en:
Ni Nyoman is 33 years old and lives in Melaya, West Bali.  She is married and has one child, aged 5.   Her husband works as a travelling salesman.  Though Ni Nyoman often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income.  She has been raising pigs for five years.  

Ni Nyoman is the head of the AS. Lestari group, which is made up of  eight neighbors from the same village.  This is the group’s second loan with MUK.  With the Rp.1.500.000 that Ni Nyoman receives, she will purchase three piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs.  With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to improve her house.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 31-year-old married woman with three children age 10, 9 and 7. Judith's husband works as a farmer.

Judith sells duck eggs to her community. She has been running this business for nine years now. She sometimes helps her husband grow rice crops at their farm.

Judith has requested a loan to purchase 200 ducks and seven sacks of feed. This loan will help Judith have more duck eggs to sell. In the future, Judith hopes to have a stable business and for her children to finish their studies and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase 200 ducks and seven sacks of feed.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 30 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for the financial and basic needs of her family. 

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the village of San Leonardo Aglipay and requested a PHP 10,000 loan to purchase additional items such as soft drinks, biscuits, candies, ingredients and sugar.

She has been running the sari-sari store for three years. According to her, she is able to earn about PHP 1,000 from her business and she uses this amount for her children's allowances and their daily needs. Marites hopes that she can increase her income through her patience and by using her income to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, candies, ingredients and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Upol's Group

texts.en:
Upol is a member of this group. She is 60 and married to a driver. She has raised two daughters and two sons. The first son is in the military; the second is a cutter. The older daughter works as a teacher and the younger daughter is a housewife. 

Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 6000 KGS, Upol started to provide sewing services. She sews Kyrgyz national cloth, blankets and pillows. With the profits gained from this activity she purchased cattle for breeding. 

Upol applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase hay for cattle. In the future she wants to increase the number of cattle and with the profits gained from the business, she plans to purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay for cattle.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old, married to a carpenter and lives in Isabela. She has three children. 

For two years, Evelyn has owned a sari-sari store (mini store) located in front of their house. Evelyn believes that she needs to work hard and well and be patient in all aspects of life.

She is asking a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy snack foods, drinks, spices and noodles for her mini store. She hopes that her store expands so that her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase snack food, drinks, spices and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Robingah

texts.en:
Robingah is 59 years old. She has a son, Harry, 29, and a daughter, Wuri, 20. 

She started her business selling Yakult, a fermented milk drink, in 2002. Her selling area is Kramat Jati, a district in Cawang. She has a lot of customers. With the income, she can send her children to university and buy electronic goods. 

Now she is asking 3,000,000 Indonesian Rupiahs to pay for a semester's tuition fee for her daughter, Wuri. Robingah hopes her daughter can finish her college and in the future, Robingah can have her own kiosk to sell groceries.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s furniture-making business. He is very experienced in his business and prepares beautifully designed furniture. With the loan, he will buy wood, nails and furniture polish for preparing good quality furniture with good designs that will allow him to complete the customer orders and make more profits. 

Nasreen is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her elder son operates a local food restaurant while two other children are studying. Her youngest daughter is six years old and hasn’t started her education. 

Nasreen is a housewife as well as a working lady. In her spare time she sews clothes for her neighboring customers to supplement the income of her family. She is hopeful that after the loan investment, her husband’s business will grow and will increase his income and that will allow her to send her younger daughter to school in near future.

loans.use: To buy required items for furniture making business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 55 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is farmer and her partner in managing her business. To make a living, Eufemia sells canned goods, cooking oil, snack foods, and spices in her sari-sari (general) store in their village. She has been in this business for almost five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month. Her income depends on the availability of the products she sells.

Eufemia is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of sugar, coffee, milk, cooking oil, and  spices to satisfy the needs of her costumers. She desires to develop her business and grow as entrepreneur, mother, and borrower.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of sugar, coffee, milk, cooking oil, and  spices .

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en:
Baasanjav is 56 years old and lives with his four children and wife in a ger (a traditional Mongolian housing tent) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His four children are high school students and his wife is currently unemployed. Baasanjav started to trade spare car parts at the local market in 2002. Before this he used to trade cars with other partners. Now, he transports spare parts from the city of Ulaanbaatar and the Mongolia western border to sell them in his hometown. 

In addition to his main business, he also trades wood frames of bow and arrow and wooden home furniture. His daily income is between 60,000 MNT to 120,000 MNT and he is planning to expand his business activities. He is a diligent man who is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts from Ulaanbaatar city.

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Being a parent means taking on the responsibility to provide for all of the family's financial and emotional needs. Most of this responsibility is to send children to school to give them the best education for the future. Likewise, Marcelina and her husband aim to continue sending their three children to school to give them a bright future. But due to financial difficulties, they need to improve their source of income to satisfy their daily basic needs and support the education of their children.

In this regard, Marcelina wants to request an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain their rice farming business. She believes that the loan will help them to increase their production and income this coming harvest season. She hopes that in the future, their business will improve and all of their children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain rice production

loans.name: Kanatbek's Group

texts.en:
Kanatbek, 49, is a member of this group. He earns money by transporting passengers from Balykchi to Bishkek and his wife sells fish in the market. Their children are students who study in Bishkek. Kanatbek started to provide transportation services three years ago. This business helped to improve their family’s living conditions. He applied for this loan because he needs additional funds to purchase auto parts. In the future Kanatbek wishes to purchase a big house for his family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Sungai Bambu 2 Group

texts.en:
In the picture, Leni is wearing a pink T-shirt. She is 32 years old and she has three children. She has been working in a catering company for two months. With this, she can help her family financially. 

Now she wants to use her share of the loan to pay her children's school fees. She wants her children have a better education than her, and that's why she want to send her children through university.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Saira's Group

texts.en:
Saira is the leader of this group. She is 63 years old and married to a retiree. Together with her husband, Saira breeds cattle. They started this business 35 years ago and, with the profits gained from reselling cattle, Saira was able to pay for her children’s education. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase two tons of coal for the winter season. In the future Saira wishes to build a new house for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two tons of coal for the winter season

loans.name: Husna's Group

texts.en:
Husna is very responsible person in nature. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well and also handles her bed-sheets selling business. Earlier, she was involved in an embroidery business but she has found this other business more profitable and she started selling the bed-sheets with her husband. Now, she has good number of business contacts and provides them with good quality bed-sheets.  

Her husband puts the bed-sheets on his cycle and visits different streets of the city to sell them. 

Husna has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will buy bed-sheets in larger quantity and of different varieties to increase his sales and profits. He is very experienced in his business and Husna is hopeful that an investment will bring positive financial changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy bed-sheets to sell.

loans.name: Turdububu's Group

texts.en:
Turdububu is the leader of this group. She is 74 years old and unfortunately she is a widow. With an initial investment of 5,000 soms three years ago, Turdububu started to breed livestock with the help of her son. She resells livestock at a higher price after fattening them, and in this way she earns about 1,500 soms per month. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase hay to feed her livestock. In the future she wants to give a good education to her grandchildren. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay for feeding livestock

loans.name: Oltinoi's Group

texts.en:
Oltinoi, who leads this loan group, is 41 years old, married to a driver and has three sons. Her oldest son attends a university while the other two study in secondary school. Eight years ago, she took a 2,000 soms investment and began growing tobacco on 0.8 hectares of land which she owns. She now earns about 3,000 soms a month by selling portions of her farm's output, and has used the profits to repair her house. She plans to use her portion of this group loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. Her goal is to continue improving her family's living conditions. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and watch a video about our orgnization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for growing tobacco

loans.name: Nataliya's Group

texts.en:
Nataliya is the leader of this group. She is 39 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. Her husband went to work in Russia. She works in the Combine of Kadamjai and receives a monthly salaryof 5600 soms. She is requesting a loan because she needs additional funds to purchase building materials. Nataliya plans to start repairing her house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to repair the house.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a 31-year-old married woman with two young children. She is engaged in farming. She and her husband own the land that they till together. They grow rice and corn crops to sell. Leah does her best to help in their business and take care of their children.

Leah is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a stable business that will sustain her family and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Andaza's Group

texts.en:
Andaza is the treasurer of this group. She is 36 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she brings up a daughter and a son, both of whom study at school. Andaza works as a nurse in the hospital and her husband is engaged in cultivating fruits and vegetables. At the moment the family grows 0.14 hectares of corn.  With money received from the loan Andaza wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for her husband's farm. In the future the family wishes to open an auto repair center. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Grace has  a poultry farm, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase chicken for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Grace hopes to expand her business.   Grace is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken for resale.

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en:
Faridah,s group is comprised of four hard working women. Faridah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is single and has 1 child.  Her child is currently in school.  Faridah has had a business of selling clothes for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Faridah hopes to generate greater profits.  In the future, Faridah hopes to expand her business.   Faridah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is engaged in agriculture. He cultivates land and keeps an orchard. Ruben would like to improve his land and orchard and get more harvest. This requires some financial investments. With the requested loan Ruben plans to purchase carrot seeds and fertilizer. 

With the loan's help Ruben will develop his agriculture and increase his income. Ruben will be able to ensure a sustainable future for his family. Ruben lives together with his wife. Their son is in the army at present.

loans.use: to pay for carrot seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is married and has 1 child.  Sophia has a business of a boutique that sells clothes, which she has had for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Sophia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sophia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Sophia hopes to expand her business.  Sophia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Paskali

texts.en: Paskali is a forty two year old married man with eight children. He owns a house in Kasese,Uganda. He has been dealing in clothes for four years.  Initially Paskali sold secondhand clothes but he now sells new clothes. His challenge is high commodity prices and his vision is a big boutique plus educating children. Paskali needs the loan  to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of east Uganda. She is single, has no children and has for the last year earned a living by running a poultry farm.         

To help expand her business, Evelyn is applying for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She plans to use the loan to increase her profits by buying chickens to raise and sell. She is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en: Phiona is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of central Uganda.  She is single, has no children and has earned a living for the last three years by running a small retail shop where she sells soap and salt. To help expand her business, improve her life and buy more food for her family, Phiona has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more items to sell to her customers.  Phiona is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her get a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell to her customers such as salt and soap.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 45 years old, married and has for the last 10 years earned a living by running a poultry farm in Shanzu, Mombasa. She has been a KADET client for some time now and is applying for her second loan, which she will use to buy more chicks and feed for them to eat. She plans to to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. Her goal is to become a very successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed for them to eat.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen supports her family financially by selling buffalo milk. She gets the milk from her buffalo and sells to her community clients to generate income for her family. Besides her work, she also manages her household responsibilities very well. 

Her husband is a fruit vendor. He offers his customers fresh seasonal fruits for reasonable rates. Parveen is the mother of seven children. Four of them study while the others stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. With the loan, her husband will buy fresh seasonal fruits in bulk to be able to sell more to his customers and earn better profits. 

Parveen hopes that this investment will be a profitable one for her husband's business and that it will improve the living standard of her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Parveen.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald, 48, is married but separated with 4 children. He lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte where he has had an internet business for 10 years. Each month, he earns approximately PHP10000. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase computer parts for his business. Ronald became a member of PMPC this year, 2011. In the future, Ronald hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase computer parts for his internet business

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is 36 years old and married with two children aged 10 and 14. She is engaged in rice farming and hog-raising. Her husband mainly manages their rice farm and she also helps grow rice crops when she can. Mildred spends her time raising pigs and taking care of their children. She does her best to help augment their income and send their children to school. Mildred has requested a loan to purchase 4 sacks of feed and 3 sacks of vitamins for her pigs. She is hoping for her family's living situation to improve.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of feed and 3 sacks of vitamins

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en: Warlita has been a widow for almost 20 years. It is a big responsibility to be the head of the family. She is engage in her sari-sari store where she sells snack foods, batteries, candies and biscuits. Warlita said that it is not easy to be the breadwinner of the family but is doing her best to feed her children. She is happy because her grown-up children now have their own families. Warlita is getting older and wants to maintain and develop her business for a continued source of income. She decided to request a loan of P15,000 to purchase soft drinks, beer, vinegar and soy sauce to sell. She will use the loan wisely for the growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beer, vinegar and soy sauce to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 35 years old married with 7 children aged between two and 14 who lives in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. He has been in the produce business for five years, starting with capital of 600,000 and now has 2,000,000 UGX as his working capital. His hardship is price flactuation and his dream is owning a big food store. Francis needs the loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: To buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Assad

texts.en: Assad is a 45-year-old married man and father of three children. He has worked in transportation since 1997 and is well known in the region because of his good reputation and customer service. His car is new and clean because he takes good care of it to continue attracting new customers. Assad is a hard worker who seeks the best to his family, providing them with good and healthy living, and giving them the best education possible. To keep his car healthy and good looking, Assad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva to do the necessary maintenance. He works hard on pleasing his customers to make sure they stay loyal to him. It is his only way to earn a living and he fights to improve it and hopes to open a transportation company in the future.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his car

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a determined and focused 43-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with six children, three of whom are in school. For the last two years, she has been running a cafeteria so as to make a living and meet the needs of her family. She supplements income from this venture with the earnings she makes from selling charcoal and the rent that she collects. Previously, she used to run a retail shop. She wants, in the next 5 years, to have grown her business into a restaurant. Grace's dream is to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as meat, rice, beans, maize flour, maize and sugar. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has been able to learn business management skills.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as meat, rice, beans, maize flour, maize and sugar to make food for her cafe

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is hardworking 39-year-old business man. He is married and blessed with three children who are in school. For the last three years, he has been operating a general shop so as to make ends meet. Previously, he was employed.

He wants in the next five years to have converted his business into a wholesale one. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy two bags of sugar and a bag of rice. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now financially literate.

loans.use: To buy two bags of sugar and a bag of rice

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 62 years old and is a married woman with 10 children. She and her husband are both farmers. At her age, Nelita is still strong enough to work at the farm. She grows rice crops and sells her harvest at the market. Nelita does her best to help provide for her family's needs. 

Nelita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Mercedes Jona

texts.en:
Mercedes Jona is 32 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sardines, groceries, etc.

Mercedes Jona has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from ready-to-wear.

Mercedes Jona aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Kristine works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring, food vending, and networking of Avon products. Kristine is borrowing 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Kristine has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Narlina

texts.en:
Narlina is 39 years old and married. She is living happily with her husband and two children. Narlina's husband is a farmer and her children are going to school at the elementary and high school level. Narlina and her husband have no other wish for their children than to finish their studies and become professionals someday.

Narlina is engaged in a sari-sari store business where she sells canned goods, powdered juice, candies and biscuits. Narlina is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock like spices, vinegar, soy sauce and drinks to sell in their village. She hopes that through the loan, Narlina could get a higher income from the business and be able to sustain the allowances of her children through college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like spices, vinegar, soy sauce and drinks to sell in their village.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Josephine has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a loan for 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Josephine has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jessebel

texts.en:
Jessebel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried shrimps and fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Jessebel earns additional income from fermented shrimps. She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy shrimps and fish to sell.

Jessebel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shrimps and fish to sell

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is 43 years old, married and a father of three children. Lucas is a poultry farmer in Kilifi. His business has been in operation for the last two years and it has been a success. 

This marks his second borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. With this loan, Lucas plans to expand his business by purchasing more chicks and chicken feed. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 65 years old and married with five children. She does poultry farming to earn a living for her family. She has employed one person in her business. She has 11 years of experience in her business. She also owns rental houses to earn extra income for her family.  Previously, she used to sell second-hand clothes.

Annah hopes to become a major supplier of poultry products.  She has requested 70,000 Kenya shillings to build more rental houses.

loans.use: To build more rental houses

loans.name: Pahe

texts.en:
Pahe is 45 years old, married, and a mother of four children.  Pahe sells dried fish in Mariakani. Her business has been in operation for the last thirteen years.

Pahe, as a KADET LTD client, is requesting her fourth loan to finance her business.  With this loan, she plans to expand her business by purchasing more fish for reselling. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand her business further. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Torees Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her late 20's, is married, with three children.  Two of them go to school.  She has been running a business as a food vendor for two years now.  She works from 10 a.m. to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She wants to use it to increase her food stock.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Torees", which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase food stock.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is 55 years old. She is married and blessed with 5 children. For the last 13 years, she has been operating a retail shop to make a living. She makes an extra shilling by selling fruits. She wants in the next 5 years to have transformed her business into a wholesale one. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy meat, rice, beans, maize flour, maize and sugar. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has been able to acquire a vehicle to distribute fruits.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, sugar, rice and maize flour

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha de 49 años de edad, viuda, tiene 3 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora que desde muy joven viene realizando labores agrícolas,  las cuales le enseñaron sus padres. Hace un año atrás dejo este oficio para dedicarse al cuidado de niños en un wawa wasi (guardería) de su comunidad, este trabajo pertenece a un programa del gobierno que brinda atención a personas que tienen bebes y no pueden laborar normalmente porque no tienen quien atienda a sus pequeños  hijos. Así, Martha presta sus servicios en el cuidado de bebes, porque tiene mucha paciencia y dedicación a ellos. Se siente feliz realizando este trabajo que a cambio le permite alcanzar un sueldo para poder solventar los gastos de la casa. En un futuro próximo ella desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que ella ratifica su compromiso el de cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará materiales educativos para enseñarles a los niños que cuida en su guardería.
texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old and widowed. She has 3 children, and they live in their own house located in the district of Pichari. Martha is a very hard-working woman who has done agricultural work since she was very young; she learned this work from her parents. One year ago, she left this profession to dedicate herself to caring for children in a "wawa wasi" (child care center) in her community. This work is part of a government program which provides care for the benefit of people who have babies and cannot normally work because they do not have anyone to care for their small children. Thus, Martha provides her services caring for babies, because she is very patient and dedicated to them. She feels happy doing this work, which in turn allows her to earn a salary so she can cover her household expenses. In the near future, she would like to open a grocery store. This is her second loan with  MFP, and Martha once again pledges to make her payments on time. 

This is her second loan, and she stands by her commitment to make her payments on time. Martha is happy to belong to her communal bank, because all of the members are punctual. With the 1,500 Peruvian new soles, she will buy materials to help care for children in the child care center.

loans.use: to buy materials for the child care center.

loans.name: Remigio

texts.en:
Remigio is 61 years old and is a married man with 10 children. He has been a farmer for 32 years. Remigio grows rice crops and sells his harvest to rice traders. He works hard to support his family financially.

Remigio has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes for this loan to help him achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is 29 years old.  He is married, and a father of four children. Arnold runs a stationery shop in Mariakani.  His business has been in operation for the last three years and it has been a success. 

This marks his second loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. With this loan, Arnold plans to expand his business by adding more stock of stationery. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to open another business.

loans.use: adding more stock of stationery

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more materials for her tailoring business.

Conception has been in this business for 23 years. Conception earns additional income from food vending, buying and selling of charcoal, and fish vending.

Conception has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Nafees' Group

texts.en:
Nafees is married and her husband is an electrician by profession.  He offers electrical repair services to his customers. He produces quality work for them, which enable him to earn a good income for his family. Nafees is also a very supportive lady in nature. She supports her husband by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and earns good profits every month from her sewing work. She is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her eldest son is 29 years old and has a private job while her elder daughter is involved in sewing work. Her youngest daughter is nine years old and studying in class 3rd.
 
Nafees has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine, which will help her make beautiful looking clothes in a shorter period of time and earn better profits. She has been operating her business for many years and is very confident about the positive financial growth of it after the loan investment. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old and married with four children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan for 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Alicia has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and rice retailing.

Alicia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Banana Maju Group

texts.en: Suhaibah is 33 years old. She has 2 daughters and 1 son. In 2007 she opened a beauty salon. Until now she has had a lot of customers. She will use part of her loan to buy salon equipment such as hair straighteners and a creambath steamer. She hopes she can expand her salon and open a branch. For her children's education, she hopes her first child, her daughter Siti (15), can go to university after she finishes high school.

loans.use: to pay for hair straighteners and a creambath steamer.

loans.name: Ana Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ana Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending, fish vending, and ready-to-wear clothing. Ana Fe is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stocks of bananas to sell.

Ana Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: April

texts.en:
April is 29 years old and married with two children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice. April works hard to provide for her family. 

April has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sattar

texts.en:
Sattar has owned a workshop since 2008 where he repairs generators and motorcycles. He has good experience in this field and a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

Sattar decided to apply for a $1500 loan in order to make a sliding door, add more inventory, and pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

Sattar is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married and has two children.

loans.use: to make a sliding door, add more inventory, and pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: Philipina

texts.en:
Philipina is 45 years old, married, and a mother of four children. Philipina runs a retail shop in Mtwapa, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last 10 years. 

She has been a KADET client and this marks her second loan to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to expand her business by purchasing more flour and sugar and to use the remaining amount to renovate her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand her business further. Her dream is to own a mini-shop.

loans.use: to purchase more flour and sugar and to renovate her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married, with three grown up children.   She is 47 years old and her spouse is a farmer.  Flora's shop sells many kinds of products, such as shampoo, toothbrushes, noodles, confectioneries and soft drinks.  She also sells vegetables and fruits. She started this business five years ago, and it provides the main source of income for her family.

Flora is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of basic goods, such as snack foods and beverages, to stock her store. She hopes that will enable her to increase the turnover of her business and help her to improve her living conditions and set aside some savings.

loans.use: to purchase milk, coffee, noodles and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Ma. Catherine

texts.en: Ma. Catherine is married and has a coffee shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now. Ma. Catherine requested a 16,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of coffee to sell. Ma. Catherine works hard to support her family. In the future, Ma. Catherine would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of coffee

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda is 53 years old and married with two children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from tricycle transport. Amanda works hard to provide for her family. 

Amanda has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing more cloth materials and shoes

loans.name: Abdel Ilah

texts.en:
Abdel Ilah has been an owner of a food market since 2010, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

Abdel Ilah decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his market and to buy a showcase. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

This borrower is from Iraq. He is 59 years old, married and has four children.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his market and to buy a showcase.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 52 years old and married. He is a father of four children and lives in Bamburi. Edward operates a swimming pool business for renting and also offers swimming training in Mombasa. He has been in this business for 11 years.  The swimming facility is in demand and is doing well.

Edward has been a KADET client and this marks his second loan to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase cleaning equipment and chemicals for his pool.  He hopes to make money and the anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan, and for his upkeep.  Edward’s dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: purchase cleaning equipment and chemicals for his pool

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona works hard to support her family. Chona is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Chona requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her food production business. Chona has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Chona would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 47 years old and has a general store set up in her home. She has operated this business for three years.  She offers a range of everyday products, including basic necessities and groceries, to her neighbors and other customers from the area. The business is very well received, thanks to the good quality of the products she offers and the excellent service she provides. With the income she obtains from this activity, she helps support her family economically. The loan she is requesting is to buy basic grains, detergents, bread, canned goods, milk, coffee and noodles.

loans.use: to buy milk, spices, drinks, noodles and rice

loans.name: Enim 5 Group

texts.en: Wisje is 45 years old. She is still single. In the picture she is the one who wears glasses. Her business is making accessories and souvenirs for weddings and birthdays. Part of her loan is to pay for tools to make souvenirs. Now she sells souvenirs in her house. In the future she wants to have an accessories store in central Jakarta and she also wants to build a business in cooperation with her nephew.

loans.use: to pay for tools to make souvenirs

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en:
Mourine is a 24 year-old business-lady.  She sells clothes to earn a living for her family.  She has employed one person to assist her in her business.  She has been in the business for six years.  She has been able to grow her business with the financial support from Faulu Kenya.  
Mourine dreams of expanding her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 36 years old and married with 2 children.

Margie works hard to provide for her family. She runs ambulant (mobile) vending of grocery items in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Margie has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ambulant vending of grocery items for 9 years.

Margie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, oranges, avocados, onions, cabbage and garlic

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 25-year-old married woman with two young children. She has been a farmer for five years. Her husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their rice farm. Ruth does her best to keep their rice crops healthy and the farm free of weeds. Ruth also makes sure her children are healthy.

Ruth is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides. She hopes to be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Ma. Celina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Ma. Celina works hard to support her family.

She has a lechon (roasted pig) vending business in the Philippines. She also earns income from the buying and selling of dressed chicken. Ma. Celina is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional pigs for her lechon vending business.

Ma. Celina has been sustaining her business activities through her past sixteen loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs for her business.

loans.name: Akil

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has three children. Akil is a butcher; he opened his own store in 2007. He has good experience with all kinds of meat. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

Akil decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to renovate and fix his store’s walls. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his store’s walls.

loans.name: Patriciah

texts.en: Patriciah is 29 years old and a single mother of a six-year-old. She runs a quarrying business to earn a living.  She is able to provide a good education for her child with the income she gets from her business. She has two years of experience in operating her business and she has employed two people. Patriciah hopes to expand her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a drilling machine.

loans.use: To buy a drilling machine

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 54 years old and married with two children. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for ten years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Nelly works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and paid off seventeen loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Nelly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 42 years old and married with three children. Rosalie has been raising pigs in the Philippines for ten years. She also earns additional income by raising other livestock.

Rosalie is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly towards attaining her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is an ambitious 29 year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with a three year-old child who is in school. For the last 5 years, he has been engaged in the taxi business to make a living. He supplements his income from the earnings he makes from dairy farming. He wants, in the next 5 years, to own his own taxi company. His dream is to be financially stable. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorcycle to start a new business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 52-year-old married man, father of four children. Mohamad works in car maintenance. He specializes in fixing car radiators. He's an expert in his field, and is recommended by most of his clients because of the good quality of his work.

Mohamad is a hard worker, and in order to cover most of his family's expenses he has started a new business, transporting students from/to school on a school bus. It's a good job that provides him with an acceptable income.  That's why he is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua, the Kiva partner, in order to do the necessary maintenance to his bus before the school year starts.

Mohamad said that he wants his students to be relaxed, and he will work hard on improving this part of his business in future. For now he will fix the bus and its color, while next time he hopes to invest in a bigger bus. He also wants to expand both businesses to fulfill all his family's needs. This is his first experience with A. Majmoua, and he hopes it's going to be a good investment for future plans.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his bus

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a 66-year-old widow with three children. She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for eight years. She also earns an income from a food and coffee shop.

Fely works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and paid off thirteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase additional inventory to sell in her store.

Fely aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell in her store.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a competitive and aggressive 27 year-old. She is single. Since the year 2010, she has been operating a retail shop and supplying sweets. She wants in the next 5 years to be a wholesaler dealing with sweets. She is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy polythene bags and sweets. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is now able to keep records about her business.

loans.use: To buy polythene bags and sweets

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Despite being a widow, Mercedes has the strong determination to improve her standard of living to satisfy her family's basic necessities and save for future emergencies. She is now 48 years old and has three adult children. They live in a village, planting and harvesting rice for sale and raising livestock.  

Due to the high cost of commodities, Mercedes wants to ask for additional capital of P20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides in order to increase their rice crop yields. 

In the future, Mercedes plans to improve all of their sources of income so that she can support the education of her grand children. She believes that through patience and hard work, she will be able to achieve her goals someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides to sustain rice production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea leaves

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 57-year-old married woman with six children. The oldest child is 34 years old and the youngest is 17.

Ruth and her husband are both farmers. They own the land that they till to plant rice and cassava. According to Ruth, they sell their harvest at her town's market. With their income from farming, they are able to buy their daily needs and send their youngest child to school.

Ruth is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan has been an owner of a shop since 2007, selling new and used spare parts for cars. He is from Iraq. Hasan is 44 years old, married and has two children. He has more than seven years' experience in his field. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

Hasan decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to renovate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 57 years old. She is married and has eight children.

Judith works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Judith has borrowed and paid fifteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 8 years, and she also earns income from farming sugarcane.

Judith aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 41 years old and married with five children. She has been raising pigs for ten years in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Aileen is requesting a loan of 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aileen is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock to his shop like metal rods, poles, welding machine etc.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 29 years old and married to Linet. They are blessed with two children. He has been running his barber shop for the past six years, making a monthly profit of KES 10,000. He has been loaned KES 40,000, which he plans to use to purchase new shaving machines and renovate his business premise.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to educate his children. In the near future, he hopes to build his own residential house.

loans.use: to purchase new shaving machines and renovate his business premise

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 42 years old and married with two children aged 19 and 13. She is engaged in farming and plants rice and corn crops to sell. Shirley works hard to keep her crops healthy. She said she wants to be able to sell quality produce to the people in her community.

Shirley is in need of fertilizers and other farm inputs. She has requested a loan because she does not have the capacity to buy the farm inputs she needs right now. Shirley hopes for this loan to help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 48 years old and married to Paul. They are blessed with one child. Rose has been running her business for the past year, making a monthly profit of KES 62,400. She has been loaned KES 30,000, which she plans to use to purchase more clothing for her shop.

With the anticipated profit made, she plans to open another branch in Kitengela and in Mlolongo. In the near future, she hopes to be a big supplier of the curtains and cushions that she makes.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for her shop

loans.name: Rosine

texts.en:
Rosine is a hardworking entrepreneur who for the past twelve years has had a food vending business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from buying and selling lechon (roast suckling pig).

Rosine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Rosine dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Mcharuko Group

texts.en:
Salum, who is in his early 30s, is married with one child who goes to school. He also takes care of his mother. He has been a tailor for 10 years now. He works from 7 a.m to 6 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy more materials and made more dresses to sell. He also bought fabrics to sell and has paid his loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy more materials to make more dresses. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mcharuko" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more materials to make more dresses

loans.name: Frankson

texts.en:
Frankson is 37 years old and married to Nancy. They are blessed with two children who are between 15 and 7 years old. He has been hiring and selling timber for the past six years, making a monthly profit of KES 40,000. He has been loaned KES 70,000, which he plans to use to purchase more timber for sale.

With the anticipated profit made from the business, he plans to establish a timber yard. In the near future, he hopes to transport timber from Tanzania.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 39 years old She is married and has four children ages 22, 20, 13 and 3 years old. Rosita established a retail business 19 years ago. Aside from the store, she sells charcoal in the nearby town. Rosita is well known as a very loving and supportive mother of four children.

Rosita is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy snack foods, drinks, spices and other daily needs. Rosita dreams that someday she can renovate their house to be comfortable and she can save money for her children to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cereals, coffee, milk and drinks for her store

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married and has bought and sold used clothing in the Philippines for twelve years now.

Gina works hard to support her family. She is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her brother’s mobile phones business. With the loan, he will buy new models of mobile phones and different mobile accessories to put to his shop to sell.
 
Parveen is 44 years old and a midwife by profession. She is unmarried and lives with her brother. She didn’t want to become a burden on her brother. That's why she started working as a midwife a few years ago. Now she is well known in her area for her services and manages her financial expenses with her earnings. 

Parveen is very confident that after investing the loan into her brother’s business, he will be able to attract more clients and make more sales.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones & mobile accessories

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 38 years old and married to Alice. They are blessed with two children between six and four years old. He has been running a timber yard for the past three years, making a monthly profit of KES 50,000. He has been loaned KES 20,000, which he plans to use to add more stock of timber to sell. With the anticipated profit made from the business, he plans to transport more timber from Tanzania and sell here in kenya.

loans.use: to purchase more timber  to sell
